Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begins the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O children, since I have fulfilled this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, by its completion in it, and by its expositions and declarations, it has appeared to me that you will complete that with this treatise which is a part of surgery through manual operation.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation through manual technique is proscribed in our realm and in our times deprived of all, while greatly endangering the science of it, and its procedures are hindered; and nothing remains of it but some slight descriptions in the books of the Ancients which they have altered and led to those errors and misconceptions whereby the understanding of it is clouded and its power and art prolonged.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it has seemed to me that you enliven that through the arrangement of this treatise according to its second way of exposition and declaration and abridgement; and so that the forms of the instruments of cautery and of the other tools of the work come through addition of declaration, and through preparation of it, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause whereby no good artificer is found by the hand in our times is because the art of medicine is long, and that one who practices it before he be exercised in the science of anatomy, which belongs to Gualia, knowing the parts of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and having the knowledge of the bones, the nerves and the sinews, and the number of these, and their issue; and of the pulsating veins and the quiet ones, and the places of their issue.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And on account of this Hypocras says that one whose name is great but in action small, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said of this in the introduction to this book; for who is not learned in that which we have said concerning anatomy, it is certain that he will fall into error whereby men will die, as I have seen many of these, for some are formed in this science and throw themselves from that without learning or experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and experienced physician incise a scrofulous abscess on the neck of a woman, and incised some arteries of the neck so that much blood flowed and the woman died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another physician who, when he had extracted a stone from a man whose condition was improved, and the stone was large, came to him and drew out that stone with a piece of the bladder so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I called to them to draw it out and saw that on account of the size of the stone and the disposition of the patient that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another physician who received stipends from a duke of our land for surgery, and he undertook to treat a negro who had suffered a fracture in his thigh; and preparing with his ignorance, drew out the fracture over the wound with powders and splints with strong compression and did not leave the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And he let him loose according to his desires and bound him and left him for several days and commanded that we unbind the ligature; and it was thus until the thigh and the leg were apostematized, and it came to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him and made preparation to unbind the ligature, and tranquility was achieved and he was eased of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But the corruption was nonetheless confirmed in the member so that I could not restrain it and the corruption continued to circulate in the member until the patient died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another physician who perforated a cankerous abscess and it was ulcerated for several days until the evil of it grew great with its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of which is that the cold humor is pure, and it does not come to him by iron at all but that it be in a member which suffers that it be opposed to all things.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And on account of this, children, it is necessary for you that the operation through manual technique be considered in two ways: one is in operation which is associated with health, and the other in work whereby there is peril in the greatest dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already expounded that in every place of this book in which occurs operation whereby there is error and fear; so that it is necessary for you to guard against that and leave it, lest the foolish bring about your harm through speaking.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take up your weapons with diligence and with God's protection, and your patients with gentleness and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way through God's grace for the sake of health and praiseworthy success and rid yourselves of terrible illnesses of difficult cure, and arm yourselves against that which causes you to fear so that trembling in your faith and in your name does not abandon you: for more remains for your glory and beyond in the world and in the last days for your saints.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Galia already said in some of his books:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Do not heal a bad illness lest bad physicians be named."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have arranged this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begins the division of the book and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered concerning the feet, in the forms of the instruments and the tools of the cauteries, and of that which is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of bleeding and piercing, and of cupping-glasses, and of wounds, and of extraction of arrows and their likes, all capitulated and ordered according to the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, of reduction and of dislocation, and of cure for twisting and their likes; a chapter ordered concerning the feet and the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cautery with fire and with sharp medicine and reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of the whole book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	That I say the quality of the humors of that cautery and of the nocent things in it, and in what condition cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the speech of the quality of the humor of cautery and of the nocent thing in it is long and prolixed, and subtle through science, and secret hid away; and already many wise men have spoken greatly of it, and from it they have disagreed, and for me a little of their speeches suffices, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery confers universally on all complexions, save two complexions which are complexions of coldness without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the complexions of coldness and dryness with matter they disagreed; for some said that cautery is beneficial for it, and the others said the contrary of this, that cautery is not convenient in illnesses which are by quality and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that an illness of coldness and dryness be cauterized.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he said the contrary of this that through cautery benefit is done in every illness of coldness and dryness which one sees in the bodies of men for when you compare the body of man and its moistures to the complexions of fire, you moisten the body of man.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the speech of that which, that experiment that already many times I have discovered.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But it is not necessary to come over here that which is already demonstrated and exercised in the chapter of cauteries by previous exercise, and has known the diversity of the complexions of men, and the disposition of diseases in their bodies, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the space of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in the other complexions, there is no fear over you, and especially in the moist and friction diseases, for all the doctors have agreed upon those, and are not disagreeing upon using cautery on them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing by cautery with fire and its goodness, is that it is a simple substance, whose action does not reach any other member except the one being cauterized, and does not affect another member with it except with minor harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of the burning medicine reaches those members from which it is distant, and strongly brings about disease in the member difficult to heal, and strongly causes it.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But the fire, by its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does not do that except to make superfluous. And it is known to us through experiment and through the longevity of service of study on the truth of causes; and because of this I am excused from the length of speech. And if it were not that I was not read in this book to you, secretly hidden by the fire, and the quality of its operation on the bodies and its expulsion by which you expel diseases, with philosophical speech demonstrated, which would be acute in your ears.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree on the time in which it is appropriate to perform cautery and pause at the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is convenient in all times, because the harm by the accidental time is submerged in the benefit of that which is attracted by the cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pain or necessary pains, strong and violent, which do not tolerate delay so that they fear the evil that comes, which is greater than minor harm coming from the time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And you should not listen to them, O children, or they will not believe it except the common people and foolish doctors; so it is that for this disease which is healed by cautery there is no reduction in all times, and they pause at that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they think it to be, for cautery is only in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries up the moistness which are the cause by which pain comes.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But cautery surpasses medicine in value and power of its operation, and grandeur of his lordship.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his disease will return at some time of the year, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of his disease, and its power, and what has been prepared in his body by the accumulation of excesses in him, and what has come upon him through acquisition in foods and like those causes; but if the disease in which cautery was administered is a subtle disease in a member with few excesses and moistness, so that cautery of teeth for pain and its likes, it is possible that the pain will not return in him, but that happens little.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is a common saying that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a true saying, not that they understand it to be, for they believe that there is no healing that benefits through medicine or other cause except cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is in contrast to that; and the intention that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is not unless the manners of healing are administered in some diseases, and those medicines do not confer, and then at the end of the cause the man is administered cautery, and benefits from it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here we see that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the intention which the vulgar and foolish doctors understand it.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say it except for the equality of gold and sublimity of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery does not make it strong, and that is not absolutely true, for I have already proved and demonstrated that it does not do that except in some bodies without the others, and cautery with it is good and better than with iron as they said; but if you perform cautery with fire with gold, it is not declared to you, because it is made according to the amount you wish according to the roughness of the gold, and it prepares itself to receive friction; and if you apply ignition on it, the gold melts by the fire, and in the fire some sheets are placed so that the artificer sees through the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And because of that cautery with iron is made more lightly and closer to the correctness of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already arranged this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and have arranged those of the head among the feet, so that elsewhere I will ask him what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for headache by coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter:
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers to moisture and coldness the accidental servant of which there are two causes, and it is caused by soda and multitude of flux, called neuritis, from the head to the parts of the ears and from the eyelashes flowing, and multitude of sleep, and of toothache and of gum inflammation, and universally of all disease that comes through friction, such as paralysis, lethargy, and apoplexy, and like in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is this: first of all command the patient to be evacuated with laxative medicine the head cleansing, for three or four days, according to that the power of the patient and his age and habit.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command that he shaves his head with a razor, and then let him sit between your hands on a heated bench, and let him rest his hands on his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then pause the edge of your palm, and then put your fingers between your eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But however, when that part of the middle location has been reached, mark it with a tent, and then ignite the olive-oil cautery, of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then put that on the marked location, in such a way that it descends, and your hand be slightly pressed there, and you revolve it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand slightly and look at the location, and if you see already some quantity of the head uncovered, as well as the amount of hair, then lift your hand again, and if it has not returned your hand with that iron, with another, if it is cooled, while it is seen by you what I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it over the location, and let that be for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then put on it cotton soaked in vinegar and let that be on it until the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the location with tetropharmacon unguent while it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that when the Roman plaster is wet, then as many herbs are put on it, for that is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them said that the jaw should be cauterized within the bone, and have the cautery within it until some part of the substance of the bone is burnt.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then let that be scratched that which is burnt in the bone, and then let it be healed.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	Others said that they reached the bone with the cautery before they put pressure on the strong bones, and this is the form of little Alcphatis.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they think that from that place they expel the vapors from the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the ulcer has been open for a long time and is not healing, it should be treated until it is healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two kinds of cautery at all, except in some men according to the way of fear; and that one, as far as I am concerned, is a thousand times better for health when it is; because the head is devitalized by solution of continuity with him as we have witnessed in other members, and especially when the patient's head is of a frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first kind of cautery is more safe and better as far as I am concerned; and that one should be used for health, both its use and its work.
Capitol segon.	Chapter second.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of cautery to the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in all the head there is a chronic and long-standing pain which is prolonged in the patient, and he uses leeches and cupping glasses and caput medusae and plasters and poultices and bandages and cauteries and similar remedies, and especially if he has already been cauterized with one cautery which does not benefit him at all from those causes, then consider that if the patient's head is of a strong creation in its nature; and it is not frail but finds great pain from great heat, then cauterize it with another cautery after that first one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize that above the crown of his head with a cautery until the scalp is split open.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	The scalp having been split and the quantity which we have mentioned having been opened up, cauterize that with a cautery in the back part of the head at the place which is called the foramen magnum —- and it is that place on which the ventouse is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And loosen your hand in it, and do not open the bone, for the patient will find much greater pain from that than from all the other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will tell you about this cautery in its place, because the cautery by which they cauterize the crown of the head and the occiput is much more subtle cautery than that with which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter third.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of cautery for a new wound, not old.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a sudden pain occurs in the front part of the head, or pain is extended to the eye, let it be evacuated with medicated washings, and let the other treatment be administered, which I have written about in the different diseases; and if all do not help, then cautery to it is in two ways: either cauterize with a sharp medicine that burns, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But cautery with a burning medicine is that you take some alum and scrape it, and put the extremes of it on both sides of the head.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then cut into the site of the pain in the temple with a pointed lance until you have made a hole in it underneath the scalp, and cover it up.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then tie it up over there with a bandage so that it might be tightly bound; and let it stay in that place for the space of three hours; and then loosen the bandage, and treat the alum, and let the ulcer remain for two or three days; and then put your hand over it, submerged in warm water, until the site becomes swollen.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with an ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you want, do that with some burning medicines which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But the cautery with iron according to this way: heat up the cautery of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a nail-shaped cautery, because the head of it has the shape of a nail with some curve to it, and in the middle part of it there is a small protuberance.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place it over the site of the pain, and hold your hand so that it might not be burnt by the cautery which is underneath; and move the iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of it that is burnt by the heat of the cautery according to the thickness of the scalp were as high as the size of your fingernail, and raise up your hand so that the artery underneath might not be burnt, so that there might not come a flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then moisten the cautery in salt water and place it over the site for three days; and then apply a poultice soaked with warm water, and cure that with an ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you want, cauterize with the edge of a scalpel according to the cautery, and beware of cutting into an artery in this new wound that is not old.
Capitol quart.	Chapter fourth.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of cautery for an old wound.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you cure a wound with what we have said about the previous treatment, and what we have said in the divisions of diseases, and the treatment does not help, and you see for the disease that it is not sufficient to it what we have said about the first cautery with medicine or the cautery with fire, then when you ignite the cautery cut until it turns white, place your hand over the site of the pain with a bandage and tighten that while you pierce the artery underneath and it comes out into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However it is necessary for you to beware of the continuation of the mandible, which is worn down by chewing, and that the ligament not be burnt and the nerve underneath it, and that no spasm come over it.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and caution of the flow of blood from the artery that it is cut, for there is danger in the cutting of it, especially for him who ignores what he does and is inexperienced and unskilled; and let the operation stop at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come with remembrance of the rule for the flow of blood accidentally from the artery according to its own way, in its own place in this free book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this disease does not help this cautery and you see the body of the patient tolerable, cauterize it in the middle part of the head as we have mentioned, and cure the ulcer until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you want, administer the cautery which we have said in the chapter about stretching of the artery with cautery having two edges, and this cautery is better and more suitable.
Capitol .v.	Chapter fifth.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of cautery for pains in the ears.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain from heat and it is cured with caustic remedies and with the other treatment which I have written about in the division, and the pain is not relieved, then ignite the cautery, and this is that one which has the name puncta, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then prick it with the cautery and heat it, and let it be moved around the whole of the ear as a wheel is turned, or in the circle of whichever part if the pain is in whichever part.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Lengthen it with the cautery from the rim of the ear little by little so that you do not touch the site with the tip.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of ten points in all of the ear, and it, and then cure the sites until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter sixth.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cautery for torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture which is cured and cautery does not help except with remedies of the spices which come from phlegm, according as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the area that hurts due to dryness or due to a spasm in the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat this kind of torture with poultices and bandages and healing remedies, and don't see any improvement, then you must cauterize the patient in three places: first at the root of the auricle, second a little below his temple, and third at the junction of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And apply your cautery opposite to where it hurts because softening only comes from the side that is healing.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the way to perform cauterization is to cauterize it on the right side of the highest part of the auricle a little bit above the corner of the head, and another one at the temple, whose length should be according to the length of the finger, and hold your hand with the cautery until half of the thickness of the hair is burnt.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, it is a kind of knife whose shape is described above.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, one should be more careful because it cuts deep in the skin. And if there are too many bumps on the surface, cut them a little bit.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with what is described above until it heals.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On cauterization for ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and you treat it with what we have described above but don't see any improvement and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize him with four cauteries: on all of the corners of his head; and with cautery on the middle part of the head as we have said before; and with cautery on the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the way to perform cauterization is as it is described above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And he has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and it is more effective this way; and he will be cured with what we have described.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On cauterization for oblivion caused by phlegm.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Give the patient large poultices and pills that are purifying at the beginning.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then rub the whole head of the patient and place on his neck a plaster made from honey as it is described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply it a few times, because that is the way to perform cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do it according to what we have said above.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if he heals well with this treatment, good; and if not, then do to him three cauteries in the back part of his head which should go from the highest part of the head down to the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place between each cautery the thickness of a finger, and treat the cauteries with what is described above.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	However, if you see improvement and the patient tolerates it, then do to him cauterization in the middle part of his head; and if you see even more improvement, then cauterize him on both corners.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat him until he is healed; and let the cautery be olive-shaped as it is described above.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On cauterization for a hernia and on softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Give the patient poultices and treatment for the head as we have said above; then rub his head, and cauterize him with cautery in the middle part of the head, and with cautery on all of the corners of his head, and with cautery on the back of his neck, and with three cauteries on the spine of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the softening of the body to give him trops and the patients tolerate it and the apoplexy is strong, then cauterize him with four cauteries on the spine of the back, and lastly with cautery over his head until half of the thickness of the hair is burnt, and lift your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then treat him until he is healed; and let this cautery be olive-shaped.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On cauterization for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	An epileptic is not cauterized unless the cause of his epilepsy is phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore give the patient treatments for the brain at the beginning of his illness with herbs and with other remedies as we have said in the division when the patient is strong and tolerates the excessive use of remedies.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if the patient is a child who does not tolerate remedies, then administer healing poultices and masticables to him for several days with the benefit of foods.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then rub the head of the patient, and cauterize him with a cautery in the middle part of the head as we have said before, and with another cautery on his occipital bone, and with cautery on all of the corners of his head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerates it, then cauterize him with cauteries as we have said before, having paralysis and softening of the body on the spine of the neck and the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let the cautery be olive-shaped as it is described above.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	However, if the patient is a child, then apply a subtle cautery according to this way:
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On cauterization for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are moist and rotten humors and phlegm, then cauterize him with cauteries as we have said in having paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excess and decline to melancholy, and the body of the patient is moist, then give him to drink what purifies his brain as we have said in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then rub the head of the patient, and make a decently made turban out of linen and place it on his head, and then hold it in place.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be seated, and let him be held upright.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply a liniment; and it is more worthy of being made from old sheep's wool.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm it over the fire with moderate heat as we have said when he is in him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then apply it on the middle part of his head on the circle, and hold it in place until it is cool.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this to him once a week for several times, with the other treatment of him being good until he is healed; or if you want, cauterize him making small points according to his condition: this is a kind of cautery which softens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then apply it wrapped in wool or in cotton wool.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On cauterization for water descending into the nose.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have declared the beginning of water in the nose due to the sinuses as we have said in the division, then start and give the patient to drink what purifies his head, and guard him from all moistness.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let him sweat in a bath with vinegar for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command him to wash his head, and cauterize him with cautery in the middle part of the head; and then cauterize him with two cauteries on two temples if it is the beginning of water in two noses, or on one side if it is the beginning of water in one nose.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Strike with cautery all the veins and sinuses which are under the skin; and let the cauteries be long in length according to the length of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And guard against flowing of blood when he is cauterized; and if you see flowing of blood from him, stop it with some medicine which is possible for you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	I have come with wisdom that is in the extraction of arrows and in the bandaging of those [wounds] and the cauterization of blood flows.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized on the heads of the bones with two cauteries recently produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cauterization of ancient tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears of the eyes are old and frequent and the veins and arteries through which they flow are manifestly apparent on the surface of the head and it is verified that this is superfluous flowing phlegmatic fluids, then cauterize that with a cautery as we have recounted in the chapter on beginning of water gushing out in the eye, and with a cautery in the middle of the head and with two cauteries on the skull below the temples, and with two cauteries on the skull below the bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if it is necessary to add [to the cautery], then cauterize that in all sides of the eye socket over the extremity of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of the stench of the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you are treating that with what we have said in the division and your treatment does not benefit, then you prepare and give to drink to the patient the cow's hoofs for three nights; and then shave his head and cauterize the middle of his head with a cautery made from an olive tree.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that with a cautery made from a clove with two cauteries over the two eyebrows beneath the hair, a little one.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful of the arrow that you do not burn it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And of the cautery made from a clove, this is its form:
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the cauterization for softening of the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened due to sickness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery made from this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you like, cauterize that over the two eyebrows a little with two cauteries in its entirety, and let them be elongated from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the amount of eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too much with your hand with the cautery, but according to the amount that the upper part of the eyelid is attached.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the cauterization of the eyelid when the hairs are converted to the parts within and close the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eye are converted to the parts within so that they close the eye, there are two ways of cauterizing them, either with a hot iron or with a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If with a cautery of fire, command the patient to look down at that so that he pulls his hairs down as they grow out and are cut off; and if it closes by itself, then you strengthen his eyes with a bandage so that he does not rub them as the hairs grow out.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they are growing out and curling, then place the patient's head on your knee, and then draw a sign over the eyelid of his eyes with a pen, make the sign according to the shape of an olive leaf, and let the beginning of the sign be near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place cotton dipped in white vinegar or in mullein tea on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then light the cautery of which this is its form:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize over the figure which you have drawn, bit by bit, in small spots, until the surface of the skin is burned black and appears like an olive leaf, all apparently even.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of the health of your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the hairs of it lifted up from the punctured eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and lay him down for three days, and then place on him cotton with balms until the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if they return for some reason and the eyelid is softened, then do the cauterization on that again entirely as you had done at first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are in the eyelid beneath it, then cauterize that until it is elevated to its natural place and curled back and the hairs do not poke the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is that you command the patient to look down at his hairs as they grow out and curl back, and then let it be made from linen the shape of an olive leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take a pounded soap and of live coals a handful. [Chapter title:] Take that and mix it with the ashes, and then add to those ashes honey, and make that into a poultice so that it is not cold; and then spread that on the linen which is made in the shape of an olive leaf, and place that on one eye or both; and let the eye be closed with a bandage and the patient's head be in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the thumb on the medicine and press that a little and let him not rub it as he feels the burning of the medicine, for the burning is in him as if by fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And then when he perceives that the burning, let him look at the medicine and bite it with his teeth; then when the burning ceases, let him wash the eye with water and then consider if he sees the eyelid raised as it is washed by fire or by incision, for then it is well; and if it does not return to that of the medicine on the spot where the medicine has not been applied and is not blackened as your operation is completed and the eye is contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place on him a bandage so that the scar of the wound is eradicated, and then cure that with an ointment of theriac or another until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, after your operation, to watch diligently so that no pus falls into the eye from the medicine, and if the eyelid several days later is softened and some cause of the hairs poking into the eye, then repeat your medicine on that spot of the eyelid which is softened, and properly as you have done at the beginning, and then bandage him until he is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the shape of an olive leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that men's eyes are diversified according to size and smallness, and therefore according to that is made your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not take the path of straightness to that to which it is directed in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you are curing a fistula with what we have said in the divisions of illnesses and your treatment does not agree, then know that you cauterize that according to this manner: command the patient to place his head on your lap, and let him hold his head by some servant so that it is not rubbed nor moved by his head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place on the eye of him cotton dipped in white vinegar or in mullein tea.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then light the cautery of which this is its form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	Which is hollow, like a reed or a feather made from a vulture, with one extremity from which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	If you wish to go further into the other extremity,
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	then you can do so by using a tent.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the one who is concave is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then squeeze the fistula if it is open, and draw out from him pus and dry up that place.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then cut it open and extract the rottenness from him.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place on him the cautery which has been well lit, and have your hand close to the cautery at the start of the nose so that your hand does not get burned or the patient disturbed, and then apply the cautery on the gums of the hole and corrupt that place.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of your cautery it penetrates into the bone, that is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice, as needed; and leave that there for three days, and then place on that spot a poultice and wrap it up with a bandage until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if eleven days have passed and it has not healed, then apply to it a sharp, corrosive medicine so that the bone is uncovered and cut according to what suits you in your chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another way of cauterizing a fistula which some people say at the beginning: enter into the place of the fistula and open it up, and then in that fissure place soft solder with which is its shape; and pour into that the quantity of one ounce of melted lead; and keep your hand with good retention so that the patient is not burned as the melted lead does not reach the hole of that; and cover what you have placed over the hole of the patient with cotton or water, for the lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it by a marvelous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cauterization and treatment, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer a blow to the nose and reduce the fistula into the nose according to what will come into its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 28
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On cauterization of a split in the jaw.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Often there are fissures in the lips, and especially in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	So if you treat those fissures with what we have said in the sections and your treatment does not benefit, then ignite the cautery with a small knife in this way that it is filled:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its cavity be according to the thinness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that gently into those fissures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with ointment so that it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 29
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On cauterization of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or in the palate or in the roots of the teeth, a pustule is formed and then bursts, and then becomes old, and pus and blood flow out, and there is a fistula, and you treat it and your treatment does not benefit, then when you ignite cautery according to the quantity that is received in the fistula, then place that fire into the hole of the fistula, and keep your hand so that the hot iron reaches the bottom of it, and at its back do this one or two times; and then treat that with what we have said about treatment so that it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so if the pus is discharged and it is healed, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to uncover the place and cut away the corrupted bone according to what comes into its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 30
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On cauterization of teeth and softening of gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are aching, and you treat those with medicines and do not help, then place the head of the patient into your lap, and ignite the cautery in the form which will come there, so that you place the canule over the tooth and insert into it the cautery ignited quickly, and keep your hand close to the patient's mouth so that the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth where it has pervened.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift up your hand, and repeat the cautery several times according to what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should fill his mouth with salt water and keep it for an hour, and then spit it out, for the aching tooth is calmed and the softened gum is strengthened and the corrupted moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 31
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is due to coldness, or in it is cold or red, or the treatment with medicine does not help, then cauterization in that place is according to two methods: either cauterization with an iron brand, or cauterization with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with an iron brand is that you take an iron brand and heat it in a charcoal fire, and then grab the hot end and wrap it in a cloth and place it on the end of the tooth gently until it is cold.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat that several times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, dip wool or cloth in the fire below it, and place that over the painful tooth, and place the hot iron on top of it so that the iron reaches the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterization with fire is that you await the needle of iron or of copper, and let it be in its center some thickness and the keenness of the fire not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cautery in the form which will come, and place that over the tooth and keep your hand so that the cautery is cold; and do this several times because the pain still continues or on another day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And have the patient fill his mouth with good water and keep it for an hour, and then spit it out; and this is the form of the cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize with what you wish extreme according to what is possible to you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the needle:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 32
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On cauterization of hernia.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernia are of phlegm and cold humors and are not cured by medicines, and you wish to cure them gently, then ignite the cautery such that its smoke reaches the hernia on one side, and then place it ignited on the hernia another time, so that it reaches the bottom of the hernia.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the hernia is small, then place the cautery according to the quantity of the hernia, and then let it be for three days and place over it a poultice soaked in ointment so that it is heated up by what the fire has burned.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with ointment and bandages so that it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the form of the needle or of the cautery to such is as follows.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 33
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On cauterization of throat and constriction of voice.
