Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body white spots appear and pustules are split open which are made of coarse corrupt materials, therefore take when it appears that there be cauterized over all head of the fistula with a subtle cautery with a rod of mirtle, the end of which is extended with fire; or with long razors, or with a cautery lentecular.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And sometimes cauterization with garlic is applied at the beginning of expulsion according to this method; and they are not believed, and the superfluity is disrupted by doing those things, and healed from those things.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	But it should be done with proper evacuation through phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter 56.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Of cautery for the flow of blood accidentally by incision of an artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Sometimes there is a flow of blood from an artery that is cut through the wound, or through the incision of an abscess or cautery on the limb, and sometimes they appear similar, and it is difficult to stop that flow.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	So when it happens to someone, then you should cover the orifice of the artery with your hand and place your finger on that orifice, and sometimes push that finger inside until the flow of blood is stopped and does not come out again.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	Then place on the wound some large and small olive-wood coals, many in number, and blow upon them until they are very hot.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take some of those coals, either small or large according to the place and wound in which the artery is broken, pushing them quickly into that vein as soon as you have removed your finger, and hold them there until the blood flow is stopped and that artery is bound up and restricted.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the orifice of the artery when you remove your finger and tighten the cautery, then take another cautery which has been prepared in the fire, and therefore do not cease doing this one after another until the blood flow is restricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful that you do not burn the nerves that are there, and that no other evil comes to the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from an artery, it is not possible to restrict the blood in those cases except by one of four methods: either by cautery as we have said, or by extraction if it has not been extracted; for when it is extracted, its extremities are burned and the blood flow restricted; or by being tied with a thread or ligature with strong pressure; or by having remedies placed on it which have the virtue of restricting the blood flow, which should be pressed with a bandage with decent pressure.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who applies decent restriction to it by ligature and pressure with a bandage, or by the position of burning causes and similar things, does not confer anything but harm.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens to someone and the doctor is not present, or medicine, then open with the tip of your finger over the orifice of that vein as we have said before, and understand that it should be pressed with great pressure on him until the blood flow is stopped from the upper part of the wound; and do not remove your finger from over the artery; and sprinkle over it water which has been rubbed with something very cold until the blood is congealed and thickened; and then stop at what needs cautery or medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and piercing and puncturing and phlebotomy, and of wounds and their likes.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are words from Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter of all diseases in which cautery with fire is convenient and suitable medicine, its occasions and causes, and the instruments necessary for it and the forms of the cauteries; and we have ordered the chapters from the superior part of the head to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And we will now proceed in this chapter in that way, so that the seeker may be eased; and then on what he has demanded.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before we begin that, know that in this chapter there is something of terror which is in the first chapter on cautery.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And be careful about it, for in the operation which is in this chapter there are many times cat evacuation, which is by blood, by which life is lost through sprinkling on the vein or incision of an abscess or opening of a wound or piercing of a stone or similar things.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And they are all accompanied by fear and trembling, and in the end death comes to them.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that this does not happen to you, for many times it happens due to the manners of men with their many manners of diseases.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And there are some who go astray because of their disease and die because of it, and also because of the vehemence of that with which they find themselves in their disease, and because of the length of their disease, and because of the illness itself which signifies death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And there are those who give it to you in their sleep and say so, hoping for health from that, and whose disease is harmful to them.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore do not consent to anyone who comes to you in this way; and your caution should be greater than their cunning and your greed; and do not presume any cause about it except certain knowledge which verifies it from you, and to whom a praiseworthy outcome comes.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use it in the cure of all your illnesses from prediction and indication of that to which health is converted; for in that there is aid to you regarding acquisition of fame and memory, praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, children, God directs your understanding and does not keep from you his direction and protection; for that is in his hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have ordered this chapter distinguishing by chapters according to that which precedes in the chapter on cauteries, of the cure of the head to the feet, so that it may be eased for you what you demanded and of which you had need.
Capitol primier.	Chapter one.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure of water which is contained in the heads of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this disease sometimes happens to children after childbirth when the mother raises her child's head in her arms.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes because of a hidden cause which is not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this disease except in children; and to all of them whom I saw the death came upon, and because of that it was known to me as happening in them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen a child whose head was filled with water, and his head was always enlarged because he could not breastfeed due to the size of his head; and yet the moisture increased inside him until fire came upon him and killed him.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this moisture is either accumulated between the brain and the bone, or it is accumulated below the bone over the skull.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	For if the operation in him is that the moisture is between the brain and the bone and the abscess is small, then you should open in the middle of the head with an incision in the width, and let the length of the incision be two fingers so that the moisture runs out; and this is the form of the spatum:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And if the moisture is more increased and the abscess is larger, then there are two incisions here according to this way:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the moisture is below the bone, a sign of it is that you will see the seams of the head open from end to end, and the water is expelled when you press it with your hand on those openings; and it is not hidden from you.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	You should open in the middle of the head with three incisions according to this way:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And then pull out all the moisture; and then tighten the incisions with bandages and plasters; and then anoint it on the fifth day, and strengthen the skull with oil, and cure the wound with ointments and poultices, and strengthen the head with equality; and feed the patient with dry food of little moisture so that the limb may be comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	There is another method of incision that considers the size of the abscess and the collection of pus, as sometimes it is larger at the back of the head, or in front, or on the right or left side; so pay attention to the incision where the abscess appears and the collection of pus, and finish according to what you think is best.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And be careful not to cut the artery and cause a flow of blood and kill the patient by that flow of blood through the evacuation of moisture.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of the incision of the arteries which are near the ears, called aural arteries.
Capitol segon.	Chapter II.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When it comes to a boil or abscess on the ears or feet, and it is old, and there is no response to the treatment with medicines, then the best cure in this case is to make an incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And then, when you want to make an incision where the patient is affected in his head, and approximately rub the area with a rough cloth so that the arteries become apparent, and then tighten the neck of the patient with some cloth; and consider where the pulse is, and the places above each side of the ears are pressed down, and they are hidden in some people.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then mark the artery with a needle, and make an incision on each side with a knife so that it comes through the bone, and do this all around the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, insert the knife below the artery and cut through to the parts above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And let the length of the incision be about two fingers wide, for when a vein is cut, blood rushes out in pulses, which jumps out frequently.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear at the touch, then measure from the ear the quantity of three fingers, and mark with a needle, and cut into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And that which comes out is the amount of wine an ounce. And very little comes out from him, more or less, and all that is according to the amount that appears in the strength of the patient and the filling of the artery in him.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And consider the wound, and therefore if anything remains on the bone that can cause a headache, then cut it out so that an abscess does not develop.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen the wound with small feathers and strips of linen cloth, and cure it within until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of the extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When some people suffer from old migraines or abscesses in the temples, due to cold humors and qualities in the eyes, or old, violent headaches similar to those, and are treated with medical remedies without success, then we have found that extraction of the arteries in the temples, or cauterization of those as I have shown is effective.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the manner of operation and extraction of these is that the patient turns his head to them; and understand the artery in the temple, for it is shown to you by its pulse, and it is hidden in some people by the force of rubbing.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden from you, then tighten the neck of the patient with some cloth; and rub the area with a rough cloth or pour warm water on it until you see the artery clearly.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then take the knife, whose shape is as follows:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then you scrape it gently with that until you reach the artery; and then extract it into the upper parts as far as you can, pulling it out of its sheath and uncovering it from the layers below it, in all directions.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is thin, then wrap it with a thread, and make an incision of it from that one part according to the amount by which its ends are lengthened and tightened, and there will be no flow of blood, for if they are not cut, it will not flow.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then discharge blood from an ounce. within three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then tie it in two places with strong double thread of linen or cords lengthwise, and do not cut it before the hardening of the wound occurs and cause a flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then cut the superfluity which is between two layers; do this in that hour or another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you want, cauterize it with a cautery within the bone with a scalpel so that its ends are cut, and it will be in place of that work.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better to do this when the patient has no fever or a cold complexions, for cauterization is of those causes that help to dry up moist humors, and therefore it is better in youth.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then extract the arteries that are near the site of a previous wound, and let them be wrapped with powdered linen decently made, and then cured with dry medicines that make the flesh dry and with poultices until it is healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you operate another vein appears from the artery, then you tie that blood with a thread, or cauterize it, or scrape the site of the wound, and tighten your hand over it so that the blood is restricted.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if none of those causes are present to you, then place your finger over the site so that the blood is coagulated, and moisten the area with very hot water rubbed vigorously until the pain subsides, and tighten according to how it feels.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And what is easier in the extraction of an artery is that you cauterize it with this cautery having two points, because you have marked the two sites with a needle, and then burn each one, with fire, until they reach the bone and cut the artery into two places, so that it is lengthened between its ends, for it is not consolidated at all by this cauterization.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And you wrap the site with a cloth so that it is cauterized.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But if it is milder heat than two points is better, for if it is sharp with two points it approaches each other rubbing, and do not cut into the flesh quickly.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore when there is any thickness in those, the heat of the fire is held in those and the flesh is cut more gently.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better in all works and easier.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And let the space between two points be the quantity of the thickness of the finger.
Capitol quart.	Chapter IV.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the treatment of acute and sharp pains in the ears.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When there are sharp pains and the veins on the top of the head are visible, and medical remedies do not help in that regard, and the face of the patient becomes red and he feels walking as if ants were crawling on him, and his ears are tired, and the heat is intense within him, and the eyes are exhausted by the intensity of tears, the old ones are cured by this operation with a sponge.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you command the patient to shave the hairs on their forehead, and then inscribe three equal incisions on the forehead, evenly spaced according to the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the fissure reaches two digits: let the first fissure be evenly spaced according to the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second according to the length of a little finger beyond the movement of the eyelashes which are in the tear duct, and the third from the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And be careful of the incision on either side of the arches, and lengthen your hand from the continuation of both mandibles.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space between each incision is the quantity of three digits, adjust it.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a piece of prepared sponge or dry rags to stop the bleeding with which you dried the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	Then insert the spatula of two sharp ends, and this is the shape of the incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	It begins at the temple and goes towards the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Excise all the membrane which is between two incisions with the scalp, and then do the same with the incision on the other side into the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	Then place this spatula and insert it into the first incision again, but this time use another instrument called a cutlar, sharp on one side and blunt on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And place the sharp side towards the membrane and the blunt side towards the bone, and move it around so that it reaches the middle incision, and cut with it all the vessels which descend from the head to the limbs.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	Let the incision continue up to the membrane, and then do the same in the middle incision up to the other incision.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And when blood comes out in equal quantity from both sides, squeeze the places of the clotted blood.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	Then place in each incision a piece of cotton wool, and place on it powders mixed with wine and oil, and pour onto it vinegar so that no ulcer forms.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day loosen the ligature and administer a great effusion of tepid water, and then dress the wound with ointment of basilicon mixed with rose oil and other things so that the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	CHAPTER 5:
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Of the treatment of ulcers by cauterization and of the ulcers which descend from the parts inside the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When the cauteries are done and continued, and one sees the ulcers of the patient become smaller, and the protection of them is weakened, and the eyelids are ulcerated and because of that the hair, and in the brow there is acute pain and intense pulsing, then know from these accidents that the matters and cauteries do not come except from many veins in the parts inside.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best treatment for them is this: command the patient to shave his forehead, and then inscribe a fissure in the middle of the forehead, a little according to its length (and begin with the fissure of the left temple going towards the right temple; and let the incision be made into the bone; and lengthen your hand from the eyelashes of the temples which are bitten because of chewing), so that the bone is uncovered.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry up all the blood with sponge or dry cloth, and then stuff between the two lips of the fissure cotton wool or lint.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then sprinkle on it powders mixed with wine and oil so that there is not formed an ulcerous cautery.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you loosen it and see that the ulcer has become smaller, then know that one should wash the bone so that the meat begins to form on it, and then treat those with an exsiccative regime which causes the meat to wither away, just as if one takes two parts of wheat flour and four parts of gum mastic and mixes them together into a plaster and applies it to these wounds of the flesh at birth.
Capitol .vi.	CHAPTER 6:
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Of the treatment of what cauterizes in the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The whole cause which cauterizes in the ears is one of four species, either it is mineral stone or causes something like stone, just as iron and vitriol, or it is plant just as chickpeas or beans, or it is volatile just as water and wine and their likes, or some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And when stone cauterizes in the ear or other cause similar to those causes which do not form a growth in the ear, and hold the ear to the sun, and if one sees the stone, then distill on it some cause of violat oil or sesame oil, and then administer its distillation, and make them sneeze with snuff, and plug the nose because of the sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then place in the circuit of the ear some pieces of cloth or wool, and lengthen the ear to its parts above, for many times it is bored by these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not bored, then administer its extraction with the subtle instrument called epicyclical forceps, of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is bored by gesti, let it be; and if not, then administer its extraction with the subtle hook of little duplication.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And if it is not bored by that, then make a cannula of ram and insert the tip of the cannula in the hole of the ear and close over the opening of the cannula with wax and softened oil so that there is not open except the cannula.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract it by strong吸引力, for many times troops have been found with this.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not bored in this way, then take hollow alum or of the type prepared with which the ears are compressed with a little quantity, and place that on the end of the ear, and then wind cloth around it decently placed.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the hole of the ear with ease, and then draw out the ear from its moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And if it is not bored by all the causes which we have recounted, then you cut to such an extent that there ensues ulcerous cautery or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the way to cut it is that you first make the patient's vein of the septica vein and extract its blood according to the nature of it, and then do that in such a way that there are not two veins in the place where one has been pricked before him, and convert the ear towards its parts above, and pierce with a small incision in the root of the ear because of the grayish color of it at the point which has been pricked before.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And let the incision be in the shape of the moon so that it reaches the stone, and if the stone is found, hold it with instruments; and then close the incision at that time with speed, and treat it so that it is healed.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause cauterizes in the ear is one of the fats which grow and are swollen, then administer its treatment and extraction; but if it does not obey your command, then take the slender tweezers according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	And administer with that the incision of that fat which has fallen in the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do that when you think that it has been moistened by the vapor of the ear, and place that in many pieces, and then extract those with forceps or with subtle tweezers, or with incision just as we have said, for the extraction from it is eased.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But when the water which is entered in the ear causes sneezing at the beginning, and fill his ear with some cotton wool, and pour on that ear in which there is the water, and if by that it is bored, let it be; and if not, then take thin stones like fingers according to their length, and heat those in the fire a little, and the patient inserts one of those into the hole of his ear and sucks on the one from which there is the water, and press with another stone over that stone which is in the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore do not cease until all the urine has been expelled.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the urine has been expelled, take a piece of paper or linen and place one end in the urethra and extend the other end towards the fire until it burns, the length of it.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then put in another one and do this as many times as needed until all the urine is expelled, and apply this also with a catheter as already described.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of an object which has entered the urethra, if it is a small object, remove it as we have already said in the section on division; but if the cause is due to a large object that blocks the flow of urine, then use forceps and tongs, and the cause of this is usually a foreign body lodged in the urethra.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of a worm that has grown inside the urethra, if you cannot cure it with what we have already said in the section on division and on the treatment of discharges, then you must look at the urethra under the sunlight.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if you see the cause of the worm, then remove it with forceps or fine tongs; but if you do not see any cause, then take a catheter that is narrow at the tip and wider towards the end.
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	Insert the narrow tip into the urethra according to how much the patient can tolerate; and then suck strongly with your mouth several times until all the worms are expelled.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if you cannot access it due to resistance, then stop and close the opening of the catheter with wax as we have already described; then administer the distilling remedies which have been used before in the treatment of worms, and find this also in the section on distillation remedies.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And use this instrument to pour the medicine oils into the urethra; this is how it should be made:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	Make it of silver or brass, narrow at the tip and wider above, with a small hole in it.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And then stop it up with a plug so that it fits snugly into the opening of the catheter where it is needed.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you want, take a reed and wrap the end of it with cotton, and then pour oil into the cavity of the instrument, or juice from herbs, or anything you want to use from these medicines in the catheter — and that is how it should be used in the urethra —; then insert the reed with the cotton above it and squeeze with your hand that end of it gently until the oil is expelled into the cavity of the instrument and the patient feels the oil inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what has been inserted in the urethra should be warmed slightly with fire.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And be careful that the cause which you distil in the urethra is not too strong, because the medicines for the urethra do not tolerate it.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7:
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the treatment of inflammation of the urethra.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Sometimes children are born with an obstruction in their bellies which is not punctured, and this also happens to some adults, with inflammation in the middle of the urethra due to a blockage or from pushing against it; and this inflammation sometimes occurs at the opening of the urethra, and sometimes deeper inside.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which occurs in the middle of it, which does not allow urine to pass through, is a more difficult condition to cure.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And if you succeed in allowing urine to pass through, look at the urethra under the sunlight and examine it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore, if you see swelling, open it with a thin spatulum of which this is the shape:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the end of it is narrow, with one edge sharp and the other not; and let the spatulum be made of two sides of lion skin so that it does not harm the urethra.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And if the inflammation is due to flesh grown in the urethra or in its middle, then cut it with fine tongs and pierce that spot forcefully until all the flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the inflammation is in the middle of the urethra, take a thin reed made from lion skin and warm it slightly with fire, then insert that into the middle of the urethra.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And therefore, if you feel swelling due to the difficulty of urination because of obstruction, relieve that pressure easily; and be careful not to harm the nerves of the urethra.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place a bandage around the urethra according to the width of the opening which you have wrapped with Egyptian liniment; and do this for several days until you are sure that the plaster has dried out; or take some ash and dip that in water and sprinkle it over the area, and if you see that the urethra is already swollen, then remove the ash and replace it with another kind of ash which you have wrapped in a cerot made from rose oil, until the swelling subsides; and then cure that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if bleeding occurs, then immerse a sponge or bandage in warm water and place it over the urethra, and use the other treatment which constricts the flow of blood, which is described in the section on distillation remedies.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8:
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the cure for athezil which occurs under the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athezil which occurs under the eyelids of humans sometimes produces moisture, and sometimes it is dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, you must have them pulled by tweezers or tongs, and tear them with a spatulum made from their roots, and then place it over the spots after they have been crushed.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if bleeding occurs with pain, then cauterize them with a small, thin cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is to make incisions and cuts several times until all causes of those roots are removed; and when they have been cauterized with fire, those roots are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9:
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	On the cure for grandeyssa which occurs under the eyelids of humans.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Many times it occurs under the eyelids of humans due to some cause which is similar to grandeyssa in its strength and hardness, and because of that, grandeyssa is called.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of thick moisture under the eyelid on top and underneath.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the appearance of it is that you must consider if the grandeyssa occurs in it due to something appearing from under the eyelid and is swollen all around; and the cause of it is cold.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, pierce it with a slit through the width, and then scrape all of that gently until it is released, and then close that with tongs and cauterize it.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not equipped for the incision of it if there is no penetration of the eyelid with a small cut, then this will not be noticed in any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then adjust it with a suture; and cure that until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not suffer harm from that because the eye restores it and heals it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the grandeyssa is declining towards the inner parts of the eyelid under its surface, then open it and close that grandeyssa with tongs, or you can cut it, and press all around it, and if the eyelid due to incision is elongated, then this will not be noticed in any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then begin by washing the wound with salty water, and heal the area with an ointment that will promote healing.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of the treatment of a ulcer on the eyelid.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	A ulcer is a grayness that is engendered in the membranes of the eyelid, and it mostly affects infants, aggravating the sight of those and causing pain to their eyes; and they cannot bear to look at the brightness of the sun because of this.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And so you will see these children always rubbing their eyes, and sleeping on their faces; and the eyelids of their eyes are moist, covered in inflammation, and there is a sign of swelling within the eye; and when you press on the area with your finger, you feel the swelling within.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And a certain kind of bandage is put on the patient who rests his head on your lap; and you drape cloth over him and make heat from it, and make a circle according to the quantity that contains arterosclerosis from all around, and then place that upon it and press with your fingers all around so that the swelling is reduced in the middle of the circle, and then open in the middle of that moisture with a spatula inserted through the slit, and the slit should not be larger than the one made in flabotomy.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the first stage, be sure to cut all the way through to the artery so that you reach the swelling, for in most cases the swelling comes through the slit as a white grayness.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Then extract that with tweezers which you have wrapped between your fingers at the outside edges and twist between the right and left hand so that it is pulled out.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be sure not to press into the slit with the spatula so that you do not reach the eye and damage it.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if you do not see the artery at the beginning of the slit, but you can press into the slit a little with ease so that the artery comes out; then extract it as we have said; and then moisten cloth in water and wine and place them over the area and hold them tight with a bandage.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And so some put salt and place it in the cavity of the slit so that what remains of the moisture comes out.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then heal the area so that it is cured.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if an ulcer occurs in the eye, then heal it with soft bandages until it is cured.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of ways of touching the eye.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When in the eyelids of the eyes there are hairs that are pushed downward and are pulled out, then those harm the eye and cause ways of illnesses as well as continuous tears and inflammation of the eyelids and membrane, which is a cause of destruction of the eye called tactinir of the eye, and it can be cured in four ways: by cauterization with fire; or with an acute medicine as mentioned earlier in the chapter on cautery; or tactinir is caused by incision and suturing; or by cannula, as I will explain.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	Then have the patient rest his head on your lap; then turn the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it turns, all is well; if not, insert an awl into the slit where the pus is below the eyelid, and let the awl go above the hairs — close to the margin of the eyelid where the hairs grow — close to the hairs, and draw out the pus towards the top of the eyelid, and turn it with your finger.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	Then open the slit within the eyelid below the hairs with a spatula inserted into the tear duct from above into the lower tear duct; then extract the pus and place small pieces of cotton or cloth underneath the eyelid, and then bandage over the eyelid with a tent so that it forms the shape of a leaf of mirt.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	But let the shape be according to the amount of swelling of the eyelid, for this is diverse in men, for some there is a great quantity that is inserted into the eyelid according to the amount by which the eyelid is inflamed.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	Then open with the spatula over the two lines that you have drawn, and begin from the tear duct from above into the lower tear duct.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your slit is close to the natural hairs, as thick as a king's hair.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	Then insert the needle into one of the two angles of the artery, and then scrape away all the inflammation, and then close with a stitch the two lips with gum or fine wool, and wipe away the blood, and attach what overflows from the hairs above two eyebrows with some causes binding, if you wish to do so, and otherwise it will not be cured.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	Then let the stitch of the hairs be loose within three or four days, and then heal it.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you wish, remove the bandage after the stitch, and heal that with something that dries and constricts, for the eyelid is raised because of the sealing of the bandage and the inflammation of it; but a stitch is better. So therefore we say these things about taxinir.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But let there be rest on the patient, and it is a good operation, and let there not be fear.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	There is another way in taxmir, and it is that you mark on the eyelid the shape of a leaf of mirt, and then raise the eyelid with three hooks separated and gathered according to this shape:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if that is not possible, let the hooks be held, and if it is not straightened, then take an awl in which there is a thread and insert it into the middle of the shape, and insert the other end close to the tear duct, and press between your fingers the hairs with equality, and then with those raise your hand with an equal raising, raise all the area over which it is marked as we have recommended.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then close the two lips of the wound with a stitch, and heal that so that it is cured.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if an ulcer occurs because of your incision or slit, heal the ulcer with ointment and bandages similar to it.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And some times it happens to the eyelid that its hairs are turned inward, so then use what we have said about incision; but a stitch in every case is more natural.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Taxinir with cannula is according to this form:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And it is that you turn the eyelid and split the figure that is within according to what has been described; and then with skill make two cannulae or two thin probes of which their length is according to the length of the eyelid and their width is less than the width of the spatula.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already split at the ends of some of these parts where you have threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then gather each one with subtlety under what overflows of the eyelid of the eye, and press the cannulae in some places with strong pressure, and let it be for several days, for the eyelid because of the pressure will die and become black and fall off when you remove it.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it is delayed, then cut it with tweezers, and then heal the wound so that it is cured.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	So when it is healed, the eyelid is raised and the hairs do not sting.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the form of two cannulae which you will make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and have the quantity of length and width neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Of raising warts by the hole with a needle when the wart is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the warts are unnatural, hard, rough and painful to the touch, then the operation to be performed on them is to take a thin needle and pierce it into that sensitive spot of the wart very gently, and then tie off its extremities with thread very gently.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the thread be about the size of a palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then tie another thin thread beneath it quickly, and knot the ends of that one if you wish.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then let the patient hold his head in your lap, and be near the sun so that your work is revealed, for it is a subtle and delicate operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle into the root of the wart which has need of skill, and let it penetrate the eyelid rapidly while you pull that one above the natural wart out.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the wart up from below and insert that into an ointment, and let there be one or two or three warts, and no more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand away so that the wart is forgotten with the ointment in the eyelid with the natural wart.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if it is drawn out with the ointment and the wart is not extracted, you shall draw out the ointment to the sides below with the thread which you have tied to it so that in being drawn out, the ointment of the tract remains above.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And wipe that with the vision of the eye, for then you will extract the ointment and the thread, and let each one and close the eye, and leave the clot for two or three days so that the wart adheres to its place and grows over good flesh.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the wart is more short, then take a long hair from one of the natural hairs and let it be elevated with that, or let the thread enter so that it is drawn out to some length, and then you elevate that.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Of the cure of a wart which comes in the eyelid above.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When a wart comes in the eyelid, and is contraction of the eyelid when it is drawn inwards to one side or the other, through bad consolidation of plague or of scars or of cauterization, and is called leporine, and this wart is either natural or accidental, and is made through consolidation of plague or of scars or cauterization, or through likenesses to them badly cured.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The way of the operation on it is that you split that consolidation and separate its lips, and place in it what is between a fold of linen cloth, and tie those so that they are healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And do not think that you use cure of it from the causes which dry up, constrict; for if you do that, it returns with pustule worse than at any time before.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use in that of causes which soften like fenugreek, and moisten with the water in which there are roots of it, or ointment dyaquilon, which should be liquified with some of the oils, and immerse in that the fold, and cure with that.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the secret of your cure is that you pierce with complete skill so that it is not consolidated according to its form at the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation which we have said, is not but some rectification of ehalixacrati which does not return the form of its place according to what it was before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the cure of a wart which is made in the eyelid below.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This alxacrati which is made in the eyelid below, which is named veritably alxacrati; and it is of one natural, another accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	But accidental is made through plague or through split or cauterization or through other likenesses.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the way of the operation on it is that you take a needle in which there are double threads, and place that in the flesh, and let it pass from the tear duct on the left into the tear duct on the right, so that the thread comes to both extremities of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	And then extend the flesh to the sides above with the needle and sew that with the needle, and insert with spatulum ample.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And so if it returns the shape of the eyelid according as you wish, well then; and if not, take the needle and place that in the split figure, and with that turn the eyelid, and split the two fissures on the sides of the eyelid below.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And let the extremities of the two fissures be of two angles of the incision which you have made so that they meet, and be made of them an angle between which when they are gathered together is made figure.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is Greek letter: lambda.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And then stitch the flesh that by the quantity it is the side of it acute below it, that which closes the eyelid.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then sew those parts separated and heal them with what we have said of the medicines softening and of the poultices so that they are healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if alxacrati comes through split or suture or cauterization, then you shall split with a flat split over the hairs of the eyelid according as it is preceded.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	And then separate with the poultice between two lips according as we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the sum of the speech of the cure of alxacrati when it is above or below, let there run in it operation according as it is prepared from the form of alxacrati, and that is in form of many differences.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the wise artisans prepare skill in every way which is possible to them so that they make return the figure to the natural form or near it, and the patient according as it suits him of the operation and of the instruments in the greater dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adhesion of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or to the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation happens to many men in whom the eyelid is solidified more above with the albumen of the eye, and it is prohibited from the facility of its movement and of its natural works, then you insert the extremity of the needle below the eyelid, and elevate it upwards, or extend that with the nail.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.
