And then you insert the adhesion with spatulum subtle which does not have the sharpness of the incisions, having obtuse a little so that the patient is not disturbed after the operation, and remove the spatulum that it does not hurt the eye by its sharpness.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And let your incision which cuts out that adhesion with facility so that the eyelid is returned according to its natural form and that all the adhesion be healed.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And then you put in the eye salted water with which you wash it; or distill in it zunia dissolved in water.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And then separate between the eyelid and the eye with poultice of linseed, and place over the eye wool infused in albumen of egg, and on the third day use causes consolidating so that it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	Of incision of nail and of eminence of flesh of the tear ducts.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Know that the nail is according to two manners; for it is nervous, and is similar to hard chaff subtile; or it is not-nervous, similar to white moisture congealed, which when the iron touches it, or it is forced to take by needle, is cut off and the needle is not placed in it.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both species do not begin unless from the tear duct major so that there goes little by little covering the view and forbid light and the movement of eye.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	The manner of proceeding in the examination is that the patient inclines his head to you, and then you open his eyes, and raise the eyelid with your hand, and then collect the fingernail with tweezers and extend it to the parts above.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	Then take a needle and insert into it a hair of horse or bullock or cow, or similar, or strong bile, or double the end of the needle little by little and push that into the nail, and pierce with the needle the nail; and extract with bile the nail; and extend that to the parts above, and with the hair scrape the sides of the nail which touches the pupil.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And so you follow that with the hair into the back of his eye.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And then you insert the remainder into the root of the tear duct with a fine spatula or small forceps, and cut the flesh of the tear duct naturally so that through its incision it does not cause continuous flow of tears.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the nail with the sole tweezers extended or with bile, thus as we have said; and then is scraped with a spatula lion whose form this is:
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And be careful that with the spatula you do not touch the cornea and that it cause rupture in him, and that the pupil be perforated.
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	Then the incision releases into the eye a little trimmed salt or made of cinammon, and let that remain until the next day; and then cure that with water that covers it so that it may heal.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	And if the nail is not nervous and you cannot put the needle into it, or it is not pierced with the tweezers, then many times this kind of nail is cured with medicines, and is healed thus as an eye, and is described in the division.
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	And if you want to split that, then open the eye of the patient and take a fine spatula lion with file sharpened according to this form:
am subtilitat.	with subtlety.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if you see that it is rarefied and withdrawn and it has taken root in the eye, then distil from your mouth into the eye made of cinammon or with fine roe or with trimmed salt, and cover the eye until the next day.
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat the operation until all that is of it is removed, unless a cautery wound be in the eye, for then you cut that and cure at the beginning the apostema until it heals.
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat your operation on that with reason until it is healed.
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	The membrane of the tear duct, if noted in the eye from great harm, is suspended with tweezers; and insert that from one part, and do not finish the incision so that it does not cause flow of tears.
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	And then distil into the tear duct fine roe or made of cinammon until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter .xvii.
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	Of incision of algusardenic and what is born of flesh pressed in the eye.
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	Sometimes in the eyes of some people there is born red flesh and it lies on top covering the pupil, or drawn near or stretched out upon the eyelids and strongly press the eyelids to the parts outside and it is attached like a bullet wound.
Mays la operacio en lu es que·l malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se; e aprop obre les huels de aquel e colligeys tota aquela carn am oncis convenientz ad aquo, e te aquo am una forcep o am cesti; e aprop inscindiys la carn el comensament entro que tot sia finit am le encisori, e guarda te del huel que no ledescas aquel deves la tua operacio.	But the operation on him is that the patient inclines his head to you; and then open his eyes and collect all of that flesh with convenient tweezers for that, and hold that with a forceps or basket; and then cut the flesh at the beginning until it is all finished with the scissors, and be careful of the eye not to injure that after your operation.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	And let your incision be with which you cut those or with a spatula which we have recommended in the incision of the nail, or with small forceps with which ashbell is collected according to the form of it; this chapter will tell you.
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	Then when your incision is completed and all that flesh is withdrawn, then fill the eye with trimmed salt, or distill into it red powder and similar to it of the medicines which are corrosive, and place over the eye outside a piece of eggshell until it is secured from cautery wound.
E si roman alcuna causa de alguardenici e es senhoragat sanc caut, e temes apostema caut, lahoras leyssa le huel e cura aquela apostema am aquo que ceda aquela apostema, e aprop itera sobre aquel am operacio entro que sia sanat, e semblantment fay en la carn ajustada la qual accideys en le huel de aquesta especia.	And if there is any cause of algusardenic and there is lordotic wound cautery, and you fear cautery wound, then cut the eye and cure that wound with what releases that wound; and then repeat on it the operation until it is healed, and similarly do in the flesh which lies upon the eye of this kind.
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	But however you see that all cure of the eye is done by natural or accidental way, doing with iron, and do not put your hand in any of these operations unless you see that this member suffers those operations.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter .xviii.
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	Of collection of ashbell in the eye.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	Red veins which are tested upon the eye and prohibit its operation, and they darken the eye over the course of days.
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	Therefore it is necessary at the beginning that you consider if the eye in which there is ashbell is strong and in it there is not another disease than ashbell, then collect that ashbell.

o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	or so two pairs of tweezers gradually inclining one to the other according to this form:
E aprop sian colligidas aquelas venas am forses subtils, am subtilitat, e abstergeys le sanc hora aprop hora, entro que vegas aquelas venas esser remaugudas del huel e sian revolgudas.	And then let those veins be collected with fine forces, with subtlety, and wipe the blood now and again, until you see those veins are withdrawn from the eye and are rolled up;
E guarda te que tu no ledes le huel am las extremitatz del spatum; e si’ la tua operacio en le miegjorn denant le solelh, e sias mot ferm en la tua operacio que no inscidas sino aquelas venas.	And be careful that you do not injure the eye with the end of the spatula; and if your operation is on the left side before the sun, and keep it firm in your operation and do not pierce except those veins.
E quan tu auras complitz, lahoras tu distilla en le huel cief vert o rog per que am sa acuitat corrodesca aquo que es remaugut del sabel.	And when you have finished, then distill into the eye fine green or roe so that with its sharpness it may corrupt what is withdrawn of the ashbell.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible colligeys tot en aquela hora, e lahoras tu emplastra tot am aquo que cede la dolor de lu, e leyssa lu per alcus dias entro que sia sedada la dolor de lu e que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	But if it is not possible for you to collect all of that in that hour, then you plaster all with what releases his pain, and let him for several days until his pain is calmed and he is secured from cautery wound.
E aprop itera sobre lu segon que la mateyssa manieyra entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat on him according to the manner in which it was healed.
E aquesta es la forma de las forfexs:	And this is the form of the tweezers:
Capitol .xix.	Chapter .xix.
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	Of reduction of arizati to the nose.
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you heal arizati with cautery or with acute medicine burning according to the previous narration of it and is not healed, then do not put anything in it except that you open the wound because of its maturity, and extract all the humidity which is in it and the pus until its bone is uncovered.
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then when the bone is uncovered and you see in it corruption or blackness, then scrape it with an instrument of which this is the form:
E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent).	And it is formed of rough iron and let the end be rounded thus with a file or ground with a pointed file (thus as in the following form).
E pausa aquel sobre le loc corrumput del os, e aprop revolveys aquel entre les tieus ditz, e prem la tua ma petit a petit entro que sapias que aquela corropcio es rasa.	And place that over the rotten part of the bone and then roll that between your fingers and press your hand little by little until you know that the corruption is rasped.
E aquo sia fayt alcunas veguadas, e aprop restaura le loc am causas exsiccativas e stipticas.	And let that be done several times, and then restore the part with astringent and styptic causes.
Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat.	Then if the place is consolidated and there is born good flesh in it and the body of the wound has been separated from the sania and he has stood for 40 days, and is not renewed nor cauterized nor happens to him accident, then you know that it is healed.
E sino, lahoras no es en lu engen sino reduzir la fissura a la forma del nas, e segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu descuebras de segon os am ferr o am medicina acuta, e cum sira descubert le os, lahoras tu pren tribo segon aquesta forma:	And if not, then it is not in him to open the fracture in the shape of a nose, and according to this manner: and you uncover according to bone with iron or with sharp medicine, and with sir discovered the bone, then you take traction according to this form:
Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	Let the extremity of him be triangularly ironed, and his shaft be first extended within the extremity thus with force as well.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le os, e sia aquel prop del lacrimal; e alongua la tua ma un pauc del huel, e aprop revol la tua ma am le tribo entro que penetre tot le os, e aquel sente le malaute per asso que atroba vent yssir per so quan te la sua ma.	And place that against the bone, and let it be close to the tear; and lengthen your hand a little from the hole, and approximately rotate your hand with traction inside so that all of the bone penetrates, and he feels the patient through his ass that atroba wind to exit through there when you place your hand.
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	Then restore the site with astringent medicines, drying as you have been taught.
Donc cum nays la carn e·l loc es endurazit, lahoras la materia la qual effundia a las partidas deforo retorna al nas, donc aquo es pus leugier sobre le malaute.	Then when the flesh and the site has hardened, then the matter which flowed out of the orifices is returned to the nose; therefore here is pus upon the patient.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	Of reduction of the eminence of the hole.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the hole eminences by its totality and not happens in the movement any damage nor decrease, then you must loosen the patient, and let him follow, and let him pause wind in his neck without scarification and suck through good sucking; and then place over the hole liniment which should be made of astringent and aloe and myrrh and sandaraca, and then strengthen the bandage over the hole with soft words.
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the manner of the words is that you take pieces of linen cloth, and each piece be doubled in four folds; and make from those words.
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	And then place those one over another according to the quantity of which has the hole necessity.
E aprop strenh sobre aquels am drap dur am fort strictura; e itera las ventosas am succio ses scarificacio; e aprop osta las ventosas e leyssa le huel streyt le dia e la nueyt.	And then strengthen over those with a hard cloth with strong stricture; and iterate the ventouses with sucking without scarification; and stop the ventouses and let him the hole tight both day and night.
Mays si entretant le liguament es mollificat, lahoras cove que sia mot streyt.	But if meanwhile the ligament is softened, then you must that it be very tight.
E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	And stop the bandage both day and night as we have said.
E si vezes le huel ja esser redusit, bo es, e sino, lahoras itera le emplastre am les polvils e la strictura e las ventosas entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the hole already reduced, good is; and if not, then iterate the bandage with the words and the stricture and the ventouses until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	Of the incision of the eminence of the tunica uvcea.
Quan endeve disrupcio en la tunica uvea, e aprop es eminent e procezeys fora las palpebras ayssi cum un gra de rasim, e es orrazada la forma de home per aquo, e vols aquo inscidir, lahoras la operacio en lu es ayssi cum havem recomtat, que tu entrometas la agula en la razitz de la uvea de la partida dejos en la partida desus, e aprop met la agula autra en la qual sia fil doble de la part del lacrimal, e fay aquela penetrar e leyssa la primieyra agula segon la sua disposicio; e aprop inscideys le loc del fiel doble e leva am aquel la partida de la uvea en le circuit de la agula, e strenh aquela mot.	When disruption in the tunica uvcea, and is eminent and processes out the eyelids thus with a grain of sand, and it is orrazada the form of man by that, and want to that incision, then the operation in him is as we have recommended, that you insert the needle in the root of the uvea of the part below in the part above, and then place the needle another in which is thread double of the part of the tear, and make that penetrate and let the first needle according to its disposition; and then incise the site of the double thread and lift with it the part of the uvea in the circuit of the needle, and strengthen that word.
E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	And then extract the needle and place over the hole wool infused in white vinegar and let it into that the thread falls with the grape.

E alcunas veguadas aduna de tota partida am cercle de drap entro le huel ajuste eminencia gran, e aprop sia perforat am le spatum subtil que vengua al preon del huel, e corra la humiditat albuginea, e descen le huel e intra tantost.	And some few times gather from all party with circle of cloth within the hole adjust eminence great, and then be perforated by the spatula subtle that comes to the preon of the hole, and run the humidity albugineous, and descend the hole and in so far.
E aprop strenh entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio de alconati.	Of cure of alconati.
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This illness that is called alconati is not but putridity which is adjusted in the hole like water descending and it is not that.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	But the manner of doing in it is that you make the patient sit on the seat prepared and straight, and then take his head in your hands of two parts and hold him so that you see the putridity coming to the parts below, and then be dried and not descend, and be obscured the light, and the patient see the causes thus with vision.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not descend below, know that it is water.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	But if not prepared the descent to the putridity with that which we have said, then make the patient sit between your hands and then take spatula subtle and fen him over the panniculus cernent a little from the continuation of the conjunctiva with the tunica cornea in the crown (into the hole whet), until the putridity is pushed out.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	Then when it is pushed out, then you distill in the hole water tail in which you have mixed honey or water in which you have boiled fenugreek and honey.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then be cured by the other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 23.
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	Of the cure of water descending from the hole.
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already said the species of the water in the division and which suits to pierce with sermo declaring, then that according to health.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Then you make him sit between your hands upon a pillow and tie his hole up, he tightly.

And then place close to the eyelid of his hole your left hand, if the hole in which is the water is the left; or with your right hand, if it is the right.

E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	And then place the extremity of almighty close to the crown for the thickness of the thread in the white of the hole from the part of the lesser tear, and then press almighty with force and rotate your hand by that.
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	And then penetrate in the white of the hole and feel that almighty is already come to seen cause.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	And let it be the measure of the way of almighty to the preon the measure of the space which is of the pupil within the end of the blackness, and is the crown of the hole; for you will see with that pupil with the vision of the hole by the clarity of the tunica cornea.

And then place almighty within the site in which is the water, and then you pull it down a little and another, and therefore if the water descend so, then see the patient that on which open his sight so soon, and almighty in his hole.
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	And then rest a little; therefore if the water is descended, then you rest that another before almighty be pulled out.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And therefore when it is dried and not descend, then you extract almighty with facility, and rotate by that your hand a little to little, and then dissolve in the water a little of salt clear of gemma and wash the hole within; and then place outside the hole cotto or stopa or wool infused in rose oil and vinegar with that the hole.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But us and those who so of our time pause over that eaten by white vinegar.

E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And then pierce by that conjuncture, and do not finish your hand in the hole, and it is not unless you make way to almighty site subtle.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And then enter almighty according as we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And the completion of your work, it is prepared for the patient's sleeping place, made in a dark room, in which he sleeps on his back, and all movements are prohibited.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And pause in nature for him so that it is clear his nature, and not harm his head at the right or left side at all.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And be the bandage according to his disposition within the third day.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And properly loosen that in that dark room and expose the wound to view, and show him some causes, and then return the bandage within the seventh day.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And not think that you do this in the time of healing or immediately after the infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	Have care that you displace it so that the water can gently flow through the pipe with ease.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if it happens to be a boil, then loosen the bandage before the seventh day, and rectify that with water so that the boil will subside.

E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And know that in some cases it is not necessary for the disciple to see some things, and then you are anxious about the operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And now it has come to us from some of those who are in the Artach , and some say that they made fire in Ayrac Magdaam by which water is sucked.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	But indeed I have not seen it in our land, nor is it read of in any of the ancient books; and it is possible that it is new.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	And these are the forms of the species of Magdaam for which there is one upon those who ignore them:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	And they are made of iron or steel properly, and their ends be with this subtlety triangularly, the acute end thus with that is the shape.
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter XXIV.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	Of the cure of a wound in the nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When in the nose there are grown diverse meats joined of which is some cause that is assembled to scorpion of mots, or polyp, and this illness is called polypus because it is like that peep represented.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And from him it is cancerous meat, scaly, of dusky colour; and from him it is that it is meat of lion not of dusky colour.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore in that which is in these meats not fraudulent or cancerous, do so the patient open between your fingers and placed in the sun, and open the nose of him, and pierce the tip of the finger in those meats.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then extract that to the forepart, and then you will see that which has been understood from those with a sharp instrument of the one part into which you know that all the meat is removed; for if there remains in him any cause for which the abscission is possible, then you rate that with one of the subtle instruments with facility into which he has not remained any cause.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if it is lorded over with blood or there is a boil, then you place to him that which you will; or if it is of the malignant boils, then cut and cauterize that into which bleeding is abscinded and all the caves are open.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And then it shall be removed from the nose, when the incision is made, with wine and water or vinegar.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and from it proceeds moisture into the palate, then you know that it is healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the moisture does not penetrate according to that which you do, then you know that inside him is meat in the pus sub-bones of the nose to which no abscission has been arrived.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore then do so you interpose bile to him of which there is any grossness, and in him move mots, nuts, and pause between each nut the quantity of the finger or less, and enjoin the patient and interpose one end of the bile in the nose with the ray or another cause by which it is possible to him.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And after that which has been done, let him throw his breath into that which arrives at the canals of the nose, and be breathed over his gullet, for troops like this seem to do this action, and it is a slight cause to that which he wants to do.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then pause the two ends of the bile, one end that goes over the nose and another which goes into the nose, and then administer a scissor of meat with the nuts that are in the bile, and do so until you know that the meat is removed from the nuts of the bile.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then pull out the bile, and pause in the nose the abstraction of blood a sponge , and do so for three days or more until the gum has corroded all that which is separated from the meats.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And then at the end of the cause, pause in the nose a cannula of lead for several days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you find that the cure is exhausted, use that.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument to head-purger with which oils and medicines are distilled in the nose:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And do so from silver or iron, which is like a little open lamp, likewise with a little hole, and the meat similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you want, make a cannula closed likewise with cane, and the cannula of the instrument to head-purger and be flat, uncovered; to which is handle in his arse, with which you have that when you heat in him oil or water that you want of the sucks and the causes.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these head-purgers are precious: take of castor fur, white balsam, ginger, and pepper long, saffron, spikenard, and epithimum, a drachm; Wine with which you will be infused with blood of bled and of cauldron, and there are made pills, and then be tempered a pill with water of tea, and then it shall be inserted in the nose of the patient lying on his back.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of the yls in the ends of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Many times it is born theyl in the ends of the nose, and is magnified and swollen for several days until what is stopped to him.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And because of that you insert that in the commencement of the appearance of him, and withdraw it altogether.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	And then pause over the place or cautery or medicine burning which is in the place of him.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if the incision is delayed until it is magnified, then consider whether it is suppuration, hard, of dusky colour and of little feeling, then do not touch that with iron because it is boil; for many times to that which you insert this suppuration becomes great malice on him who had.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the boil is of the colour not dusky and there is incision possible in all that, then evacuate the patient and insert that without fear, and bind it around until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the suture of the nose and of the lips and of the ear when the connection is dissolved by water or like.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when there happens solution of continuity in one of these cartilages, few confer in that operation unless in some men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore do so when also for some cause of those that you consider whether it is fresh water with his blood, and then join the two lips of the wound with suture, and then heal that until it is healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of the wound have already been separated and each has healed, then you must scrape away any dead flesh from the wound so that it may bleed.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then, tie the two lips of the wound together tightly and put on powdered dragon's blood and crushed aspen wood over it, then apply a layer of diafinicon plaster or one of the other consolidative plasters, and leave it on for two or three days, then remove that plaster and replace it with another, and leave it on until the flesh has healed naturally.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the manner of the suture is to bring the wound together or with needles as we have recommended in the suture of the belly, or bring the wound together with thread in such a way that you and your assistant know how it was done.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter .XXVII.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the extraction of those causes that come from both lips within the wounds.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Many times in these wounds between the lips of men you will find certain hard bumps resembling grains of ergot, and some are small while others are large.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, you must turn the lips inside out and cut into each of those hard bumps from all sides, then fill the wound with powdered sage until the bleeding is stopped, then wash the wound with wine vinegar and treat it with something astringent until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter .XXVIII.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of incision of the flesh pressed against the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Often there is flesh pressed against the gums, which the ancients called albus, so you must lift that up with a hook or what you have there, and cut it at its root, and let the pus flow out or the blood.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	Then place powdered sage or other astringent or drying powders on the wound.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh comes back, cut it again secondly, and cauterize it, because then the cautery will not let it come back.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter .XXIX.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of reason of teeth with iron.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When there are rough, sharp sores on the surface of the teeth in the wounds and holes between the gums and also within the gums, some are black and are made yellow or green by corruption of the gum and the teeth are made loose.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	Therefore, you must put the patient between your knees and hold his head in place, and pull the teeth in which those sores appear and the causes seem like sand so that no cause remains inside them, and this removes the blackness and yellowing and others until they are cleansed.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	Therefore, if that is the end of what is in the beginning of the root, then that is good; but if not, then you must go back over the root on those teeth again and again on the second and third day until it reaches the final state that you want.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth have many needs for various tools of different shapes according to how they are prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And therefore the file with which the tooth is filed for the wound between the teeth is another type of file than that used to file between the teeth according to other forms, and you should prepare those types of files which you will see immediately.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter .XXX.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of extraction of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	You must cure the tooth of its pain by all means and delay at all costs in complete extraction of it, because there is no cause that exceeds the appearance of it when it has been extracted, for it is a subtle substance that is an obstacle in its extraction.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But when the patient is forced to have that tooth extracted, then you must be certain which is the painful tooth, for many times the pain deceives the patient and it appears to be in a healthy tooth, and you extract it and yet the pain does not cease until the painful tooth has been extracted, because we have seen this through the operation of the barbarians.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, when you are certain which is the painful tooth and that you know it, then you must scrape around the circuit of the tooth with a spatular in which there is some virtue so that it dissolves the tooth from the gum entirely all around, and then pull it out by its roots with your fingers or with fine forceps little by little until you loosen it.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then grab it tightly with strong fingers or strong pliers, and hold the patient's head steady so that he does not move, and pull the tooth according to the right method so that you do not break it or give the patient greater pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And if there is a cavity, then take one of those instruments and put it below the tooth from all sides with ease and force the extraction of it just as it was done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is cracked or hollow, then you must fill that crack with a piece of cloth and squeeze it with the end of a thin rod so that it is not broken when you tighten it on it with your fingers.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And you must open it widely with a scarification around the circuit of all parts of the gum and be very careful that you do not break it or tear it apart, and return to the patient because the first pain of it is great.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And be careful that you do not do what some ignorant barbers do in their haste and audacity in the extraction of them, for they do not follow what we have recommended; because many times they bring great illnesses on men which are very difficult to cure, and their roots are all worn away or some of them, or that you extract it with certain bones of the jaw just as we have tested.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And then the extraction of it should be washed with wine cauterium or vinegar with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if blood flows out of it, therefore, as we have said before, take some quantity of salt and sprinkle it on the wound, and if that salt does not stop the bleeding, cauterize it.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The shape of the forceps and thin tongs with which the tooth is extracted at the beginning should be long, narrow-tipped and thick, so that they do not bend when you operate with them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And let them also be as wide of handle in the middle so that when you tighten them they do not bend, they should be short in length.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And let them be made of Indian iron forged and hammered, and in their tips be teeth with which the others bite into each other and tighten with a strong descent, and sometimes the tips of those are the shape of the beak of an owl, so it is hooked, and they are of strong constriction.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter .XXXI.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Of extraction of teeth and the dislocation of the bones of the jaws that are broken.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you must extract a tooth that is broken due to some cause, then you should hold the wound closed with a bandage for one or two days until the wound is softened; and then use the instrument or forceps whose tips are joined together like the beak of an owl or hooked, the shape of the forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	Their tips should be made with pliers or a file.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if it does not obey you with those forceps or tongs, then you should cut into the root and strip away all the flesh and put in the instrument called the lever, which is a short lever whose shape is as follows:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	Let there be a small one of short thickness, and not so wet that it is not broken.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore if through this the vein is cut, it is good; and if not, use some other instrument of which these are the forms: The form of the first instrument is triangular in its extremity, and in which there should be some thickness.
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it should have a triangular and very fine point.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And now you are helped with this instrument having two spikes, and whose form is as follows:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and with other instruments which are used in pulling teeth; for it is done with this instrument which is like the jaw of a large animal, and this is its form:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	of the triangular bent point, short or curved, and in which there should be some thickness, and not wet enough to break.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And another wisdom is that the instruments of the teeth move and are like other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the wise and subtle artist will find for himself many ways according to what he learns from the operation and various illnesses; for there are various illnesses which the ancients did not describe or use proper instruments for because of their different shapes.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the bone of the jaw or other bones in the mouth are broken, then the foot must be cured where it is convenient with some of those instruments and forceps which we mentioned in the extraction of teeth roots, and use the action for which this is the form:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And some thickness must be applied little by little, and the hole held closed with the mouth so that it does not open or escape until all the bone is healed; then restore the area with appropriate medicines for this.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if it is a small fracture, then cut away the fracture and the blackness from it, and cure the area inside until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter XXXII.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the cure of teeth protruding above others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth protrude not according to their natural shape, and especially when they do so in women, and especially in older women, then you should consider: if the tooth is next to another tooth and there is no way of closing or binding it, then cut it; but if the tooth is next to another tooth, then drill it with this instrument whose form is like a pig's jaw, and which is made from Indian steel with a very fine point.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And your drilling should be such that you drill it for several days according to the hardness of the tooth, and that none of the other teeth are harmed.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the protruding tooth is worn away by grinding, then grind it with an Indian steel file whose form is as follows:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And all of it is made from Indian steel, and the point is very fine; and it is like small needles, and with the file which is used to make needles, the tooth is ground little by little over several days with ease, so that no other tooth is harmed or worn away.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	Then line it at the end, and cut it with a very sharp razor.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if the tooth of which one side is broken and cuts the tongue, then you should grind it until that fracture is flattened and rounded off, so that the tongue is not cut nor the speech impaired.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of restoring broken teeth with gold or silver foil.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When teeth are knocked out and broken due to a blow or fall, and the patient cannot chew, and your cure with styptic medicines has not helped, then in order that they do not rot, they must be strengthened with gold foil rather than silver, for silver turns black and rots within a few days, but gold never changes.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the foil should be so fine and thick according to how much can fit between the teeth; and the form of the repair is that you take the foil and place twice as much between two healthy teeth, and then it grows with two curves of the foil between two broken teeth, or if one or more are broken, until it reaches the healthy tooth on the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	Then repeat the bonding inside at the break from which you started, and strengthen your work with ease and skill so that none of it is broken.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And your bonding should be such that you bond the foil so that it does not open at the roots of the teeth.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	Then cut away the excess foil with tweezers or pliers, and add those to each location with action, and cover them over and conceal them between the healthy tooth and the broken tooth, so that they do not harm the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	Then let it be bound thus tightly with thread.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loose or torn, strengthen it or those with another foil in the same way at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the repair of two healthy teeth and two broken teeth, as they are bound thus:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when one or two teeth fall out and return to their places, and are regrow thus as we have described, and rot again:
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	Then let it not be done except by a wise artist.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes it is appropriate to use some cause of cow bones, and it is made in the form of a tooth, and placed in the hole from which the tooth fell out, and strengthened as we have said, and remain and serve with that for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter XXXIV.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the cutting of the ligature which appears in the tongue, and prohibited speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligature which appears under the tongue sometimes naturally, or accidentally occurs due to a blow which has already healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation is to open the mouth of the patient, and lift up his jaw bone which is under his tongue; and then insert that nervous ligament according to its breadth so that the tongue is released from its binding.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or knotting in it, and that is due to the hardening of a blow, then you cut and split it according to its breadth so that you have split the ligament and the knot is dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful that there is not any fissure in the flesh of the jaw, and that you split only the membrane, and there is a flow of blood.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	Then let it be washed with vinegar or with sour wine, and then place the tongue in its socket, so that there is a wound which the patient does not close so that it is not healed again.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if blood flows, then place a piece of charred wood over the hole; but if the blood stops, then cauterize the hole with a cautery which is appropriate for this.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	Then let it be cured by the other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Of the extraction of a ranula under the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes there occurs under the tongue an abscess which resembles a small lump, and it prevents the tongue from its natural movement, and when it is enlarged and fills the mouth:
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation is to open the mouth of the patient and examine the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it of a dusky or black colour, hard, to which the patient does not respond with feeling, then do not touch it for it is rotten.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is white, and moist, then place the tip of the needle in it, and split it with a very fine point; and if blood flows while you are operating, then pause over it with charred wood, so that the blood is stopped.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then return to your task, washing the wound with wine and salt, and treat it with another ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of an abscess from both ears, and that which occurs in the throat, and of other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When there is swelling in the throat, there are glands which are united like cotton, and which become enlarged and are called two ears; when you treat them with what we have said in the division, and they do not heal, then consider whether the abscess is hard, of dusky color, and of little feeling; then touch it not with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of red color and the root is large, then touch it not with iron through the flow of blood; before you let that be matured, either you will pierce that or it will burst by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of white color, soft and the root of it subtle, then that one is to be incised.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation upon it is that you consider, before your operation, whether the abscess has rested with complete rest or if it has diminished by any diminution; and then let the patient lie before the sun, his head in your lap, and open his mouth, and the servant take hold of his tongue with his hands, away from the instrument most noble of which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it shall be made of silver or of bronze, and it shall be subtle like a needle.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Therefore when you press with that the tongue and it is shown to you the abscess, and put upon that your instrument, then take hold of it and insert that into the hole outward as far as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another one is that you pull on some of the membranes; then incision that with an instrument of which this is the form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and it is like tweezers, except that the ends of it are curved so that the openings of each one is in the direction of the other, very sharp, and it shall be made of iron tempered hard.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not present to you, then incision that with spatulum of which this is the form: And it shall be sharp on one side, not sharp on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And after you have incised one part, incision the other according to this manner of incision, and then let the patient recuperate from water rubbed on.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there ensues a flow of blood, recuperate with water of decoction of husk of pomegranate or leaf of mallow, and similar to that from the causes constrictive until the flow of blood is restrained, and then cure that until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes in the throat there are other abscesses other than those two ears; and incision them according to what you see and say in the incision of two parts alike.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I was once treating a woman of an abscess which was occurring in her throat; and that abscess was of dusky color, of little feeling, which had closed her throat, and the woman was breathing with difficulty, and she had prohibited eating and drinking water, and she was brought to the point of death unless she had stood for one or two days.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And that abscess had grown so much that it had made two holes through which pus was flowing.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Therefore I cut the throat carefully and put in one of them a probe, and drew out that pus and a great part of it, and then I incision the other side from where I understood the other tract; and then I opened the mouth of him, and grasped his tongue, and then I put the probe into that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I cut out a great part of it, and there flowed from it only a little blood.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Therefore the throat of that woman was completely opened, and she began at once to drink water, and then to take food; therefore I did not cease to incision that abscess many times for a long time, and an abscess succeeded in place of that one which I incision until it was prolonged.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Therefore I had the throat of her cauterized and then sewed it up, therefore from that I walked around and did not know what God made of that one.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	Of incision of membrane when it is abscessed.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When catarrh occurs in the uvula, and it is abscessed and is long, then it is named perpendicular; and if it is at its lower part thick and round, then it is named buba.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is healed with what you have said in the division and your treatment does not confer, and then there occurs that the abscess cauterized is last from her and is subtle; and if it is to that length and is bloody, of dusky color or black, and is not to him sensible, then beware that you incision it for in that one is fear over the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see that according to the manner that I have said of its whiteness and length, then make the patient lie down and press his tongue with an instrument of which you have described the form, and then put the probe in the new one, and draw that downward and incision it with one of two instruments of which you have said in the incision of two parts.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And beware that you incision it except what is adjusted over the natural term for addition, for if you incision from it more, you will break his speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And then the incision, use what we have recommended in the incision of two parts, and cure that one until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient was frightened by the incision of him, beware that you use gentleness in the cauterization of him without fear, and the manner of the cautery in him is only with sharp water; and it shall be that you lay the head of the patient in your lap, and then press his tongue with the instrument which we have said, and then take of the water which we have said in the chapter of cauterization, and confer with that live cause, and pause that not thick nor subtle, and of that fill the concavity of the instrument of which this is the form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the end of it be hollow in which is paused the medicine as with the concavity of spoon of ray; and pause the instrument with the medicine over the uvula, and the patient let lie on his side so that flow saliva or mucilage of the mouth of him because no any cause descend over the throat of him and that it thaws that.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.
