And then hold your hand with the medicine, and express that over the uvula for the space of a half hour until you see that to be blackened and dulled by the biting of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take thread and wrap that over the end of the ray; and immerse the thread in the medicine and insert the ray with the thread into a cannula of above so that the thread adheres in that cannula, and do that as many times until you accomplish what you wish of the cauterization of the grape, and then let it dry that for three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if indigestions that repeat the medicine, repeat that, and then the cauterization cleanse in the circuit of the grape with thread immersed in wine, and cleanse with that what is in the circuit of it of the medicine; and be washed with rubbed water, and be cured with ointment, and teeth with remedies until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of cure is more safe than incision and longer lasting in terms of fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is cured by something more subtle than cauterization and incision; it is cured by sub-fumigation in this way: take calamus, hyssop, oregano, rue, Arabic thistles, camomile, bromides, and similar ingredients from among the herbs, and prepare all of those things, or some of them, in a bowl, and let them be submerged in agreeably sour wine, and let the wine boil; and let the bowl be properly luted, and let there be a hole in the middle of the bowl through which an appropriately-shaped instrument made of silver or copper is placed; it should be made of silver or copper.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And the end of this instrument is inserted into the patient's mouth so that the steam rises to the uvula over the glottis, as the uvula becomes very fogged up.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And you should repeat this several times until it is dry; be careful not to perform this cure during the beginning of an appetite for food, because it will increase the appetite too much; rather, you should wait until after he has eaten something.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if you do not have this instrument available, then take a reed and attach some wool to its end, so that the patient's mouth is filled, because the wool prevents the steam from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this cure is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of thorns and what adheres in the gullet, and other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Many times there are adherences in the gullet or a thorn in the throat or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Therefore, you should extract whatever is visible there, by pressing the tongue with an instrument in front of the sun, so that what is in the throat will be revealed to you.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And if what is hidden in the throat is not apparent to you, then make the patient vomit before the food has digested in the stomach; because often the cause of an obstruction in the gullet is thrown up by vomiting; or the patient should swallow a piece of soap or a piece of lettuce stem or a piece of dry bread; or he could take a piece of dried sea sponge, and chew it hard while spitting out the saliva, and then press his throat with your hand, because when this reaches the place where there are thorns, they will come out.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	Or take an eel and chew it with vinegar, and let it be inside the mouth and spit it out; or take a pig's ear and chew it and then spit it out.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if they are not dislodged by the causes we have mentioned, then use a lead instrument in the following shape:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And the point should be made with a plucker, and the point should be larger than the rest of it; and in the end of it there should be a concavity which you insert into his throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And let him hold his head up, and be careful not to touch the bone of his throat, so that it does not push against the bone or the thorn, or that the doctor with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But let the patient himself put it in, according to his knowledge of where the obstruction is located and let him press down from above, and pull up the instrument with his hand, according to the amount by which he is prepared for it to be dislodged.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of blood clots from the gullet.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When blood clots are treated with what we have said in the division of cures by medicines and not by cauterization, then look to the gullet of the patient from above, as you press his tongue with an instrument which we recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore if you see the blood clot, extract it with a small needle or with very fine tweezers, gently and decently.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to extract it with that, then take a hollow reed and insert it into the patient's gullet, and then place a red hot iron in the concavity of the reed, and do this as many times as necessary (as long as the blood clot is dead and comes out of his throat), and let the patient abstain from drinking water for the whole day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a rag wet with water, and wipe his mouth with it; and do not spit out any of the water and let him sip the water little by little with his hand, because the blood clot will come right away when he feels the water.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not dislodged by what we have recommended, then sub-fumigate the patient with camphor or asafoetida through the instrument which we recommended in the sub-fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, as long as it is necessary.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another way of operating with sub-fumigation: take a bowl in which are burning coals and the bowl should be covered with a cloth in the middle of which there is a hole, and fix the end of the instrument in that hole; then do the sub-fumigation; and let the patient close his mouth over the end of the reed, so that the sub-fumigation does not escape as long as you know that the sub-fumigation has reached the blood clot, because the blood clot will come right away.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not come out, then repeat the sub-fumigation many times; and let the patient abstain from drinking, and eat salty causes and alms, and do not drink water; and if this treatment is followed, then the blood clot will be dislodged.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which blood clots are extracted from the gullet when they are seen; and it is similar to tweezers except for the fact that there is some curvature in it.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	This should be inserted into the gullet, and its end is similar to a stork's beak, which is hooked, so that when it grasps something, it does not let go; therefore, when you press on some cause, it will not slip.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the tongue in regard to obstructions and their sections.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Obstruction are of many kinds, according to what is remembered by us in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in their penetration and sections by two methods: the first is by the nature of obstructions themselves; and by what we understand from moisture.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is by the places where they occur: for example, an obstruction that accidentally occurs in the head is different from one that accidentally occurs in the anus; and an obstruction that occurs in a fleshy part is different from one that occurs in a joint; and each of them is treated by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And there are some obstructions which do not need to be penetrated, but only the maturation of the pus in them or the completion of them.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	There are also obstructions which do not need to be punctured but only the maturation of the pus in them or their completion: or they are near a joint, for when an obstruction occurs near a joint, its nature is prolonged by the parts around it and it strongly corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint; or it is near the main member, so if you delay its penetration until it matures, then it will corrupt the main member; or it is near the anus, so do not puncture it until it matures.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	May you know the time of the piercing of the pustule, and that is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you will know that it has matured when there is a lessening of the pain and fever, and also a decrease in redness and pulse, and a sharp point to the head of the pustule, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And you will know that the piercing has been successful when it occurs in the lowest place of the pustule and pus comes out from the healing of the prominence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the piercing should always be done along the length of the skin or body, if the pustules are on the palms of the hands or soles of the feet, and in places of the veins, nerves, or arteries; and, finally, in any place where there is no reflection; for in those places where there is a reflection, use piercing according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the pustule is on fleshy tissue, it is better to let the piercing be done within it as it has been stated; for if you pierce that which precedes it, the body of it is prolonged and the pus flows out from it along with a lot of thick matter, and its lips are hardened and the depth of it.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some pustules should be pierced according to the width of the skin or body, depending on the necessity, or according to that member from which one suffers.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you must administer a small piercing on the smaller pustules, and for the larger pustules, a large and ample piercing or many piercings according to the variety of their sizes.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And there are others that are pustules in which the cord is hollow and has been cut, when it is done so that a pan is made from it, that is, as much as one can make from a horse's hoof, or from a bullock's hoof, or even more.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And there are those that are cut with a three-pronged incision, and there is one in which it is cut like the shape of a fern leaf, just as the pustules on the angles of the nose.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And there are those in which a round incision and a moon-shaped one is administered, and they are similar to those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But if it does not happen like that with superficial pustules, then you must pierce that one with a superficial piercing, or a flat one only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the pustule is large and has already collected a lot of pus, pierce that one and do not be afraid to extract all of its pus at that time; first draw out some from it, then plug up the pustule until the next day, then draw out a larger portion, then do this many times according to its degree until it is fully drained.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of cold nature, or a woman in labor, or a small child, or an old person in weakness, for the animal spirit is many times resolved by the discharge of pus, and soon dies after, then you operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Therefore, keep this chapter with great caution, and when you pierce those pustules, wash the sores, and then consider if the sore of the pustule is little, or is a flat section, then you administer the remedies of lead or of red copper; and if the pustule is large, and its fissures are many, then you must pause the needle in each crack as they come out together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the pustule a part of the cord is abscised or you have hollowed it out all around, then you must complete it with old lead, or with thread made from linen or from lead cloth, just as when one treats pans or roots, without moisture; and strengthen that one on the third day; and then process and cure it with what one uses to heal sores.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if blood flows in the hour of your operation, then you must administer water mixed with vinegar and wine in which a cloth of lead has been soaked, and place that over the location of the flow of blood many times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the flow of blood persists, then you must administer remedies and cures and powders which I have mentioned in many places in this book and its divisions.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in the winter time, and the location of the pustule is the site of many nerves, then you must mix powder with wine and oil that is hot, and place those on the locations.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in the summer, and the locations are fleshy, then you must place powders that have been moistened with water and oil or wine and oil on them; and let all of this be done until the third day, just as we have said, and then you must dissolve the pustule and wash it and administer to its cure whatever is convenient for it.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And that is what is necessary for the knowledge of the cure of pustules universally, but according to the way of distinction I have already said about every pustule in which manner is the way of its cure specifically.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the section of pustules that come in the cord of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the cord of the head are small pustules, and they are of the nature of joints which contain membranes that are to them attached; and their nature is varied.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And from them are bumps, and from those are those that contain moisture similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And from those are ones that contain moisture similar to powder, and they resemble them in appearance; and from those are ones that are scaly and hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all of them, and in the extraction of those there is no fear, just as when one extracts thorns, it does not contradict the artery.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the section of those is that you express them with an instrument whose shape you see here, the one which is called entremes, as long as you know what it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if that which it contains is moisture, then split that one with a section according to its length by a superficial section according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin the section at line .B to line .G. Therefore, when the moisture has been discharged, then you will scrape that one from which that moisture was evacuated, and do not leave any cause of it behind, for returning many times, if any cause remains.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then immerse it in Egyptian ointment, if it is available, and if not, in water and salt; and fill that with the sore, and let it remain until the next day, for by doing so you will corrode all that remains of that membrane.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then apply ointment on that one again and again if it needs it, until you are confident that no cause of that membrane remains; then cure the sore with ointment until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the pustule contains a fatty nodule, then you must insert that one according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	by section having the form of a crook, and cut the edges between the two lips of the section and scrape that one from all around, and exert your strength in extracting the membrane which contains that one.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if your artery causes a contradiction, then do what I have told you before.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the pustule that is lapified by section and cure according to what I have told you before; and section on pustule that is lapified is pus-like, for it is of little blood and little moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are some of these pustules in the head of some people in whom there is no moisture; and their cause is that one who has struck on a pustule in the head of an old woman and blocked the pustule with a hard, rough, white pebble, which could not be broken, and if he strikes it, it bleeds.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But with other swellings that appear on the head other than this one, which is not in this chapter, such as swellings that come to the heads of infants and behind the ears, the incision of all of these should be superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And make the incision from the lower part of them so that the body is relieved from the disease in the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Then treat those with what is appropriate for that kind of treatment.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the incision of scrofula which occurs on the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	These swellings often appear on the neck and armpits and elbows; and sometimes they appear in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that appear on the neck, and many of them are engendered among themselves, and all scrofula of these is within their own tunic, and so with the nodes and swellings of the head, as we have already described.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the species of these scrofula are many; some of them are stony, and some contain moisture, and some are malignant and do not obey treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in that which you see of good disposition in the Touching, of which the color of that which is manifest is similar to the color of the skin, and is swollen in all parts, and is not annexed by the nerve of the neck, nor by the veins, nor by the artery, and is not deep, then you should investigate that with a superficial cut of the part above to the part below the body of the line of G. between the line of B., and scrape that from all parts, and extend two lips of the skin with your fingernails, or with many nails if you have need of those, as we have said in the swellings of the head, and extract that little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more careful that the vein or nerve not be cut.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the spatula not be very sharp, so that you do not touch your hand with cutting, or disturb the patient, and cut what is not necessary to cut; for if you cut a vein or artery and forbid yourself from your operation, then stop in the wound vinegar tripe or other powders which stop blood fluxes, and tighten the wound, and let that which rests be rested the acuteness of the swelling and let the wound be softened and begin to become pus.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is cut off.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore return to your operation until you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire with your finger if there is any cause of the other little scrofula; therefore cut those and cleanse them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if in the root of the great scrofula is a vein, then you should not cut that scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Before, let that be lifted with strong thread and let it be left until it falls by itself without harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Then fill the wound with old cotton which you have already immersed in Egyptian ointment, and then treat it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you cut that scrofula all the way through, then you should bring together the two lips of the wound and suck at once, so that no superfluity remains.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there has been superfluity due to the size of the scrofula, then you should understand cutting its root, and opening that and administering cauterization and what is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And of those scrofula that contain moisture, pierce that with a superficial incision where it appears to you the place of its maturity, and make an incision of that which is the bottom of the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	Then administer cauterization, with ointment and bandages to those, so that it corrodes what is broken of the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound already cleansed, then treat that with generative flesh ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the incision of the pimple of the swelling within the throat.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients spoke of this incision in the epiglottis, and I have not seen any man in our land who that has been done to him.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the word of those.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men who have squintiness, so that the extraction of the epiglottis is avoided, as it is not made a cure so that all the veins and the major ones of the patient are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have swellings hot in the mouth or throat or two ears, when the disease is not in the gullet, there use the incision of the epiglottis to avoid the loss which is made by piercing.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want this, let us cut the epiglottis below three circles of the circles of the epiglottis, or four with small incision for the breadth in that which is between two circles by quantity; let the incision be in the membrane, not in the cartilage, and that location is convenient to incision, because it is deprived of flesh, and the vessels of blood from him are open.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the patient is fearful, then let him extend the skin of the throat with his fingernail, and then split the skin so that he comes to the gullet, but avoid the blood vessels if he sees from those any cause.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	Then cut the cricoid according to what we have recommended; and it is signified over the incision of the gullet by the flame which comes out from that which is from him broken and by the abrasion of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And let the wound remain open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore when the hour is healed in which piercing is feared, bring together two lips of the skin of the wound, and sew that only over the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	Then administer medicines which make flesh to grow within so that it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the sum of the word which we have recommended, exposure is not unless you see some of those swellings have oppressed the throat of the patient, and the patient has come into death, and his breath is choked, and some go to cut the epiglottis so that the patient breathes the breath over the location of the wound by any respiration, and he is saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for that command to leave the wound open until the wickedness of the disease is consumed; and the wickedness of it is for three days; and then therefore command to sew the wound, and treat that within so that it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And that which I have seen by my physicians is that one servant press a knife into his throat and cut in there a part of the pipe of the lung, and he was called to the cure of him, and choked the breath so as it is choked of the dead, and opened the wound and choked the blood which was coming from the wound.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore he confessed that that had not cut a vein nor artery, and the wind issued from the wound, and he treated that within so that fire was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And I did not believe the servant unless he had put his finger into his throat, and then after some days he returned to the place of his dispositions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	Now I say that in the incision of the epiglottis there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of incision over swelling which occurs in the throat, and it is called hernia of the throat.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This swelling named hernia of the throat is great swelling according to the color of the body, and it happens in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And there are two types of gout, one that is natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	The natural type cannot be cured.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	The accidental type occurs in two forms; one is like fatty nodules and the other is like an abscess caused by a nodule of an artery, and there is fear with that one.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And one should not make an incision on him with a knife except in the case where it is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And examine him and if you find it like a fatty nodule and not attached to any of the veins, then open that up just like the nodes and remove everything inside from the skin and bursa; but if it is examined throughout his entire being and it is cured by what remedy goes inside so that it may heal.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the sections of the types of nodules.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are many types of nodules, and I have already described all of their types in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And one should thus account for the difference between a nodule and an ulcer as long as there is doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore I say that with an ulcer there is heat, fever and violent pains until the ebullition of the superfluity ceases; it is completed putrefaction, and then the fever, pain and heat cease as well.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But with a nodule, there is no heat or fever or pain, and it contains that which the lion has in its throat, a proper sac.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And they are according to the color of the body, and their origin is with a hernia, and they are made in such a way that it can be major or minor; and they are of two types: either fatty and containing moisture, and the colors of moisture are many, according to what I described in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when one arrives at the cure of nodules, he should probe and investigate it to its origin with an instrument that is called an introme, according to its form in the chapter that is next.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And it is the method of investigation of ulcers and all nodules; take this instrument and insert it into the most moist part of the ulcer, and rotate your fingers with it little by little until you know that the instrument has penetrated the membrane.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	Then close your hand according to the size of the ulcer and extract the instrument and consider what has come out in its wake.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if moist matter of any color comes out, then open it up with a superficial incision as I have said for the other ulcers.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if you do not get moisture from the instrument's passage, then know that it is fatty.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry it out with an incision in the shape of a cross according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	In the same way that it is taught, and suspend it with pins, and scrape away the membrane from every part with ease, and guard the skin or sac, if you can, on it, and extract that pus with the nodule.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken in the operation and it is not possible to extract that pus all at once, then take it in bits so that no cause remains within him.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	Because if any cause remains within him, a little or a lot, the nodule will return according to the most.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that some little part remains within him, then complete the wound with some powdered caustic and strengthen the wound, and place over it what creates an ulcer cautery, and cure it by another remedy until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large nodule, then cut its two lips and cure it with that which incarnates.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if the vein is pulsatile or not, then cut and pour into that place a mixture of three parts vetiver oil and one part lye, and let it rest for two days or three until the mixture hardens; then return to opening what is broken in the nodule.

Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the cure of the breasts of men which are resembling women's.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Sometimes the breasts of some men are swollen because of the habit of sleeping as they begin to be hairy, and then the breasts become swollen and resembling women's breasts, and firm.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And for whoever has this, cut them with a lunar section according to this form, from line B to line G, and then scrape away all the swelling, and fill the wound with an embodied medicine, and then sew closed the two lips of the wound, and cure it until it is healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast declines towards the sides and is softened by its weight just like a woman's, then cut it in two along its middle with two sections resembling a lunar figure, of which each contains the other because of their end, so that the major line contains the minor according to this form from line B to line G. And then scrape away the cord which is between the two lips of the wound, and the fatness, and apply what we have said about the sewing and powders that are necessary in the cure until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of what must be cut for the uneasiness of the patient and for the flow of blood, then fill the wound with cotton soaked in corrosive ointment and leave it there until it corrodes what is rotten from the swelling, and then cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Of puncturing abscesses that come below the nipple.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	Those abscesses which come below the nipple are of the kinds of scrofulas, hard, and they contain a bag which is sac-like.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And some of them contain moisture; and those that contain moisture should be punctured with a lunar section according to this figure: from line G to line B. And when all the contents of the abscess are evacuated, then fill it with old vinegar and leave it for another day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And then the wound is stopped and cured with an appropriate ointment until it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.
