Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Of the section of abscesses that occur through an artery or vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is broken and the vein is collapsed on it, then many times abscess occurs: for when the abscess is through an artery, it is longly aggregated in the bowels of the body; and when it is forced into the abscess with the fingers, you feel a quack in it that there is stridor.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And what is through a vein is round to the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And the section on this abscess is difficult, and especially in that which is below the armpits, and in the angle, and in the neck, and in many parts of the body; and it is large, therefore its cure by cautery is avoided, and that which is at the extremities, or to the head, must be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But for that which is from them by inflammation of the orifice of the artery, cut it in the vein with a long section; and then open the section with nails, and the artery, and free the tunics so that they are discovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then place over it an awl and make it penetrate to the other side, and tighten the artery with a double thread in two places, — which causes you to press on it in extraction of two arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then puncture the place which is between two membranes with a needle so that blood flows out from it all that is in it, and the abscess is dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then apply cure to which is engendered pus within so that the membranes fall, and then cure it with appropriate ointments until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an abscess from the section of a vein, then you must hold with your hand what is possible to you of the abscess with the vein, and then insert the awl below the place which you have held with your hand, and make it penetrate; and there will be in it double thread within so that you draw out that from the other side, and then tie the abscess with a fine thread according to what we have said to you in the thread of two parts with two extremities.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that the thread is drawn out, then insert the awl so that it penetrates all the abscess because of the first puncture of the awl, and tighten your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the abscess in its middle part so that when it is soaked what is in it, then you cut the superfluity of the vein, and leave what from it is tied.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then pause over it powder which you have soaked in wine and oil, and then apply the cure which is made with water and ointments until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 50 of the abscess which occurs by twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as abscess occurs in an artery and vein, and similarly abscess occurs in nerves when they occur in their compression or occur by superfluous beating, and similarly.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is made of them in the places of the helpers or of the talus, or in any place where the joints are crushed.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a heavy pustule, and it is similar in color to the rest of the body, and there are six of them on his arms, and when they are pressed with force, the patient appears to be in a stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not a pustule located in the chest area, but rather below the neck, and he is sick all over, and he does not want to go forward or backward.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, for those who have pain in their joints, it is not advisable to use a hot iron, because it would quickly cause contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But for those who have pain in the head or forehead, apply a spatulum on the neck.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if there are few pustules, then cut them out with forceps at their roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then open it with a knife, and remove the pus; and close the wound with stitches, and heal it so that it may recover.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 11:
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Of the incision of a pustule which happens to the jaw and happens in the stomach.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Some people have many warts on their stomachs and other parts of their bodies, which are called warts because they resemble fungi, the roots of which are fine but the tops are thick; sometimes their lips are also affected, and they can be either small or become very large.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one such person whose two warts in his stomach were very similar to fungi; their roots were fine and they were not different in color.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And sometimes the lips of these people turn inside out and split open, and moisture runs from them all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, when I cut into one of these, I found that it was about an inch and a half deep. The other was about an inch deep.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And when you cut into them, consider whether the patient is hot or cold, and if the color of the tissue is white, then cut it with a wide knife, and let it be cauterized in the fire, for many times the pus is expelled through the incision; and if blood comes out, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see the patient is fearful and anxious, do not cut it with a hot iron; but rather take some fresh pitch, and spread it on that area, in the manner we have described; and let it rest for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Then tighten the pitch around the thread; therefore, do not stop tightening the large thread around it until it is completely cut off and falls away by itself.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the wart has a thick root, then cutting it will cause fear and terror, especially when it is in the stomach.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But you may cut only half of it, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	Then heal the wound so that the wound recovers.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And beware of cutting a wart which is dark in color, has little sensation, and seems to be very firm, for that one is cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I have seen many such warts, just like cranes.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 12:
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the treatment of an umbilical hernia.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Umbdominal hernias are caused by many things; or by fissures in the diaphragm above the stomach, and the tissue or intestine of which they are made goes into other openings; or by blood coming from a vein or artery in front, or by restricted expansion in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is from a fissure in the diaphragm and from an injury to the tissue, then the pustule will be of similar color to the rest of the body; it will have less pain, and it will appear at various locations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is from a hernia of the intestine, then its location will be as we have described before, with greater and more violent diversity; and when you press on it with your fingers, it hides away, and soon returns; and it becomes very large because of internal heat and violent effort.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is from moisture, then there will be pain, and it will not hide when you press on it with your fingers, nor be constricted or cut off.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is from blood, then the pustule will appear with dark-inclining marks.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is from fat, then it will be a heavy, large and hard pustule, and it will be according to a certain amount.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	And if it is from expansion, then touching it will cause pain.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation on it is that you should consider whether the umbilical hernia is from blood of an artery or vein, or from expansion; then you must not use the cure for it as we have instructed in the chapter where we spoke about hernias from arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the umbilical hernia is from the intestine or tissue, then you must tell the patient to hold his breath and be standing upright; then touch around the whole circumference of the umbilicus, and then command him to push his stomach out towards your hands over his chest, and then cut the hernia open at its highest point with a wide knife all the way around where you have touched it with the tip; then extend the opening to the sides above it with a large needle; and then tie it all the way around with strong pitch or strong thread in a decent manner.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	Then open the hernia wide over the wound and put your finger into that hole and feel for the intestine; and if you have it caught or trapped by the ligature, then cut off the hernial sac and push out the intestine to the sides inside the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have caught the tissue, then take it with a needle; and cut away its excesses.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is against an artery or vein, then surround it a lot and then return to your operation; and take two needles and put them in strong pitch and insert two needles around the hernia in the shape of crosses, making them penetrate; then tighten the hernia into four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you want to, take away the needles and leave that place where the extended flesh is shrinking in and falling by itself; or cut it when it has become fine and is shrinking in, and then heal it with what covers it inside so that it may recover.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the umbilical hernia is from fat in it or moisture, then you must hollow out the pustule as we have said and draw away the blood or moisture which you find in it; then heal it with what covers it inside so that it may be consolidated.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 13:
De curacio de cranc.	On the treatment of a hernia.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said, in the division, about the kind of hernia and how it is treated with remedies, and that it is difficult to treat a hernia with an iron without causing an ulcer; we have also spoken about a hernia generated from the mother and the caution in treating it.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that sometimes a hernia can be in a place where its removal is possible, like a hernia which is in the breasts or in the thighs and which resembles the limbs attached to drawing out all of it, especially when it starts small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and large, you must not come near it, for I have not seen any such hernia recover from that.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation on it is when it has been located as we have said, that you must precede and cut away the patient and purge them from black bile, then bind that hernia, if there is a manifest herniation discovered.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	Then prepare the patient with a preparation in which he will be operated on, and cut off all the nails of his toes; and then with a good sharp knife cut deeply into the tissue all around so that no cause remains from the roots.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow freely without stopping it; and then squeeze out all of it from the wound by pressing with your hand or an instrument that you can manage, according to which instrument is available to you.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if you are facing difficulties with the blood flowing from a vein or an artery, then cauterize that area so that the flow of blood is stopped; and then treat it with another treatment so that it heals.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter .liv.
De curacio de ydropici.	Of the treatment for dropsy.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already described, in the division, of the species of dropsy and the signs of each species; of the treatment for it with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And the one which is cured with iron is only the species of "althitas", and it is not approach iron for the species of tympany or of iposarca because they are deadly.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have treated this species of dropsy timpanistre with medicines and it does not respond to your treatment, then consider; because if the patient is already weakened, or has another malady like another dropsy, as if it is in the chest or abdomen and similar to those, then beware that you do not treat it with iron, because there is danger in this.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient has robust vigour and does not have another malady except dropsy, and he is neither an infant nor elderly, then the manner of operating on him is that you raise the patient between your hands and press his abdomen with your hand, forcing the water out from under the navel; and then take a hollow thorn according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	It should be of two pointed parts long, of acute extremity like a thorn; but it should have in it some shortness little by little, so that during the operation you do not pass into the intestine and that you take it out.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider if the generation of dropsy is from part of the intestines; because in that case you should lengthen yourself from the navel by the quantity of three fingers at the lower ends, on the right side of him over the navel.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of dropsy is from a malady of the liver, then your section should be on the left of the navel by three fingers.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if it is from a tumour, then your section should be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And you must not make your section over the side that the patient wants to lie on so that the superfluities do not flow to that place freely.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then pierce all around with the instrument and insert into that section, and raise your hand with the thorn between the skin and the bowels, and squeeze it out; and if a nail or a little bit.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then pierce the bowels so that the thorn reaches the desired place which is where the water is.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then take it out and insert an instrument of which this is the form:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	And it is like a slender silver tube; made of silver or of brass or of lion’s tooth, to which at the lower end there are two small holes, and on the sides of it three holes: two from one side and one from the other side; and its end is notched according to the manner of a pen, like this:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the upper end of it there is a ring, because when the instrument reaches the water, then it immediately rises over the instrument, therefore it empties from the water in the momentary quantity; because if you empty more than that which does not happen in the moment, he will soon die by resolution of his animal spirit, or it happens to him five times that is near death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But it empties according to the quantity of his vigour and according to how you understand the dispositions of the patient from the vigour of his pulse and from its goodness.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And then take out the instrument, and it will retain the water which is the cause because as soon as it is retained by the skin which retains the thorn that is over the bowels, of which we have instructed you to pierce according to this manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And then return the instrument on the next day if he can tolerate it, and take out a little bit of water, and do this for several days with fear, and beware of error so that the water does not flow out except a little.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you are afraid for the patient, and let out a great quantity of water, then treat him with sweat bath in hot sand, and expose to the sun for a long time; and treat it with drying medicines until he is healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize over the stomach and the tumour and the liver; and in addition to the extraction of the water according to what I have recounted before.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter .lv.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	Of the treatment for children whose places of urine are not pierced.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes, some of the children are born from the womb of their mother and the top of the mixture is not pierced (or it is struck tight or it is not in its place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore, there must be treatment with piercing of him immediately after he is born with a very fine thorn according to this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then put in the hole a small subtle nail of lead and tie it, and let him for three days or for .iiii.tre.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when he wants to urinate, he will be stopped up and urinate; and then return that.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not put in the lead, it is possible that the urine which goes over the place will not open this closure.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	But he of whom the hole is tight must be treated with a nail of lead as we have said for several days until it is enlarged.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	But those in which the hole is not in its place are swollen, the cause of which is that from those, he who is born and the hole is struck is at the end of the tip of the penis because it cannot urinate into the parts inside, so it raises the penis with his hand to the parts above; and there is no generation for him because the semen cannot come to the mother according to straightness, and it is a very harmful malady.

And the manner of operating on him is that the patient be bent over his chest, and then extend the tip of the penis with your left hand with violent extraction, and insert the tip of the head of the penis of the place of the foreskin with a sharp thorn, like this: or that you pierce any part, so that the middle of him comes like the head of the penis and that the hole falls into the middle place as it should.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And beware of causing blood flow in your operation because sometimes it happens; and stop him with it that you stop the blood, and treat the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter .lvi.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of the white which happens in the foreskin on the head of the penis and of whiteness and blackness and adhesion of the foreskin of the head of the penis.

No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat. quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	For lunar cautery is beneficial in two ways, for stopping bleeding and for corrupt blood.

Capitol .lvii.	Chapter .57.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of the purification of children and of the cure for those who are circumcised.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a cure for continence like other ulcers; but rather since it comes from our action and will, and its use is especially in children, it is necessary that we assign to it a better operation and easier path so they may more quickly return to health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore I say that the ancients did not prescribe circumcision for any of their free people, because they do not use it in their laws, and it is only that we have acquired through experience, which cause is that I have seen most of the physicians and surgeons use circumcision and purification with a knife and with torches; they use cauterization with vinegar and incision with the fingernail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have prohibited all these ways and not found better purification with forceps or cauterization with vinegar than with scissors, for often the foreskin escapes above, for the foreskin has two tunics, and the one on top is removed while the one underneath remains; so there is great danger of another incision and pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu. Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in the operation with the fingernail, iron and corruption often result from your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the foreskin of a child is short by nature, and often it happens in such a way that it does not need purification, and I have seen this.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But from the purification that is done with forceps and cauterization with vinegar, I discovered the goodness, for the forceps are of proportional incision, so that the keenness that is above is like the keenness that is below; and therefore when you press your hand in proportion, and you insert it according to a comparison at one time; and compression of the vinegar is made in the shape containing the foreskin of the whole, with which there is no error at all.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the way of the first operation is that you make the child stand mostly if he is one of those who understand a little, and do not do it unless you tie the vinegar in his penis only, and let him be until another day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then make him happy in all those ways that are possible for you to receive his intelligence.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And then make him stand between your hands, established and prepared, and do not be afraid; and hide the forceps in your hand or under your foot so that the child does not see those or any of the other instruments.

And then insert your hand into his penis and breathe on the foreskin, and draw it out so that the glans of the penis comes out, and then purify him of what is accumulated in it from dirtiness.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And then tie the marked place with vinegar folded in two, and then apply the second ligament pushed up a little from below with good retention, and insert between two ligaments.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then lift the foreskin up a little and stretch out the glans of the penis; and let the blood flow a little at a time, for that is better; and pause powder over it and on the powder place cloth in which is spread mulberry-tree gum in rose oil cooked recently warm; and let him be over that until another day; and cure him with ointment until he is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The shape of the forceps for purification, this is the shape:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	Let the outside tips not be cut and the inside ones be cut so that the branch of the claw is not cut, and let the length of both keennesses be like the length of two handles equally.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	But the mistake in purification is that often all the inner foreskin escapes or some part of it from the incision.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore, you must stretch it from your finger in front of the place of the ulcer and insert it according to equality.
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it with your fingernail, then cut off that with a needle and insert it.

But if they have passed three days and the ulcer that is inflated under the penis has not gone down, then you insert that until the ulcer is dried up with cauterization, and cut that off with ease, and insert it according to how you are prepared.

E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	But cure him with that which we have said until he is healed.
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter .58.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the cure of urine retained in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio. E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou. E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And let the patient lie on his back, and pierce his bladder with a piercing needle, and with oil of turpentine, and olive oil and eggs.

And then insert the syringe easily so that it reaches the root of the piercing; and then bend the piercing needle above to the part of the embelic; and then pull the syringe into it; and then pull it in so that it reaches the bladder, and that the patient feels the voided cause, and not according to this order, but the meat in which he went to tortuosity.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And then extend the needle with the wool little by little, because urine seeks wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then expel that and cause urine carefully, and use the syringe; do not cease to do this and use the syringe until the bladder is evacuated and the patient receives some relief.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter .lix.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of the quality of clysterization of the bladder with camphor and with similar instruments which are appropriate for it.

Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in that there are three holes: two from the one part, thus for urine;
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	In the beginning there is a hollow place into which one puts what is to be infused; and it is according to quantity that one stops up that opening, without addition, so that when any cause is withdrawn from the humidities, it is withdrawn, and when it is expelled far out, with that one stops it up, and when it is expelled far, according to how camphor is made with naphtha in sea battles.

And then insert the end of clapcedra into the piercing as we commanded in the syringe; and then pull the moisture with that which you pull it, because that moisture goes at once to the bladder, and the patient feels that.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	Subtle form of clyster by which the bladder is clystpered, and this is its form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it should be made of silver or brass, the end of which is more pointed and resembling a small feather, and below a tube passes within it.

And then take the bladder of a person, and put into it the moisture which you want to clysterize in the bladder; and then bind that between two with strong ligature with folded needle, and heat that moisture over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And then insert the end of the clyster into the piercing.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica. Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if the bladder is not at hand, then take a bunch of parsley and make a ring from it; and pierce that all around its roundness; and then insert a strong needle into those holes, as one revolves; and then add the ring so that it is added also like an egg, because you put in that what you want of moisture, oil and water.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then hold that in the instrument and do by it as you did by the bladder, and express with your hand so that the moisture reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter .lx.
De extraccio de peyra.	Of extraction of stone.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already said in the division the species of stone and cure of it with medicines, and the difference between stone engendered in the kidneys and stone engendered in the bladder, and its signs.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said about stone for which cauterization is done with hand, and incision;
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone engendered properly in the bladder is that which is lodged in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And we will now tell about that with manifest exposition and abbreviation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore we say that stone engendered in the bladder mostly comes to infants; and of its signs is that urine which emerges from the bladder is like water in its subtlety, and appears in it sand; and the patient rubs his penis, and moves it many times, and then it is erected; and with this there are openings in it.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And the cure of infants of that is that they attain 12 years; and it is difficult to cure in the old.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young it is easier for that which is between them.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that whose stone is larger and the cure is more distant; and if it is lesser, it is contrary to that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore when we come to the cure of that, first let us cleanse the patient with a clyster which draws out all the fissure which is in his intestines; for that fissure some times hinders the emission of the stone from inquiry of it.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then let the patient be pressed on his feet and groan in pain until the stone descends to the bottom of the bladder, or that it emerges from some place or another.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then let him do that between his thighs, while the patient's thighs are pushed down below, so that all of the bladder is made to incline downward.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then draw that out and all of that out from it.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore if you feel the stone in the space, then you stop at once with incision on him.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if it does not come down completely to your touch, then let you anoint with oil the tip of the middle finger, if the patient is an infant, or the tip of the index finger if he is a youth completed, and insert that into his anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And from the stone which you are standing next to, take out your dagger.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And gently insert it into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	Then press gently with your dagger against that area and push out any air trapped inside through the opening that you have cut.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And instruct the assistant to press the bladder with their hand, and instruct another assistant to use their right hand to stretch out the intestines upwards, and with their other hand to hold back the rectum which is under the intestines, at the location where the incision is made.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	Then insert a sponge, cut into a wedge shape like this:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	and cut through the rectum and intestines, not in the rectal area but on the left side of the buttock; and make a crosswise incision so that the external opening is wide and the internal one is narrow according to how much space there is for the stone to come out without causing any problems, and no more, because if you push the dagger too hard against the stone it will slip into the rectum.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And be aware that some stones have edges and ridges, making them difficult to remove.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	Some are like a grape in shape, round, and easy to remove.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	So if it has edges, cut along the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not loose, then you should either press down on it or grip it tightly with an instrument with a curved end and prevent the stone from slipping away; or insert under it a thin flexible instrument.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot grip it, then make the opening a little wider; and if you see any bleeding, apply powdered vitriol to the cut.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if there are more than one stone, then at the start you should push your hand towards the mouth of the bladder, and gently insert it; and push in a little bit more if necessary; and do the same if there are more than two stones.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the stone is very large, then you should not cut it too much, because one of two things will happen to the patient: either they will die or they will experience continuous dripping of urine, because the wound has not healed properly.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But you should try to push it out by pulling on it with forceps, or by pulling it in pieces with the forceps.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	So when you have finished your operation, then fill the wound with cotton wool soaked in aloe and dragon's blood, and stitch it up.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And place a cloth soaked in oil and wine, or in rose oil and water, over the wound to prevent any boil from developing.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	Then tie up the patient around their waist, and do not untie the bandage until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when you untie it, wash the wound with water and oil, and treat the wound with ointment of diaphoretic and diuretic herbs until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if a boil occurs on the wound, hot and corrosive, and it seems like the blood is frozen in the bladder, and as a result urine cannot pass through (and this is known as the egress of blood with urine), then insert your dagger into the wound and draw out that blood, because if it stays it will cause putrefaction of the bladder.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And wash the wound with sour wine, water and salt, and apply ointment of all kinds to it until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And remember at all times during the healing process that you should press both thighs and apply the medicines which are placed on the wound.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and it is in the middle of the penis, and urination is prohibited, then treat it with what you yourself have discovered to be the cause of the incision; for troops wounded by this treatment are accused of having had an incision, and I have already tried it, and it is that you take a punch tool made of iron felt, of which this is the shape:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	with a triangular tip, pointed, attached to a staff.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	Then take the penis in your left hand and pull it down so that the stone does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	Then insert the iron into the penis, pushing easily until the punch reaches the stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And turn the punch with your hand towards the stone little by little, and when you have made the incision on that side, pierce it from the other side as well; for urine will immediately be absorbed.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	Then press your hand over the part of the stone that is outside the penis; for it is relaxed and is prevented from urination by the urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this treatment is not available to you for some reason which prohibits it, then take a hold of the stone from below with one hand, and with the other hand above the stone.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	Then squeeze the penis between two grips.
E aprop extratz aquela.	Then pull it out.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	Then untie the ligature and clean the congealed blood which is made in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	It is not necessary to tie the stone with a ligature from below, but only so that it does not return to the bladder; and the other ligature above, because when you untie the ligature, the stone will come out immediately, and then the wound will heal.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And for that reason when you tie the ligature above, you should lift the intestines upwards or allow them to fall back into place, and the wound will heal as we have said before.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter 61.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	On the extraction of stones from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	A stone in a woman is seldom found.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if you see any such stone in a woman, then it is difficult to treat it, and it is prohibited for many reasons.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is that women are very sensitive.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is that you cannot find a woman who will tell her husband when she is chaste, or is of the women who have married virgins.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is that you cannot find a woman who knows this art, especially the operation with the hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the location of the incision on a stone in women is different from the location of the stone, because it causes fear when cutting.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity forces you to do so, then take a woman who knows this art, and she will be hard to find.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you lack that one, then look for a midwife who is skilled in this art, or a woman who has experience as a midwife of women, or a woman who is an expert in this art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Then have her present, and instruct her to do everything that you command her to do when she feels the incision on the stone; the cause of this is that if the woman is a virgin, then put your finger in her rear end and grab the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Then if you find it, cut it below your finger, and then instruct her to push down on it.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not a virgin, then instruct the midwife to insert her finger into the vagina and grip the stone; then place her left hand over the bladder, and hold it firmly in place.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Then if you find it, then gently push her vagina towards the openings below, causing the stone to rise up into the opening of the bladder; and place your left hand over the wound, holding it firmly in place.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	Then cut into that position on the halfway point of the knee down to the root of the thigh, from whatever side it is that he is lying on, and place the stone in that section, making sure that his leg is not bent under him by the stone.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the incision should be small at the beginning; and then cut into that section, and if he feels the stone, then cut according to how much he knows the stone will come out of that section.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that there are many types of stones: some of those are small and large, smooth and rough, long and round, and they have bumps.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	So you know what kind to cut for according to where you want to cut.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see blood flow, apply ground vitriol to that spot and hold it there for an hour until the bleeding stops, and then return to your operation until the stone is out.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And you should prepare some of the instruments that are used in the extraction of stones in men, so that you are helped by them in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see blood flow and know that the bleeding is from the artery that was cut, then put powder on that spot and tightly constrict it with a bandage, and do not touch it again; leave the stone and do not extract it, for soon the patient will die.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then cure the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	So when the sharpness of the bleeding has subsided after a few days and the wound is closed up, then you return to your operation until the stone is out.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter 62.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Of incision on a hernia lump.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	A hernia lump is nothing but an accumulation of moisture in the white membrane that is below the chord of the muscles containing the bowels, and it is named membrane.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And sometimes it is in the subcutaneous tissue that nature has prepared for it in the region of the bowels, so that there is another bowel; and it is the chord of the muscle between the white membrane we mentioned earlier, and it is not anything else but a hernia.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is due to weakness that happens to the muscles, so that material is poured into them; and sometimes it happens due to a blow made on the muscles.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this moisture has many colors; the color of it is either inclining towards yellow or blood-red, or red, or it is black and foul, or it is watery white, and that is what is most common.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which one knows that this accumulation of water is in the white membrane we mentioned earlier are these: for if it is in the white membrane, then the lump will be round and declining a little towards length like the shape of a bowel, and it will appear on the muscle, because the moisture contains it from all sides.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the moisture is in the subcutaneous tissue, then the lump will be round with the end of the bowel and because of this one believes it to be another bowel.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the moisture is between the chord of the muscles and the white membrane, then cut under the center.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And when you want to know the color of the moisture, then test it on the lump with a needle tip from which the end is removed; and according to what comes out on the end of the needle, judge what is inside.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	So when we come to curing it with iron, then we command that the patient should be phlebotomized if it is possible for you, and have his body bled.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And then let him be re-bandaged over the hernia on any cause a little higher up, and put some bandages underneath it.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And then sit on the left side of him, and command the assistant to follow on his right, who will extend his hand to one side of two inches above the chord of the muscles and at the beginning of the navel.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And then take a broad blade and cut through the chord of the muscles from the middle location towards the length, so that it is near to the point.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And the incision should be made according to a straight line equally distant from the edge that is supposed to be of the membrane of the muscles, so that it comes to the white membrane encompassing it.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And cut it, and observe, and be careful so that you do not cut it; and your incision by which you cut it by section should be hanging by the greater bowel and subtly scrutinize by the incision according to how much is possible for you.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	And then pierce the membrane full of water with a wide perforation, and extract all the water.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	And then separate between the two lips of the incision with hooks, and extend the membrane above the parts below it; do not touch the chord of the muscles encompassing it, and cut the membrane in whatever way that is possible for you.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And cut it in its entirety or in parts, and especially its sides more subtly, because if you do not scrutinize the incision of it carefully, there is no security that the water will not return.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	But if the bowel processes from that hole of its chord in the hour of your operation, then when you will have completed the incision of the membrane, return inside it, and then join the two lips of the chord of the muscles with sutures, and then cure it as well as the other wounds, so that it heals.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	And if you find the bowel rotten due to another illness, then see that you ligate the vessels which are over the suspensor, and extract the bowel, and then cure it as we said.
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	But if the moisture is accumulated in two parts, then know that there are two hernias; therefore cut that part according to how you did it in the other equally; and if it is your opinion that there is one operation, then do it.
E aprop tu abstergiys le sanc, e entramet en las seccios lana submersa en oli o en oli rozat; e pausa deforo autra lana la qual tu as submersa en vi e oli, e expandeys aquela sobre dos genetius e·l mirac del ventre; e pausa desobre draps doblatz e pulvils, e lia aquels desobre am liament le qual es segon aquesta forma:	And then you will wipe away the blood, and put in the incisions wool soaked in oil or rose oil; and place over that another wool which you have soaked in wine and oil, and expand it over the two muscles and the navel; and place over it doubled bandages and powder, and smear that with ointment which is according to this shape:
e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas.	and then two bandages are tied and made into a pad of wool according to this appearance; and the extremities are bound with which they are pressed by the groin or with wet wool, and they are tied with constriction in the waistband of the trousers, and one extremity is pressed under the buttocks and the other is pressed at the beginning of the navel, and two extremities over two thighs and two extremities over two armpits, and all constriction is tightened in the waistband of the trousers.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta hernia es medicada artificialment am cauteri en loc de seccio am ferr; e es que tu prenguas cauteri cutellar subtil e que inscidas am aquel la codena dels ginitius, e es ignit segon que havem recomtat entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc contenent la aygua, e lahoras tu pren cauteri segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes this hernia is treated artificially by cautery instead of incision with iron; and it is that you take thin cautery and cut through the chord of the muscles, and it is ignited according to how we recommended earlier so that the white membrane encompassing the moisture is uncovered, and then you take cautery according to this shape:
e es asemblat a letra greca.	and it is assembled like the Greek letter.
E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	And then pierce through that membrane, and it is ignited so that all the moisture is driven out.
E aprop exten le ciphac am uncis, e excorja am uncis, e excorja am cauteri subtil ignit; e inscideys aquel segon que es a tu possible entro que eradiques tot lu; e guarda te del huou que·l foc no·l toque.	And then extend the membrane with hooks, and cut it with cautery, and scorch with thin cautery ignited; and cut it according to how it is possible for you so that you eradicate everything; and be careful that the fire does not touch the bowel.
E sapias que aquesta operacio es pus salva e pus longinqua de flux de sanc, e milhor que operacio am seccio.	And you should know that this operation is the safest and most remote from blood flow, and better than an operation with a section.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat apostema caut en la hora de seccio o en hora de cauteri, o flux de sanc, lahoras cove que tu cures qual contrarietat fa a tu per aquo, am curacio la qual conveneys a lu segon que es dit.	But if there is an abscess or blood flow at the time of sectioning or cauterizing, then you must treat any complication that arises from it with a cure that suits him according to what has been said.
Mays si le malaute es pauruc, e no spera la segonda operacio per la sua horribilitat, lahoras administra perforacio segon que yeu recomti aquo; e es quan es certificat deves tu, per aquo que havem dit de las significacios, que aquela hernia es ayguosa.	But if the patient is weak and does not hope for a second operation due to its horror, then you should perform a puncture according to what I have recommended; and it is when this is certified that you must, based on what we have said about the significants, conclude that the hernia is watery.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute sobre alcuna cezelha elevada, aprop perfora le apostema en la partida pus bassa de lu am spatum lat, e pausa la perforacio segon la longitut del cos.	Then you should have the patient lie on his back on a high bed, puncture the abscess in its lowest part with a spatulum, and make the puncture according to the length of the body.
E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	And the opening should be wide enough for all the water to flow out.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l’aygua.	Then place a pad over the wound and press it tightly to let the remaining water flow out.
E aprop cura aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	Then treat that area until the wound is healed.
Mays si contrarietat es a la egrecio de l’aygua en aquela hora tu perforas aquela: e aquo no es fayt sino per aquo quar le pannicol blanc en le orrifici de la plagua fa contrarietat e prohibeys le eyssiment de l’aygua, lahoras cove que tu metas en la plagua pena o instrument am la qual es extrayta l’aygua dels ydropitz, la forma del qual es precedida; o ajusta en la opprecio de la plagua un petit.	But if there is a complication in the discharge of water during that time when you puncture it: and this is not done unless the white membrane at the opening of the wound causes a blockage and prevents the exit of water, then you should insert into the wound a needle or instrument with which the water is extracted from the hydrocele; or apply to the compression of the hernia a small.
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	And you should know that the water will return and persist for about six months or so; and when it persists, then it should be punctured in the same way as before, for the patient will thus spend his days.
Capitol .lxiii.	Chapter 63.
De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	Of sectioning on a fleshy hernia and its cure.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	Know that in sectioning on this hernia, there is great danger of loss of life in the most favorable circumstances; therefore, I have seen its dismissal and saving through it better.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And I will remember the operation on that one and the properties of abscesses.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	Therefore, I say that abscesses arise in the parts of which the body is composed and are caused by various causes: either by acute acute excess, which is distributed to the body, or by impact.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	And its color is according to the color of the body, and there is no pain in it, and it is a heavy abscess.
