Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	Form of a spatula having two ends by which the head is cut off:
Forma de dos espatums latz:	Form of two spatulas broad:
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	All those instruments are exercised, and when they are more numerous and prepared by the artisans, then it is easier for the operation and better for men because of its quantity.
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	And you should not lack those instruments, because the necessity of them is inexcusable.
De extraccio de la segondina.	On extraction of the placenta:
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	When the placenta is retained after childbirth, then you should command the woman to retain her breath, and then make her sneeze with force, and if it is not expelled by that, cut it out.
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	And if not, then you take a bowl and pierce the covering with a hole and stop that wound with herbs opening the mouth of the mother, as well as the calcium and rue and anise and camomile and dried scacade and cassia line and frankincense.
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	All those herbs or some of them are to be soaked in water in the bowl, and stop that over fire.
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	And then stop a tube of reed in the mother's mouth, and hold it there while the evaporation comes to the hollow of the mother.
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	And then make her sneeze as we have said, and the placenta is expelled with speed.
Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	But if that cure is applied and it is not expelled, then command the midwife to submerge her left hand in sesame oil or in mallow juice, and then insert that into the navel and probe with it the placenta, and when she has found the placenta, pull it out little by little according to how the mother does not feel strong attraction.
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	Before anything else, ensure that the patient's right and left ribs are easily accessible.
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	Then adjust the amount of attraction, for it will obey and avoid adhesion.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada, nos ja havem recomtat la curacio am sturnutacio e am medicacio de la ola am erbas.	And if the mouth of the mother is constricted, we have already recommended the cure with a snuff and medicine from the oil with herbs.
Mays si no es fora-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recomtadas, lahoras guarda te que no fetigues sobre aquela en iteracio de abstracio, mays empero cove que aquo que es eyssit de lu a la boca de la mayre lies a la coyssa de la femna, e aprop cristeriza aquela am enguent e tetrafarmacon; quar aquel fara poyrir aquela aprop alcus dias e sira dissolvuda e sira fora-getada.	But if it is not cured by all the causes which we have recommended, then beware that you do not tire yourself out with too much sucking, but rather anoint what comes out of the mouth of the mother with oil and four-drug remedy; for it will make that part soft, dissolved and cured.
Mays quan se poyreys, es de lu elevada mala audor al cap, e al estomac, e aquo ledeys la malauta; e adonc cove que sian aministradas sub-fumiguacios e convenientz ad aquo.	But when it becomes rotten, there is a bad odour which rises to the head and stomach, and that harms the patient; therefore smoking medicines and suitable remedies should be administered to counter this.
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	But some of the ancients have already tried smoking with nase-tort and dry figs.
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	Form of an instrument by which the woman is smoked, for retention of menstruation and secundine:
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	It should be made of glass or brass.
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	And the thin end is placed in her vagina and the wider end over the fire, and the smoking is placed on the embers of the fire.
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	And let that remain until the smoking is consumed and then repeat another.
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	For cure of a non-perforated child's anus:
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	Young children and their anuses, if they are not perforated, become very thin and narrow.
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	Then the midwife should enlarge it with her finger; and if not, enlarge it with a sharp spatula, and beware of touching the foreskin.
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	Then apply wool soaked in wine and oil over it; and cure that with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	But if you fear that it is blocked, then insert a cannula for a few days, and remove it when the child wants to defecate.
E ja accideys oppilacio del cul per consolidacio de plagua o de apostema; adonc cove que aquela consolidacio sia inscidida, e aprop sia curada am aquo que avem dit de la curacio e del plom.	And it often happens that the anus is blocked by a clot or an abscess; therefore the clot should be cut, and then cured with what we have said about the cure and the lead.
De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	For cure of the fistulas that cause discharge below:
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	The fistulas that cause discharge near the anus, in the space of the lower part, produce a hard lump from which pus flows out.
E es una fistula o motas.	And it is a fistula or many.
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	And when that lump becomes old and corroded by the putrid white or subtle pus, sometimes from some of these fistulas some penetrate.
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	And those that penetrate are known by what comes out of them by the exit and by windiness; and some have the patient of the exit, and often it comes out of them very strongly.
E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.	And some of these fistulas sometimes penetrate into the bladder and into the length of the urethra; and some penetrate the joint of the thigh and into the knob of the hip.
E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	And when you know that the penetrating fistula does not penetrate into the anus, then put your finger in the anus and insert a thin probe of brass or iron into the fistula when it is soft.
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	But if it is hard, then insert into it a thin probe of lead or horsetail hair so that you feel the probe or the hair in your finger.
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you feel nothing in it and there is no sign of excretion or windiness or anything coming out, then know that it is not penetrating, and then proceed to the cure.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula is penetrating into the bladder or into the length of the urethra, then the sign of it is excretion of urine from there and prevention of it so that medicine can consolidate the place.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	But if it is penetrating into the joint of the thigh or into the bone and there is pain in the course, then its sign is that the probe goes through there if it does not hurt in the bone, and pain in the course of the part; and there is pus from time to time; and medicine does not help it nor is it healed with ointment.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all penetrating fistulas there is not a cure of all, and the cure of them is difficult work of foolish physicians upon which they are settled.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But in that which is not penetrating and not old, healing with iron is expected according to what you have described, and that which was seen and tried.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And it is that the patient lies on his back, and raises his legs up over him, with his thighs bent towards his belly, and then insert a probe of lead or iron into the fistula until you know the place where the probe goes through.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if he feels that around his anus, then let him insert your finger into his anus.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel the probe already pushed in and discovered to penetrate, also what you feel between your finger and that it stretches or flesh, then know certainly that it is penetrating; and then do not work on it, for there is no cure for that, as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	But some say that it heals in some people.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And for the medicine by which it is expected to heal quickly in him is that you apply cautery subtly according to the width of the fistula, as it has been mentioned, and insert that hot cautery into the fistula until it comes out around the anus; and then repeat that two or three times until you know that all those stretched flesh have become dried like a reed of bird feather.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	And then cure that with poultices wrapped in wool until all those flesh have dried up, and then cure it with medicines that generate and consolidate flesh, and if it is healed, well; but if not, then it will not be healed at any time by another cure.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	And if the probe goes in but does not penetrate into your finger which is in the anus, and between that and the probe there is a stretched flesh or swelling, and the fistula goes to where it pierces the surface of the skin, then dry the skin from the beginning of the fistula, and you will dry it with the probe, and it will be loose in the fistula at the place where the end of the probe goes through, and by the probe it is loosened and drawn out.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And then clean those flesh which are like a reed of bird feather, and none of the causes remain.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	But if blood flows from between you and your probe when you push in those flesh, then the milk that is and of the pus the sharp instrument is cauterized with fire or with sharp medicine, for cautery with fire tightens good flesh: so it is drying of those stretched flesh, and abscission of the blood the drying of the moisture.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And then cure that with poultices wrapped in wool or in cress within which the place is hot, and then cure the wound with hard flesh-generating and consolidating ointments.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And thus medicines in which there is constriction and drying; when then it is restored, then it is healed and does not fear repetition.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	But if the fistula already goes through into the foreskin of the anus and is elongated from the superficial part of the body, then insert your finger in the anus and probe it.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And so if you feel resistance and between you and it is veil of membrane or flesh, and it is close to penetration, then there is no operation on him but according to the way of confidence and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	This can be treated in one of three ways: cauterize it as we have said; cut away the skin around the wound and try to find the cavity so that you can enter with your fingers and apply treatment directly; do not cut deeply enough to damage the membrane covering the spine, and let the patient pass wind freely according to his will, so that the swelling in the anus will go down of itself. Then treat it as we have said before, so that it will heal quickly; or enlarge the membrane and open the pustules with a sharp instrument as you cut away the skin around the wound, or with a probe, and clean out the fistulous sores which you find inside by probing; try your best to cure the whole wound by cutting, and if the orifice above is not healed over, and the fistula still drains from near the anus, then it will heal more quickly.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes the fistula is cured in this way: when you insert the probe into the fistula, it is near the edge of the anus, on the surface of the body, and around the margin of the anus; then take a probe with a pointed end, like a needle for piercing ears, and prepare it in this way:
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and insert it into that fistula, wrapped in a piece of wool or linen, and then insert the probe into the fistula until you find its cavity.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	But if you feel resistance near the edge of the anus inside, then withdraw the probe from that wound; extract the end of the probe and tie the two ends together, and leave it in place for a day or two; and when you have pierced the membrane with the probe, tighten it around the piercing so that the flesh between the two ends of the probe is squeezed.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	Then cure the wound until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	But if the orifice of the fistula is not penetrated, then make it so, in whatever way you are skilled, unless it damages the membrane, for you must not pierce the membrane; and then cure it until it is healed.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The shape of the spatula with which the fistula is split: one end is very sharp and the other blunt, so that you do not pierce what is unnecessary, as we have said.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	About stitching up hemorrhoids from which blood flows when they are cut.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	There are two types of hemorrhoids: some appear inside the anus like a bunch of grapes, and others look like a bunch of raisins.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	They are small or large; the blood flows from all of them at some time; they are inside and outside the anus, and at its edges.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	But those which are outside the anus are according to the season of less moisture; from these flows water like yellow bile or a little blood with continuous pus; they are according to the color of the body.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the treatment of that which is inside the anus is that you order the patient to sit down and squeeze it until the anus protrudes, so that the hemorrhoids appear to you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you grab it and hold it with your fingernail or something else which you have; then cut off those roots.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	But if the fingernails are not held in them because of their moisture and softness, then take them with rough cloth or a twig or woolen thread, and extract them with your teeth, and then pierce them and sprinkle some powdered herbs on the wound at the point of piercing, so that they may serve instead of cauterization; or cauterize them as described in the chapter on cauterization.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	Then cure them with the other cure until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	And if the anus does not obey excretion, then cut the patient's anus with a sharp instrument so that it has a small bite; and let him be washed with water which is in the anus until he excretes quickly when he is squeezed.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, then their cause is looser; take them with your fingernail or something else which you have, and pierce them, and cure them as we have said until they are healed.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And if you see the cut, know that you should give them sutures in this way: take a piece of wool and insert it into the needle, and then extract the hemorrhoids at their tops; then make the needle penetrate the root on the other side, and wrap the two ends of the wool around the needle below the needle, and tie them latitudinally; then tighten the hemorrhoid with a strong grip, and withdraw the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And do this to all of them; cut one and not the others, so that the surplus blood flows from it.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	Then place a cloth soaked in rose oil or cerot over the anus, and let him rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then let it remain until it is healed; when it is healed, cure them with ointment or some other cure until they are completely healed.
De curacio de fistulas.	Of the treatment of fistulas.
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	They often occur due to dryness or nature's constriction.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And if they are old and the medicine does not help, then know that you should pierce them with the point of a spatula or your fingernail until they are moist, and let the suppuration occur above them, which prevents their consolidation; then cure them until they are consolidated.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then you should stop those with a more violent bleeding than the first, until they no longer bleed and are excoriated; then cure them until they are completely healed.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	Of the treatment of ulcers, which is key.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	Know that ulcers, which are key, and do not if the body is not red around the color of a nail head; they occur throughout the body and mostly in the lower parts, the feet and the fingers, and through these there is pain.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	Then know that it should be pierced where there is a circle around the nail, and held with forceps or something else which you have, and pulled out by its root; then cure it.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you wish, cauterize it as described in the previous chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	But warts are small rough round pustules on the surface of the body; they often occur in children's hands.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And its treatment is that you stretch and pierce it, or squeeze it with a needle until it pops out.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you wish, cauterize it as we have said, with fire or sharp medicine.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And they are eradicated from their roots both straight and crooked by the instrument which I will describe to you.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	But a carbuncle is a large pustule on the surface of the body which occurs in the armpits; when it is rubbed, it feels like an insect bite, and it occurs around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And its treatment is to take a cane of reed or of peacock's feather, and make it strong; then place it over the carbuncle until it contains the circle of the cane; then turn your hand around the cane so that you pierce what is in the circle of the carbuncle, and let him squeeze the canule so that he pulls out the root of the carbuncle.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you want, make this with a tube of gold or iron in this way:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	Let the part above the cannula be thin, smooth (so that it is not perforated), and wrapped so that over the said part the perception of it is abolished and the revolution of that.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you want to cauterize the ant according to what is mentioned above in the cautery of atheyl in the chapter on cauteries.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	On the shape of the instruments that are administered to give surgery.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes surgery is done with silver or brass or molten gold or malleable; and sometimes they are made of those instruments small and large according to those to whom they are administered, for that which is administered in the cure of small children should be small; and of those whose anus is sore or painful, the cristiers of these should be small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The shape of a large and few cristiere:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The head of the cannula above which is tied the pouch should be wide in this way; and there should be a distinction to it where the pouch is tied as well as the veins.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the extremity of it below, which is inserted into the anus, should be smooth (so that it is not open) very little, preventing subtlety; and on one side of it there are two holes, and on the other side a hole, and the width of the hole according to the thickness of the rays, and the thicker ones smaller.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And the pouch in which are placed the medicines of a beast's bladder or sheep's wool, and its length be one palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be perforated with many holes as it is rolled; and if the space between the holes, the thickness of the said instrument.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And then insert into those holes strong bile of raw bile which should be from twelve biles, or surround them with it; and when it is tied to him, the pouch, let it be tightly tied at the head of the cristiere between two distinctions with a strong constriction, and then cauterize with that each hole: But the quality of cauterizing with that is that you fill the pouch with medicine, which should be warmed according to the quantity of the patient's tolerance; and beware that it is not too cold or too hot.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And then the patient should lie on his back, and raise his legs up and place under him a board upon which there are men or a lanceole; and then anoint the extremity of the cautery with oil or with albumen of egg or with mucilage of fenugreek or of similar things; and then insert that into the anus with ease, and let the minister hold the pouch and squeeze it with two hands and press with force until everything within the cristiere is evacuated; and then remove the cristiere and the patient raise his legs to the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces that to come out, let it be as much as possible; and if he sleeps with that for a whole night, it is better for healing.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you cauterize that in the diseases of a loose belly and its discharge, then repeat the cautery until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if there are hemorrhoids or painful abscesses in the anus, then let the cristiere be very thin and smooth, of those cristeres with which children are cauterized.
De curacio de las plaguas.	On the cure of wounds.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	You have already said in the division of the cure of wounds what suited the free one, and I say thus the cure of those with hand and medicines according to the complement.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore I say that wounds are varied according to what they are made of and according to the place on which they fell.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which many times wounds are made are thus with a stone, or incision with a knife or dagger, or blow with a spear, or with a club, or with an arrow, or similar things.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	But the wounds that are in the parts of the body are thus with a wound which falls on the head, or neck, or feet, or belly, or thigh, and similar things to those of the members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I am recommending the cure for some wounds so that you pause that reasoning and rule over the other wounds.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with the simple wounds of the head, for the recollection of the compound ones will come to the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore I say that when it happens in the head a simple wound and there is no fracture, then consider: if it is with a stone or similar, and the tendon has only just been cut and it is a large wound and you fear an abscess on the patient, then you should apply a cautery to the wound and a fleubotomy to the temporal artery immediately, and not delay that; and remove from there blood according to the quantity of its virtue if no other cause prohibits fleubotomy, especially if the blood that comes out of the wound is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And let the fleubotomy be on the side opposite the affected part; and keep the patient from replection and wine and coarse foods.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if some cause prohibits it, then let him be lessened of food but not approach meat or wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And place over the wound, if it happens to him an abscess, a hot poultice in rose oil or wine in which is mixed.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if he is certain of an abscess, then place over the wound if it is fresh with his own blood and the air has not changed that which I recommended earlier, then place over it, then small.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that, then place over the wound albus poultices until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the wound is large or it is by incision with a knife or similar, and its lips are not drawn together by threads, then draw those together with sutures according to what I recommended for them.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the wound is uncovered of bone and pen, and there is no retention of it except for a small suspensory, then insert that and then cure the wound with medicines and restore the flesh by cutting in the place of tendon, and command the patient to abstain from foods in which there is coarseness: garlic and formen cow and similar things to them, until it is healed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you see in the tendon putrefaction and it does not adhere to bone, then insert everything rotten and cut that, and then cure that.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which blood might flow and it is not stopped by medicines, then tie over the artery, and if you find that uncut, then insert that with spathum, or ligature that; and if necessity compels you to do what we have said, then cauterize until the blood is stopped.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of them is coldness; for this you powder over those this powder, for when that has dried in front, the air changes it.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: take oil of aloes one part, dragon' blood two parts, and causticum not-extinguished three parts; let all be ground and sifted, and let the wound be filled with it, and let it be compressed with a good constriction so that it lies upon it to harden, and let the blood coagulate.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then tighten that above with a bandage and let it be left so that it is not loose while the wound is unhealed, for otherwise it will not be healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And sometimes it does this on its own, when you are not in the presence of dragon's blood.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And this treatment is also performed on large wounds when it is appropriate to apply it directly and the wound is fresh with blood, which has not been altered by air.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them and especially in summer, then there is no intention to use this powder, but instead cure them with what we have said, that you apply some astringent ointments or paste made from barley flour mixed with water and honey; and also cure them with the other treatment until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if there is a broken bone in the wound and it is small, then you must remove it with tweezers.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I will describe the cure for fractures of the head when it has been poisoned.
De las plaguas del col.	Of wounds in the neck:
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the wound occurs in the neck, then there is no difference in treatment and it is the same as for a simple wound on the head.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerve of the neck is cut or an artery, then if it is a nerve, there should be no irritation but rather avoided by applying something that causes strong constriction, as well as cinchona and a kind of vitriol which is harmful to nerves and acts as a counterirritant.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And you must not apply anything hot to the wound, because the substance of the nerves is sensitive and its continuation is to the brain, which is the source of all the members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is treated with mild medicines, as well as causing washing with warm water, some poultice soaked in rose oil or not, and cauterization when it is washed with warm water and the other stones are removed according to this manner, and ointments moistened.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the wound is large, then administer sutures or cut the lips of it, and then cure it with powders until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if there is a deep wound or an infection in the lower part, then pierce it in the lowest place.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if an artery is cut in the wound and blood flow is achieved, then stop or dry it, or ligature it, or cauterize it if necessity compels you to do so.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the windpipe or throat is completely cut through and the veins of the neck are preserved, then you must sew up the edges of the wound on the windpipe without touching it; raise it up and return it to its natural shape, and then bind it tightly with a decent bandage, and let that be for several days; and then cure it with ointments in which there is constriction and excitation until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the wound has been made by pressure on bone, then pierce it and if there are fragments of bone in it, extract all that you can; and what you cannot, let that be within so that the wound becomes pustular, and let the discharge of it be separated and the swelling around it be relieved.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the wound is fresh, then powder it with the powder which I have recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if a fistula is made in the wound, then cure it with that which its memory will come to you soon in this chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of wounds in the neck or similar when made between the shoulders and is made by a spear or lance or similar:
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a thrust of a lance or spear and you see the depth of it, then consider that the wound is deadly if the victim shows shortness of breath; then know that the wound is lethal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if it is not deep and the wound is fresh with its blood, then you must apply powder to it in the first hour and not constrict it so that the blood is not retained in the depth of it and returns to the heart and that the victim is relieved, but rather apply attracting ointment to it, and loose it twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the ointment is not present to you, then you must place a sharp instrument in the wound's opening so that it sucks out what is in the humid parts; and let the victim sleep with their head over the wound so that what is inside it flows out.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if three days or more have passed and there are no signs of spasms or trembling of the heart or stricture of the chest, and you see the other good dispositions of it, then know that the wound is healed; and then cure it with poultices and with the other treatment until it is completely healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if its healing is delayed and all time it remains open, then know that a fistula has been made; cure it therefore according to its chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the wound is made by a spear or lance and is simple on the surface of the foot or leg, then cure it with that which precedes sutures if it is large, or powder if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if it has made an impression on the bone and the fragments are separated from it, then you must twist the wound and cut to extract those fragments if they are separate.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separated, then let them be within so that the wound becomes pustular and the extraction of them is relieved.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other wounds by accidents on other members, the treatment in cure is the same as what we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of wounds in the abdomen:
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The disposition which occurs in the abdomen is either large or small or punctured.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the large some times the intestine or nerve of the intestine is pierced so that there is intrusion and their suture is made very strong and very delicate.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And a small disruption is made difficult in another way and you see that their reduction is more difficult if you do not cut off the intrusion of them to their place at once, for it opens up and becomes swollen so that the insertion of it is made difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is punctured because in it the reduction of the intestine is not difficult as is difficult in the two species mentioned above.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that the suture of the abdomen is according to four ways, but two sutures are common in sutures of other wounds of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other sutures are proper to other wounds but rather are more proper in the suture of the abdomen.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I will recommend to you each one with exposition and explanation.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore I say that when the wound is small and there is some cause of the intestine through it, and its reduction is made difficult, then it is in one of two ways: or because of the smallness of the disruption as we have said, or when the intestine receives cold air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when that is so, you see that you warm it with a sponge or cloth moistened in only tepid water, or that you place it in water made warm, and cyperum, and spic, and embrocations on the intestine so that the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes it does this with the substance which has constriction, and is better than just water in resolving inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when you see the inflammation is resolved, then you moisten the intestine with water in which there is a little vinegar and mallows, for by this it is relieved the substance of it with little cause.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the instrument is not suitable for this cure, then split the hemorrhoids with a small instrument with which they are cut.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first cure is better when it is not a cut, and there is no occupation to dry by necessity and deflation.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, see its form:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of it is acute and bent, and the other part not acute, and the end fine, and not be as fine as a spatula, but rather blunt a little.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the wound is enlarged and the intestine comes out, then it is necessary that its reduction be according to its natural form, in its proper place, if possible on it, for it is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But if the hemorrhoid is large and is in the lower part of the belly, then you should make the patient lie on his back, and place his legs higher than his head; and if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you should place his head and chest higher than his legs.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And likewise if the hemorrhoid is in one of the two parts of the belly, then pay your attention and your consideration equally to both so that the part in which the wound is be higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus you should administer this for large hemorrhoids and for smaller hemorrhoids.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And for small hemorrhoids, use what is prepared for you, and make the minister hold it between his fingers, which have the hemorrhoid entirely in his hand and press its lips together, and uncover from that to that one side of the stitch, any cause whatever.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the way of common sewing: one that you take the needle, or count of needle according to the amount of the width of the wound; and let go of the end of the hemorrhoid of the little finger, and strengthen the needle one, and do not put oil in both ends of the thread, with two ends of the ligature which is under the hemorrhoid of the fingers within, so that you make it penetrate from that party; and you have already added two ends of the thread and two ends of the ligature, and so are made four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And strengthen with double oil around the needle, and several times from two parts together, and add both lips and the hemorrhoid by a decent addition; and let go of the thickness of the finger and put another needle in that one, and tie it up thus with oil as it was with the first needle; and do not cease to do this if it is necessary with needles until you have completed all the contraction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And let the needles be between coarseness and fineness, for fine needles pierce gently into the flesh; and coarse ones are of difficult insertion in the thread, and therefore so that they be finer in fineness and coarseness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is not that the needle be fixed in both ends of the thread next to each other, so that the flesh is not pierced gently and that the wound opens before its solidification.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And they are not prolonged with sewing so that the wound is prohibited from solidification.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And pierce the ends of the needles so that they do not hurt the patient when he sleeps; and you will place on the wound powdered expanders of all parts, which have the ends of the needles; and let it be until you know that the wound is solidified.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And this kind of sewing with needles in any way is more convenient for small hemorrhoids, for it has in their sewing one needle or two or around them.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	But the second sewing is common: and it is that you sew the four ends, of the thread and two ends of the ligature, in one go, with a needle in which there is oil wrapped both in fineness and coarseness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And when with the needle you have penetrated these four ends, reduce the needle from that meted part from which you began, so that the oil withdrawn box of the most sublimated part to the wound, so that the sewing is according to sewing of cloth with which the cloths are tightened.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And place between each sewing the quantity of the thickness of the little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this sewing is known to men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with such sewing I healed the wound which was inflicted on a man in his belly, and it was wounded by a knife, and the rupture of the wound was more than a palm, and he had come out of the intestines around two palms from the intestinal membrane, and the rupture was in the middle part of the member; and then I reduced it after the intestine had been out of the wound for 24 hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound was solidified in the space of 15 days or around it, and I healed him and he is healthy; and thus he lived for many years, and is in his senses.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And other physicians had judged that he would not be healed; and by miracle he was healed, for I did not cure him with ointment, but placed on the wound a piece of wool two times a day and an frequent ablution with water mixed with honey until he was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I will tell you two kinds of sewing according to the account of the Word.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And it is that you begin with sewing of the thread, and pierce the needle from the outside part to the inside part.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And therefore when the needle penetrates in the thread and in that you pierce the rectum and in length of all the body, and let go of the end of the ligature in which you have pierced the needle; and make it penetrate from the other end from within to without in the other end of the anus.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And when you have made that penetrate, then you make it penetrate another time in the meted end of the anus from within to without in the other end of the anus; and let go of the end of the ligature which is in this side, and make the needle penetrate in the other end of the anus.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make it penetrate with that your penetration with which you make it penetrate in the anus in the end of the anus which is in the part of him so that all that penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And begin from this meted side and sew that with the end which is of the ligature in the other side, and pull out that needle from the thread which has penetrated, and then reduce it in that thread and tie the end of the ligature which is in the other side with this end of the anus; and pull out that needle from the thread which is of part of him.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do that one time and another, and do that one time about another time so that you sew all that is out according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this way of sewing is that you sew with sewing of skin with which you sew the ligature, assuming that you sew the anus one time from the end of the thread, and let it be until you have completed it.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	But the second kind of sewing proper which I say is from the word of Galienus, and this is of semen of him and by him composed, is that you sew it according to similarity with which they compose medicine, assuming that you add all part to its compared part to him conveniently by nature; and apply one end of him to the other end of him, and this is done according that I have composed.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	Place the needle at the tip of the eye that is closest to the side of the wound, and make it penetrate into the inside of the wound in that sun, and tie the two ends of the thread; then twist the needle and make it pass through from the outside to the inside in the two ends of the ciphr.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	Then twist those knots and make some of the outside of the wound pass inside into the inside of the wound in the two ends of the eye that are on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this manner of suture is better than common suture, and it is a suture of which I have given a description.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the speech of Walga
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And some say that the suture of the belly is rectified with two needles; therefore you must put a needle into one of these, and begin with the insertion of the needle from what is below you, and make it pass into the other side according to the suture of those who sew skin to skin.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when there is a disruption in the middle of the belly, then the suture of it is more difficult than that of the other places in the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	But the judgment of medicine for plague is the judgment of the other plagues.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	And the cause is that when you encounter the plague recently with its blood before the air alters it, and return the intestine and cook it and arrange it decently, then place over it a carnative powder.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the plague, then place over it certain unction which are to you present that they make hard stone and draw out the puss, and be consolidated thread and eye; and cure that thus as is the cure of the other plagues so that it may be healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you do not have the medicines at hand, then place over it immediately, for as soon as it begins to give off a stench, change that twice a day, morning and evening, ayssi how you are taught, until it is healed, for you do not need any other medicine in various dispositions when the plagues are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the plague will communicate injury to the principal members, then take a lion’s wool and soak it in oil of suitable quality, or in roasted oil, and place that in the circuit of the places that are between the angles and below the armpits.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if there is pain or putrefaction in his intestines, as many times as that happens, anoint that with black styptic wine of tebe, and especially if the putrefaction is come into the intestine and makes an exit piercing into its cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that that which is of the gross intestines is easier to heal than that which is in the subtle intestines.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal because the intestine which is called "gegunu" does not receive healing of the plague that occurs in it at all; and that is because of the great multitude of veins that are in it, and because of the magnitude of it that is in those, and because of the subtlety of the body of that, and because of its proximity to nature of nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if that which proceeds from the plague is the fabric, and you accomplish that recently, return it according to your rectitude by which you return intestines to health.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has passed to him space and is already made black or dark, then that you bind that with thread over the place which is blackened by it, in order that there come flow of blood, for in the fabric there are veins and arteries.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	And then insert what is under that ligament, and place the two ends of the thread hanging from below the plague hole over you, in order that upon you be alleviated the attraction of him due to the sinking of the fabric and emission of the stench of the plague.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Description of the plagues when they happen in the intestines.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When disruption happens in the intestines and it is small, then it is possible that it may be restored in certain men, because he had seen a man who was plagued in his belly by a spear thrust and the plague was on the right side of his stomach, and the plague was old and made a fistula, and it was driven out from him and ventositat.

And some experienced men say that when the plague comes in the intestines and is small, then it should be bound according to this manner: and it is that you take foments of great caps; and then adjust the two lips of the plague and place a foment of those which has the open mouth over the two lips of the plague; therefore when he takes hold of those and tightens his mouth over them, cut off the cap from him, for it will adhere and not dissolve.

De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of cure of suck and fistula.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that all plague and pustule when it is come to rot and become old, and is made ulcer, and is not consolidated and gives off stench, then in any member that it is in, universally is named fistula and we call that suck.
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.
