And then insert with incisions that which is between each pierce of the bone, and make that more subtle which you can over it in end of elevation, as we have said, while you radiate the bone, or by your hand, or by any other cause through some tools which you have prepared for that, as tweezers and forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And know that you keep with total caution that the incision does not touch any cause of the brain.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And when you have circuit the bone and separated it from the brain if it is continued with it, then extract that, know that cut and gnaw that in its roughness of that which is in the bone with another tool resembling an incision, but however know that it is more thin and more subtle than the other incisions.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if there appears any part of the small bones and rough, then take that with facility by that which is due to you of the tools; and then cure the plague with poultices and ointments which we have said.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other way of operation is lighter, farther from fear, which Gualia and Launcelot say by great law; and this is the speech of it: it is necessary to you in the beginning that you begin to uncover the part of the bone of the place in which there is the fracture more violent and more manifest, while when you have uncovered that part and stopped under it the end of this incision long and gentle of which this is the shape:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And the rounded part is lion and do not insert any cause, and the acute part is of it in two sides forward in length, as you see; that the rounded part be fitted to the brain with the membrane of it incisive acute in the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then pierce over the incision of one part with a small hammer while you insert all the bone with facility as it is turned, and be secure of the membrane that no accident occurs in it which you fear in any manner, and if the patient was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he was sleeping.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Then if appears any cause annexed to the bone of the membrane in any place of bone, cut that from it with the end of the incision rounded, and loose that from it with facility, for it is loosed from it without harm and fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate within the membrane, and that which is cut off or is left of the bone is the membrane of it, and appears in it rough and small pieces, then know that you cut that roughness and loose those small pieces with razors subtle by which you have prepared the number, of diverse quantities so that it be to you possible to administer of those most convenient ones and the rightest of them according to what you are led astray by your operation that broken bone and its shape.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And know that you administer in your reason with which you cut the bone at the beginning the widest of those razors, and then use next it of the most subtle of it, and do not cease doing that according to continuity while you come to administer the most thin and the most subtle of all those.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	But in each of the other small hair fractures and subtle fracture, know that you cure treatment according to what you are led astray by rectification of it.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is caused by not being rubbed on all those who have studied in that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And we will now show you what we have written about large fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the flesh is torn when you remove the bone, then take a piece of cloth according to the amount of the wound and soak it in rose oil, and place it over the opening of the wound; then take another piece of folded or doubled cloth and soak it in wine and rose oil and place it on top of the first piece of cloth, and do this gently over the wound so that you don't cause the wound to bleed; then apply a bandage of linen, and don't tighten it but only as much as the wound can take.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And let him stay under this treatment for one or two days until you are sure that the wound won't fester; then loosen the bandage and apply medications to remove excess moisture such as linen rags, oatmeal flour, powdered peas, and similar things.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is good for you to make a powder of these medications and sprinkle it on the wound, especially if they are dry; generally speaking, apply to that any medicine of such nature that it cleanses without biting.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And be careful in your treatment that the wound is clean; and let there be no putrescence or anything else on it; nor let virulence accumulate on it; for when it is applied to the membrane of the brain, it corrupts and damages it, and malicious evil happens to the patient.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it happens in the head when the bone is cleaned and especially when the treatment of it is neglected, and there is blackness on its surface; therefore, consider if these accidents happen to the patient as we have said, know that they are all deadly.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if blackness doesn't happen except from the medicine that is applied to it, and it is because of that medicine that causes the blackness, then take honey in one part and rose oil in three parts, and soak a cloth with them, then place it over the head; and treat that with spices of healing until it is cured.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3:
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken in two pieces except in two cases: either both are upper bones or one of them is cartilage and not broken; and only pain, crookedness, and sinusitis happen to it.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts is broken, then you must insert your little finger into his nose and grip that fracture with your index finger and thumb from the outside, so that the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And let this be done by you with ease, and be careful that you don't cause pain to the patient through this operation.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the upper bone of the nose and the finger can't reach it, then let the end of the nose be made small and thick.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you do the same thing.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And let him be treated for restoration on the first day of the fracture, if possible; and otherwise, then let him have rest from the festering wound.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And insert into the end of the nose a plug of linen cloth if the fracture is in one part, or two plugs if it's in two parts, and let there be thickness on the plug(s) of an amount that fills the crack in the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And some of the ancient restorators say that the plugs should be wrapped in wool, and changed every day; but I haven't seen this; let there be instead a plug wrapped in honey comfit with oatmeal powder, and let the bone be set and the cartilage harden.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And sometimes there should be inserted into the nose, instead of plugs, a feather of a bird that is wrapped in linen cloth; and let there be such vehemence that the fracture of the nose isn' t prohibited from inspiration.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this cause is not necessary for you; and if you want to do it, then do it, and if you want to do plugs, then do that.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if the wound happens again, plaster the nose with cerot or with cotton soaked in wine and rose oil, or with diaquilon.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if the wound doesn't happen again, then let there be plastered on the outside with oatmeal flour and powdered peas cooked with honey; and let there be placed over it a plug of linen, and don't wipe the nose for any reason.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or ground down, then split them and extract them with instruments that suit this; then sew up the cut and treat it with something that encourages flesh to grow and harden, and apply plasters as is convenient.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if the wound happens within the nose, then let it be treated with plugs and lead tubes inserted so that it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter 4:
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Of the restoration of the mandible when it is broken.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the mandible is broken and there is no wound on it, then be careful if the fracture is only on the outside and not broken in two and curved on the inside, then its perception is easier.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, then insert your left index finger into his mouth; and similarly, if the fracture is on the mandible on the left, then insert your right index finger; and push with that the crookedness of the fracture inside with ease from the outside with your other hand; with that decently straighten it.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the mandible is already separated into two parts, then let there be extension of those two parts according to straightness so that its position is possible.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if the teeth are shaken by disruption, then strengthen those of which you expect that they will break with thread of gold or silver or of silk; and let there be applied to the broken mandible cerot, and let a doubled cloth be placed over it, and place over the cloth a great star decently made, or a sole piece as long as the mandible; and tie that under it according to how you are equipped with its application, so that it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to have rest and stillness, and let him drink wine mixed with rose oil.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you see that its shape is altered in any way, then let it be checked and loosened on the third day; and straighten what has been altered on it, and plaster it with oatmeal flour, with honey, or with oatmeal flour, after you have removed the cerot from it, and place over the plaster wool of linen.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then after that dressing is placed on it and the position of the bone isn't altered, let it be left so that it's healed and the fracture strengthened; for many times this fracture has been healed in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if the wound happens again, then let there be done what we have said several times in its healing so that it' s healed, and let that wound be cleaned.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture has a wound, then consider if it is split or shattered, then you be subtle so that those pieces with what suits for this in the removal of those tools.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the opening of the wound is small, then you should make it larger with a bloodletting needle according to the amount of your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	Then, when you have stopped the bleeding and it does not bleed again, then open the wound if it is large; but if not, put one of the ointments that are fit for this purpose onto it and cover it until it is healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of the restoration of the collarbone when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Many times the collarbone is broken in front of the chest, and that fracture happens in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	When it is broken, either it is separated or it is separated into two parts without any bleeding and it is easier to restore, or it happens with bleeding and it is more difficult to restore, or the fracture occurs through the skin.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation on that, when the fracture is through the skin, is that you have two ministers present, so that one has the aid and follows the broken collarbone, and the other extends the neck in that direction.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	Then fasten the fracture with your fingers until it is made in its form according to how it should be, and there is not a little protuberance or concavity in it.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, then you should put a pillow of cloth or wool under the patient's armpit, and its size according to the amount of your need; and extend and raise the collarbone and narrow the pillow with your hand until it fastens the fracture as it should be.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot bring the end of the collarbone to the sides outside because it is reached by the armpit, then you should have the patient lean back on his neck and place a cushion under the muscle on that side.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the minister should press the muscle on that side towards the sides down so that the bone of the collarbone is raised up where it is in the armpit, and then you should straighten the fracture and fasten it with your fingers.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	But if you feel bleeding from the collarbone and they are not stopped, then you should open it and stop those bleedings with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, then you should make an incision on it with one of the cutting instruments which you have prepared for this purpose, after you have placed under the collarbone the instrument which serves the head; and that instrument is of wood or iron, and this is the shape of it:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to a spoon of which this is the concavity; and its width should be according to what you need it for, according to the size of the bone or its smallness.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But its length should be according to what is possible for you in the operation; let it have two ends thus, and one end be wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the opening of the wound which you have incised when you have extracted the bleeding from the bone is wide, and it is certain that there will be a scab, then you should bring the two lips of the wound together with a suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the opening is small, or you fear a scab, then you should fill the wound with cloths and powders according to the quantity of the cut of the wound.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if a scab occurs, then soak a cloth in warm vinegar and rose oil and wine, and place it on that.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But the fastening of the bone when it is without a wound and without a cut is that you place plaster made from wheat flour with egg white, and place a poultice on it, and then place the pillow under the armpit if it needs it, and then take a bandage, which should be very long, and its width should be about three fingers, and then place powders on the poultice and the plaster; and then take a slender stake of wood whose width is about three fingers and its length is similar, and then wrap that in cloth, and wrap that cloth with the stake around the site of the fracture; and then take a bandage when it is turned back, and turn it around the neck of the patient and under the armpit on his side, and bring it down to all parts, and when you see that the fastening of the fracture with its fastening has descended, and this is what is not hidden from you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And let it not bleed on the broken bone; and so that you see the patient every day, when the bandage becomes soft or you see the stake has bled, then you should straighten that and tighten the binding.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then place the patient's pillow under his neck, and place a small cushion under the armpit on that side, so that with that the support of it is raised from that side, and therefore the fracture of the collarbone is elevated by the elevation of the muscle; or let his arm hang at his neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not loosen the bandage unless bleeding occurs in the site or a scab, until twelve days have passed.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And then renew the plaster when you have seen his face to that, and adjust the fastening and restore that and leave it until it is restored and the fracture of the collarbone is coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is strengthened and comfortable according to the month in 28 days, and sometimes in some people it is done in less time than that.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Of the restoration of a fracture of the shoulder.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The scapula is broken in its lateral part and not broken from it but the margins.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And then when it is broken in its middle part and not broken from it but the margins, then according to how the fracture is twisted you should prepare it and reduce it according to the natural shape in every way that is possible for you.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And then place on the site powder of wheat flour with egg white and a poultice, and then place on it a bandage of cloth doubled; and then place on it a slender stake of wood according to the quantity of the scapula or more.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if under the stake the scapula is hollowed out in any of its parts, then you should straighten that hollow with a poultice, and then place the stake according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then tighten above it with a long bandage with mild compression and the stake so that it is not bled from its site.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the bandage every day; and whenever it becomes soft, loosen another turn and tighten it and equalize the stake if it has bled from its site.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And support the patient on his side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the scapula is restored in 20 days or in 25.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And then when that number is complete, then you should dissolve the bandage, and know that it is certain that there is a beginning of union of those bones from which there is not feared or their dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if the site of the bone weighs down and there is placed under it the cord, then you should cut that, and support it, and do according to what we have said in the fracture of the collarbone about bleeding from a scab if it occurs here.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	Of the restoration of a fracture of the foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot sometimes is broken in its middle part and that especially occurs at the end; but the ends of it are usually crushed and ground together.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And when the patient's lung is broken it leads to a decline in the internal parts and the occurrence of great pain, difficulty in breathing, cough, and strong vomiting of blood; and the cavity in the broken bone is revealed and not hidden from sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of the patient is that he should be supine on his back, and place a cushion between his shoulders; and press the muscles of his chest, and adjust his ribs with the hands of two assistants, and act subtly in the operation and according to all ways that are possible and convenient, until the bone returns to its shape.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And then place a plaster and wadding over the fracture site, and put on top of it a thin table made of willow or alder wood, or similar materials in levitation, wrapped in cloth; and act subtly in tying that around the broken bone so that there is no pain; and go with the binding according to the shape of the back several times, and tighten that decently with a strap; and consider the binding at all times, and when it becomes soft, tighten it.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if necessity requires the removal of that bandage or dressing, or swelling, or pain, or abscess that occurs in the place, then you cut and loosen that, and remove the plaster and correct what occurs through the mode of cure of the patient; and then return the plaster, if possible, to its former state; and tighten the binding so that it is healed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of ribs when they are broken.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Know that rib fractures do not occur except in large places that follow the back; and from their ends at the front, contriction does not occur to those except through what are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And cognition of it is not hidden from sensation by means of inquiry with the fingers.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration is that you unite the fracture with your fingers according to the possible mode, so that it is united according to its shape; and then plaster and tighten the broken bone with splints, if needed.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the rib fracture is declining to the internal parts, then the patient experiences vehement pain and puncturing, just as puncturing occurs in one who has pleurisy, and it causes difficulty in breathing, cough, and vomiting of blood; and this is difficult to cure.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And the Antics are ingeniously devised for that with many ingenious things.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And from them I say: place foods that generate inflammation and flatulence, so that the belly is inflated and extended, and the fracture is pushed to the external parts.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	But we should eat that so that it is not a cause to generate an abscess, if it has not occurred; and if it has occurred, then it helps.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And some of them say that it should be placed above the windpipe and that it should draw strength; and it is like reasoning, but nevertheless it is feared that the windpipe will send the superfluities to the place due to weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And some of them say: cover the site with wool that is already submerged in hot oil, and place powders between the ribs so that it is filled, and let the binding be made as round as you wrap it; and then the patient should be cured with pleurisy cure by food and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if it causes vehement constriction on the patient who cannot bear it, and the bone punctures the membrane with piercing pain, then fear for the patient; cover the site, cut open the broken rib, and place over it an instrument that conserves the heart, the remembrance of which is preceded, so that we may insert it into the bone with ease and extract it.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then tie the two lips of the wound, if it is large, with sutures, and cure it with plasters until it is healed.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if an abscess occurs within, then you cut and pour powders into rose oil and place it over the site, and let the patient be cured by that which occurs to the abscess within.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And he should be laid down on his side on which he sleeps so that it is healed.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of fractures of the spine and collarbone.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Sometimes it is a fracture of the bones of the collarbone, and it hurts them there and the joints of the spine.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And if it happens to someone and you want to know whether he will be healed or not, then consider that if you see the joints soft and stupified and dead, and they cannot move them nor tighten them, and when you press them with your fingers or puncture them with an awl and do not feel pain in those places, then know that it is not healed; and in some dispositions it is deadly.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if they hurt and you feel constriction in those places with the fingers or puncture, then know that the joint of the bone is saved and that the patient will recover with cure.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see the joints of the collarbone like this and want to know whether it will be healed or not, then consider the patient's feet.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	Then if you see that they are already soft and it happens to them what happened to the joints, and then when he lies on his back, he experiences windiness and involuntary urination, and sometimes he is laid on his back and wants to urinate but cannot, then know that it is deadly, and so you should not treat him.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	But if none of those happen, the cause is better and less distant.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the cure of him is that you pierce into the abscess that you place over the fractured joint with a dropper, using either rose oil solution or crushed beans; place it on several times throughout the day so that the abscess is soothed.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And then place one of the comforting and relaxing plasters, and tighten it with a strap; and order the patient to take rest and tranquility and not sleep on the side that hurts so that he is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if it occurs due to the joint of the bone being separated from him, then cut over the cord and let the bone rest; and then unite the two lips of the wound with sutures if it is large; and then cure it with something encrusted from within the gums, so that it is healed.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	But if it is the end of the bone of the hip joints and the end of the cloth, then insert your left index finger into the anus, and unite the broken bone with the other hand according to what is possible by the second mode; and then place a plaster and splint over it, if needed, and then tighten that.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if you feel broken tendons in him, then cut over it and hold it, and cure the wound with the cure that is preceded so that it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De restauracio de la ancha.	On the restoration of the shoulder joint.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the shoulder joints hurt when they are broken, and if they are broken, then their fracture is only a conjunction in their extremities, and they are inserted lengthwise and decline to the internal parts; and it hurts the patient in that place with piercing pain.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And the restoration of him is that you extend your hand over him so that it is over the fracture as is his shape.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is only in its extremity, then you unite it according to what appears to you by the second mode so that it is assembled into its natural shape.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	But if the fracture is in the leg or that which inclines towards the parts below, then you make the patient lie on his belly until he is prepared for the restoration of that fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And when you have bound that up, place a plaster on it, and also place a splint of wood or cane on it, and tighten it with a bandage so that there will be no puncturing of the fracture or removal of the splinter.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And fill the cavity with something that fills it up so that it assumes its normal shape, and command the patient to sleep on his back or on his side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	But if an abscess has occurred, then cease from its extension and restoration until the abscess is suppurated, and place on it something that promotes suppuration according to what has been mentioned before; then return to its restoration, and bind it tightly with a bandage in that way.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if the bones have become separated or splintered, then you treat them.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of the fracture of the hip.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The hip is what is between the armpit and the head of the shoulder.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is broken, then its restoration is in one of two ways, one of which is that you take a splint of the thickness of a finger according to this form:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And let there be holes at both ends of the two splints, and let it be suspended from an elevated point.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And let the patient lie on a chair; and let him extend his broken arm over the splint until he reaches the tip of it at the point where the curve of the splint is attached.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And let someone suspend some heavy weight over it, or the assistant extend the arm downward; and then the doctor applies pressure with his hands on both sides of the fracture until the fracture goes back into place according to how it should be.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other way is that the patient be laid on his neck and suspend his hand from his collar with a splint; and let the doctor command two servants, one of whom holds what is above the fracture with his hands, and the other holds below the patient's arm; and each of them extends to his own side.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, then you tighten with a splint on the fracture and another splint above it, and let each of the two servants extend to his side.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And if the fracture is near the end of the muscle, then it should be placed halfway on the tip and the other half below the fracture beyond the armpit.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	And similarly if the fracture is near the armpit, then let the splint be placed on that point and on the armpit.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Bind that up with ease and without pain, and then when it is bound according to how it should be and applied well, tighten it if an abscess does not occur.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	But if an abscess occurs, then cease from tightening it until the seventh day, and place on it soft wool soaked in wine and rose oil until the abscess drains; then you tighten it.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the way to tighten it is to place a plaster on the fracture, and then place a wrapping of new cloth over the plaster; and then lift up the arm on that hip, and place your open hand on his muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And let the cloth and arm rest on the hip so that the arm is in its natural place, unless some cause from the broken bone prohibits it.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	Then use splints.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And it is that you place on the fracture that splint which is wider and stronger than the others; and let there be between each splint the width of a finger, and let the length of the splints be according to the fracture with an addition of three fingers of all parts.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then tighten on the splints with the binding which is described at the beginning of the chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And let your binding on the site of the fracture be tighter.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And when the fracture is longer, then let the binding be shorter.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And so if you see the position of the splints and binding as we have said in the time when you are restoring the member to its natural position, then you do this:
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear an abscess, then you cease from tightening and splints for the seventh day as we have said.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And then consider the splint in all parts for three days so that nothing occurs at the point of pressure or inflammation, or that nourishment does not reach the member because of a surplus of binding; and then rectify all that according to what we have said.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	But if you are certain that nothing occurs of that, then do not loosen the ligature except after three or more days.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And let the patient sleep on his back, and let his hands be over his stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And place on the hip a poultice full of wool bound up, and consider all night or day that it is not loosened or dissolved nor the figure of the broken member altered, or that the binding be softened; then rectify all that with your skill.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	And let the patient' s food be according to the order which we have mentioned before, so that the food is subtle at the beginning until it is started being tightened; then let the food become coarser.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	The custom of the hip and the bed is that they are tightened for 40 days; then let them be loosened and a bath be administered, and it be anointed with ointments which rectify that.
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is laid open, then you do not loosen from it the binding and splints until 10 or 2 days.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	On the restoration of a broken arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm is made of two bones which are called two bones; one of which is small and is that which supports the finger, and the other is large and is that which is placed below the small finger from the part that is further away.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And usually it is only the larger bone or the smaller one that is broken.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when the small bone is broken above, then its restoration is easier, and its healing is easier.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when it is broken below, then the fracture of it is bad, and its healing is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And worse than that is when both bones are broken at the same time.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore, if the bone which is broken is the small bone above, then it is convenient for the doctor, in order to restore it, to place a little extension with ease so that it is bound up.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	But if the larger bone is broken, then let there be placed a more violent extension.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if both bones are broken at the same time, then let you place the most violent extension.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And let the figure of the hand be according to its restoration and its extension stretched out over a pillow, and let its wrist be above the parts, more above all the other fingers, and let the finger be below all the others, and let the patient lie on his back on a inclined pillow.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And let one pillow be in front of him at an angle or straight under him so that the patient does not strain himself.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	And then the assistant extends the arm of the part below with his hand or with a splint, and another assistant extends it above similarly.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	And then the doctor binds the bone so that he reduces it according to the best figure that he can.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if there are sores on the bones, then you must pierce through and reduce all pain in its place with your virtue.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	And if there appears on it a separate sore that punctures the cord and is not hopeful for its restoration, then you must cut over it and treat it according to the manner we have mentioned above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	But if the fracture is with pus, I have already made a particular chapter about it, and so take its cure from that.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	And if an abscess occurs at the beginning of your restoration, then you must line a cloth with ceratum made from rose oil and white wax, and let it be medium between thin and thick, and tie the tight cloth over that so that the abscess may yield; and then remove the ceratum and place an ointment prepared from moly powder with honey, and then place stelae; and let the stela which is placed over that fracture be more pus-laden and stronger.
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	And know that the number of the stelae on the arm is seen in the greater dispositions, or it is a fracture in one or two joints together.
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	And then place your compression over the site of the fracture more strongly and more fiercely, and when you see that the compression goes to the parts above the fracture or to the parts lower down on it, stop the compression a little softer according to how it is remembered in the beginning of the chapter.
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And the cloths which are wrapped over the fracture are to be soft moistened cloths, and not hard nor rough, and the thread with which it is tied must be of medium thickness between thin and thick, as we have recommended.
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	And consider the member and its ligament after a few days.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	And if there happens some cause for which a correction is necessary, such as a growth on the member, and then you see that you embrocate the member with warm water until that growth ceases.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	And let the member not be constricted while it rests, and then return the compression.

E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	And consider more if the nourishment is prohibited from coming to the member because of superfluity of compression, then cover that a little and let it be for a few days until the nourishment runs to that, and then tighten it.
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	But if none of those causes happen to the patient, then don't untie it until about twenty days or so from those.

And know that this fracture is restored in 30 days or around 32 days, or rather it is restored strongly in 28 days, and all that is according to the disposition of the complexities and dispositions of the virtue.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	Of restoration of fracture of the thumb and fingers.

Capitol .xiv.	Chapter 14.
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	Of restoration of fracture of the bone of the thigh.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The bone of the thigh many times is broken and is declared in feeling according to how it is converted to the part in front and to the highest.

Then place the bandage over it in such a way that there is no swelling or blistering or inflammation of the limb; and if any of those things happen for some reason, then remove it from him, and correct what happened entirely according to what we have said many times.

De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	Of the fracture of the heel and of the bones of the foot and of the toes.

E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	Then tighten that with the foot by bandage descending, since you have wrapped it with bands and other causes from which it needs.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And when three or four days have passed, then you loosen the ligament, for you will find the bones dislocated, or torn, or broken, and the operation on them is in that way known.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	But if any toes are torn, then restore them and dislocate them in the same way as you and put together to you in the restoration of the fingers of the hand.
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	Then place to the torn toe bandage according to the length of the toe, and let it be more inclined from him; and underneath the foot that table which you have recounted to me, and tighten that with bandage descending.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	But if what is torn from the bones are two or three or more, then you place on each toe a star of its quantity wrapped in linen, and tighten that table at the lowest part of the foot, and let it stand on one of the pegs of the table bore the belly of the foot so that the tongue has good retention.
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	And it is convenient for you to remember that you do not consider all the causes which have been mentioned to you in the other fractures of the accidents we have spoken about; and pause with each accident as it occurs.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	Of the fracture of the pubic bone and of the bone of the penis and of the virile member in man.
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the pubic bone is broken, then have that woman lie on her back, and tilt her pelvis slightly to one side, and let her hand be held behind her.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	And let the midwife fill the pubic region with cotton, and have the man's penis be made erect; and let the woman be shaken, and let her pelvis be raised little by little, for everything that is forgotten will come out before what is in front of the pubic bone, just as it was, and the broken bone will return.
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	And let powdered herbs be sprinkled over his back, and when he wants to urinate, wet the cotton with ease, and let him urinate; and reduce and return it according to the way in which you applied it at the beginning, and let him return to his first position.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And do this for seven days or around that, for that is restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you wish, take a bladder of sheep and insert into the wound of him a cannula of canvas; and put the whole bladder into his pubic region, and let the cannula be insufflated with vertigo so that the bladder is inflated inside the pubic region, for the fracture will return.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And let it be filled with cotton and stay for several days according to what we have recommended, until it is healed.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	And when the bone of the penis in man or woman is broken, then administer to its restoration and healing what we have recommended for the bone of the hip.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And what is straight is not hidden in these proximity fractures, and few understand it, especially those who have some study and understanding of this my book; for that fracture indicates to you in the greatest dispositions a direct way in its restoration and in its stricture, and therefore understand well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	But in the virile member of man when it is broken, take a walnut shell, and put the penis into that; and let powdered herbs be sprinkled over him, and let it be wrapped up, and let it be left for three days or around that, and let it be healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	Of the restoration of fracture of bones when they are swollen.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is convenient for him to whom fracture with swelling occurs, and especially if the bone is large like that of the thigh or the adductor, or similar to that, that you care for it and treat it immediately, if the conditions of phlebitis testify to you as we have said above.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the swelling flows with blood, then have you care for its retention in that way as you pulverize it over it with ground black thistle, if another cause is not present to you.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	And let the fracture be restored on that same day, and do not prolong it, unless swelling occurs.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	But if swelling occurs, then let you leave the restoration of it until the ninth day, so that the swelling may cease, and do not approach it on the third and fourth days, for you will make bad accidents occur.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	But if the broken bone is prominent over the uncovered tendon, then have you reduce it and bring it down by your hands with ease and with little extension.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	But if extension is not prepared for you and the equation of it by your hands, then let you reduce that by your hands with this instrument; and this instrument is made of iron, whose length is seven or eight digits, and its breadth according to the quantity of swelling; and it is necessary for the doctor to take one of these three or four according to the quantity which is needed in the cure in all kinds of fracture.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And let it be round and have little thickness so that it is not bent by the pressure upon it in the hour of operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And let its end be acute and its edges sharp; and let it be of a thick thickness above, and of the thickness of its middle within to the ends.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is the form of it:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And it is named in Greek "labro volentz atelarem", thus is palette little.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	So that let the acute end of it be elevated and paused over the prominent extremity of the bone.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And press it into a hollow so that the bone returns, and let it be bent with some equation.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And therefore force yourself to bend the ends of the fracture between them, and if the end of the broken bone is subtle, and does not take that instrument for a good perception, then have you insert the end of that bone so that the instrument has power of it.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	But if you cannot reduce the bone in all of what we have recommended, then insert that into that which is convenient to it among the inserts which we have said; or saw that with one of the saws in whatever way is possible for you.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And let you smooth that which is rough and jagged in the bone.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And when the bone is reduced, and therefore the reduction causes great pain to the patient, then know that the bone has not returned to its natural place; and therefore do that which you confer to the patient great benefit.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When you have completed your restoration which you do to the bone, then soak cloth in black wine, and especially if it is summer; and do not pause over the swelling ointment or other cause by which oil is made, so that swelling and decay do not occur in it.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And let you administer stars in the hour of your compliment of the restoration of the bone, and leave the swelling uncovered so that you insert the wound with tweezers and use bandages according to the quantity of the swelling.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And keep yourself in all caution so that you do not constrict the swelling with the fracture, for many times have been made by foolish doctors, and caused over their patients death or a rotting ulcer, thus is a wound.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if your constriction is long, soft, different from the constriction of other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	And if the swelling is great or it is bad, and you fear some evil accidents which we have recommended, and pain occurs in the place, then do not have you pause over that astelas, but do to that a covering of hard cloths in place of astelas and tighten it with those.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.
