And when after one or two days the swelling begins to come out, let there be engendered in it a bruise, then you stay above that cloth which you have put over it with wine, and therefore administer hot waters, in which medicines are usually applied to swellings, thus with tetrafarmacon and similarly to that.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	And it is convenient for you to loosen the bandage and consider the swelling every day morning and evening until it is consolidated and closed up, and let the member be prepared in such a way that the swelling runs from it to the ends below with ease.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If after several days the swelling does not become consolidated or it is not separated from it the bruise, then know that here are hidden small bones, so beware of the swelling with tent.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those small bones which are separated and extracted, those that are not separated from it and cause the member to ache, force yourself to insert them according to what is possible for you.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if it happens that the wound is infected with pus or becomes swollen, this indicates the presence of a foreign object, or another kind of corruption and putrefaction. In such cases, you must apply to the wound whatever treatment is appropriate, as described in the preceding chapter.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o .xxx.; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And regarding the object which caused the wound: when it is a large object that has penetrated deeply into the body and broken through the bone of the thigh or the rib cage, and resembles those objects found in the larger limbs, do not attempt to extract it, for its removal often leads to death. Instead, leave it there to fester, for it will usually fall out on its own within 20 or 30 days. And then treat the wound if you can see it; if not, leave it as is.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	On the treatment of nodules that appear on the site of a fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	This nodule often occurs on the site of a healed fracture, especially near the joints, and affects the shape of the limb; it strongly hinders the limb from performing its natural functions.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Therefore, if the nodule is recent, administer to it those medicines that have a styptic effect, such as aloe, myrrh, and gall-nut; take some or all of these, and prepare them with white wine, or vinegar, or sweet wine, and apply the mixture to the nodule using a piece of cloth, and bind it tightly in place.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And let the binding remain in place for several days without removing it; then loosen it and repeat the treatment, until the nodule is reduced in size; or press a piece of lead gently over it, since lead has the property of reducing anything that is swollen in the limbs.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if the nodule has already turned into a stone and it is causing pain, then split it at its highest point, and drain out the pus and any other fluid that has accumulated inside it; treat this wound so that it heals.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	On the restoration of a fracture when it is healed, and on the subsequent return of the limb to its normal condition, without any deformity.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a bone fracture is healed, and the limb regains its normal condition without any deformity, this happens due to several causes: one cause is excessive fluid retention in the ligament and the failure to properly bind it; another cause is excess swelling of the ligaments, preventing nourishment from reaching the limb; or excessive movement at an inappropriate time; or a deficiency of blood in the patient's body, or weakness.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	The treatment for this is to encourage the patient to eat and make their heart strong, so that blood flow is increased in them; administer a bath; and apply poultices of marjoram and lettuce over the affected area.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And then apply a poultice to the limb, so that it draws nutrients to the area; or continue to apply warm water to it, until the flow of nutrients is restored and the limb returns to its normal shape.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	On the treatment of fractured bones that are healed in a crooked position, and prevent them from returning to their normal condition.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When a healed bone is crooked and there is nodule formation, causing distortion in the shape of the limb, but the limb can still function normally, then you must not accept the word of someone who claims that this limb has recently been fractured.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	But there are some foolish doctors and surgeons who have performed this operation in our land, and it is a very reproachful practice, causing great fear, the sign of which is fatal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	But if the claudication and nodule are recent, then they should be bathed in tepid water containing soft herbs, such as mallows and plantain leaves, and mallow-root, and similar ingredients; or a poultice should be made with sweet almond oil, or with soap made from olive oil and white lead; or fat figures should be bound to the affected area using the feathers of a young pigeon, and similar remedies from among those mentioned earlier as consolidents.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And sometimes it is dissolved by continuous gentle friction with the hands that are moistened, and the limb should be moved to all sides at all times.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	But if the crookedness has progressed further and has become a stone, requiring treatment with iron, then the pus should be drained first, and the bone should be softened by dissolving any nodule with subtle incisions, and the area should be treated with gentle manipulation and attention.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23
De sermo en dislocacio.	On speech in dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the separation of a joint, causing the limb to be unable to move, and the shape of the limb is altered, bringing great pain and severe injuries to the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when a dislocation occurs, it must be reduced immediately and not delayed, for if it is delayed, the joint will become inflamed, and its reduction will then be very difficult.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And for that reason, it must not be bent or twisted during the process of reduction, for this often causes spasms and pain.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when this happens, the patient should be given a bath, and then the affected area should be left to rest until the swelling subsides; and the limb should be bathed in warm water with oil, and then reduced gently.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And every limb should be treated according to its location.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And I have already arranged the chapters on dislocation, following those on fracture, from the highest part of the body to the lowest.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	On the treatment of dislocation of the lower jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	The two jaws are dislocated if they do not meet; and their dislocation occurs in one of two ways: either they are displaced from their joints by a small amount, and are then slightly softened; or they are fully dislocated, causing them to be displaced at the joint where saliva flows from the patient' s mouth, and their teeth cannot meet, and their tongue is wrapped around their words.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But when their dislocation is slight, they usually return to their proper position for the most part, due to some minor cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is complete and full, then it must be reduced immediately, and not delayed in any way.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the minister should hold the patient's head, and the doctor should push one of his fingers into the root of the dislocation of the jaw inside the mouth, if it is dislocated on one side; or he should insert both of his fingers simultaneously, if it is dislocated on both sides, while the other fingers are wrapped around the outside; and command the patient to open his mouth and loosen the jaws.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if its reduction is difficult, and especially if both jaws are fully dislocated, then the jaw should be bathed in warm water with oil, so that their reduction is made easier, and their reduction should not be delayed at all, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And when they have returned and are engorged, and the mouth of the patient is closed and not loosened, then place on those powders of cloth a cerot, made of wax and rose oil; and it should be bound with gentle ligatures.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on his back, and his head should be between two pillows, so that he does not turn to the right or left; and do not force him to chew anything for any reason; while his food should be meat of a lion, until when the pains are relieved and the jaws are swollen, then he can do as he pleases.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this should be administered with gentleness, and he should not work hard or exert himself through speaking, eating, drinking, or opening his mouth wide, until the jaw is swollen and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if it is difficult to reduce both mandibles when they are dislocated at any time and not returned to their places, then often many complications arise, such as fever, constant sweating, the stomach of the patient becoming very hot, and vomiting pure cholera.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, then know that it is dangerous; and often the one who experiences this dies within ten days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	On the reduction of a dislocation of the collarbone and of the extremity of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The collarbone is not dislocated on the inside by its connection to the foot; and sometimes it is dislocated on the outside, and this is indicated by sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And its restoration is that the patient lies on his back and extends his arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	And then press the joint with your palm with a strong compression, for it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And then place on that an ointment and powders and strengthen that.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the extremity of that which is connected to the head and continued from it, is not dislocated at any time; then it must be reduced and engorged according to what we have said and according to how you are prepared.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And then place on that an ointment, powders, and a bandage, and command the patient to adhere to tranquility and rest until he is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And by this method of treatment, the extremity of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its joint.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the reduction of a dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, of which one is that it is dislocated at the nipple towards the bottom.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated above the muscle, and this happens rarely; and it is not dislocated at the back by the shoulder; and it is not dislocated in front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And mostly it is dislocated and exits outward at the bottom by the nipple, and mostly in those whose flesh is thin, it is dislocated easily; but in those in whom there is much flesh, it exits with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And often it happens to some men due to a blow or fall, and the muscle of them is pustularized by pustules, and is cured by that which has already dislocated it.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	So therefore know this while you are above him, and then proceed in his curing.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And the dislocation of it is known when it is at the bottom by the nipple; so that you distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the intact muscle, for you will see a marked difference between them; and you will see in the head of the muscle a concavity and below the nipple towards the touch of the head of the muscle as far as an egg, and the patient cannot reduce his hand to his ear, nor move that by any motion.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated above or below, and you will see a marked touch, and it is not hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And from this dislocation there is made an easy reduction when it is fresh and the patient is young.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And its reduction is that the minister raises his hand above; and then place your fingers below the nipple of him, and raise the joint with strength above to its place, and the minister raises his hand and extends that above; and then place that below so that it returns easily.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if by what we have said it does not return, and so from the beginning that the dislocation occurred, after many days, then know that the patient should be bathed in warm water and be administered embrocation which softens and lubricates as though his joints were razor-sharp, and fenugreek, and honey in water, and be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient should lie on his back and place below the nipple of him a pad of wool that is engorged between compression and relaxation, and then the doctor places his heel over the joint, and raises the head of the muscle with force, and pulls the hand of the patient so that it is not turned downward, and another minister holds the head of the patient so that it is not turned downward, for then that will return to its place at once.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, reduce it according to this manner: and it is that you make present a man who is longer than the patient, and stand on his side, and insert the muscle of him below the nipple of the patient and raise the nipple of him above while the patient is suspended in the air, and another minister pulls the hand of the patient from the bottom of his belly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is thin, then know that with him or another cause suspended, by gravity it returns at once.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced according also to another manner: and it is that there is placed on the ground a post whose head is rounded in shape, like mortar, which is not thick nor subtle, and then place below the patient; then place over the head of the post lion cloths, and let the patient stand according to the length of the post, and then extend his hand from the bottom of the other part with strength, for the joint returns to its place with speed.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult to reduce it by all the causes we have said, then use this cure: and it is that you take a post whose length is two cubits, and its width is four digits, and its thickness is separated in the nipple according to this form:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And then over the rounded head there are tied lion cloths so that the patient does not slide.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And then place below the nipple of the patient, and let his hand or arm be extended over the post to the bottom, and let the post be tied over the helper, and the arm and the extremity of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Then place the arm over a rung of a ladder according to its width, and let the hand be extended to the bottom, and let the other body be suspended from the other side, for the joint will return at once.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the instrument of him is completed according to any manner that it is possible for you, then know that you place below the nipple a pad of wool of equal quantity; and then place ointment prepared from ground moli with honey over all the muscle, as far as it is turned above, and then bind below the nipple with a bandage moderately tight; and let the bandage be turned over the ointment, and let his hand be joined to his neck, and let him be bound, and not moved his hand for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And once the patient's food has been reduced, as long as the member is comfortable, it is closer to being healed.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	Then food should be given in greater quantity and the patient exercised; if it is closed and not softened, then it is healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	But if the joint is dislocated many times due to moisture that happens to it or for some other reason, then three punctures should be made on it, as already mentioned in the chapter on cautery.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all this is done and after seven days the ligament is loosened and the joint not closed, and the poultice and the binding are removed from it several times, and it is not closed and the skin not closing and unable to lift that arm up towards the parts above, then know that its nerves which are at the head of the muscle are either severed or stretched or softened, and know that the joint will never return to its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	From the dislocation of that which is made from the foot and the breast or the parts behind, the reduction is made by impulsion and extension with the hands, until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And let the other binding be administered on that, and heal it as long as it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if the healing becomes heavy on the member and delayed in its movement, then let the patient take many baths until that heaviness is relieved and it returns to its first nature.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter .XXVII.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the curing of dislocation of the elbow.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	Know that the joint of the elbow is dislocated with difficulty and returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated to all parts, and especially to the front part from the back part, and its dislocation is not concealed from you because when you try to bend the dislocated elbow towards you or away from you depending on how it is dislocated, this will be made manifest to you, for the joint is hollowed out and cannot bend the arm or touch with that muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And if you see that the elbow is dislocated and you reduce the dislocation at once before it comes to an ulcerated wound, for if it comes to an ulcerated wound, its reduction is difficult, and most often it does not heal at all; and especially when it is to the back part, for it is worse than all other species of dislocation, and more painful, and many times leads to death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And its restoration, when it is possible to reduce, is that the hand of it be stretched with two hands, and the arm of it expanded, and the doctor's hands on the elbow and under it, and he pushes the joint together with his fingers or the root of his palm until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is to the front part, then it returns thus that he bends the hand with his hand, while striking the elbow with the root of his palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey reduction, then administer vigorous extension and great force.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And two ministers are to hold that joint while it is being extended so that it is not pulled back by the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And then let the arm be rotated on all sides, for it is wrapped in a long folded cloth over the hand or ligament.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint with his hand, he should smear it with some oil so that it causes the cause of the joint to be helped by ease of lubrication with facility; and then push the joint together with strong impulsion until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And then its reduction should be that the poultice in which it is wrapped with stiptic and astringent albumen of egg white, and it being tightened by descent binding, and the arm suspended from the neck, and let go for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then it should be loosened; and if the joint is formed in its place, then you loosen its binding and leave it.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see the joint not to be stronger, then you iterate the poultice and binding, and leave it for several days until it is tightened; and then loosen it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if it happens to it heaviness after the reduction of the joint, and its disposition is in movement, then administer moisture in bath and subtle friction, and compression, until it is relieved; or pause over the joint all-night-oil, as it is grease of motion; and then let it be bound, and leave that on the bone the day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then wash that off, and let him take a bath; and when he is bathed, you rub the joint with tempered friction, and then iterate over it all-night-oil, as it is rose-oil of motion, once, and the second, and the iii.a.,
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has already occurred on the nerve through the instrument of bathing, unless it was limited.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you want, pause over that cow's udder moistened with wine and heat over it; and do that several times, for that is moist and reduced to its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter .XXVIII.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the curing of dislocation of a mallet, that is of the joint which is between the arm and hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	The hand some times is dislocated, and the reduction of its dislocation is easier, but it is contrary with other joints; however, when there is swiftness in its reduction at the hour that it is dislocated, before the place becomes ulcerated or that an ulcerated wound occurs on it.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of its dislocation is that you place the joint of the mallet on a table and the minister extends the hand of him, and the doctor pauses his hand or his palm over the impendence of the joint, and pushes it until it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	But however, let it be considered if the palm is already turned to the belly of the hand, then the mallet should place both hands on a table because of extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is before the palm of the hand, then the position of the hand of him intrinsecly over the table, so that the hand of the doctor rests on that impendence of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And then if it returns at once, good; and if not, then loosen that with poultice, letting it go; and do not repeat that, for unless it passes on it days, you will not suffer nor be able to reduce it.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	But however, let the joint be reduced according to its tortuosity; and do not trouble the mallet for any cause, unless the hand is softened and not able to strengthen for any cause; then know that the nerves are severed or torn, and then it does not have strength in it except when it is tightened with cautery close to the joint of it and very often that confers no cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then when the mallet is returned, then pause on it the poultice which we have recommended, and let it be left and tightened for several days; and then loosen it and let the hand of him be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if its movement is stopped and any heaviness happens to it, then loosen that with water and with friction several times, until it is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter .XXIX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the curing of dislocation of the fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes they are completely displaced.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any of these fingers are dislocated on the back of the hand or on the belly, then press the finger and push out its dislocation with your thumbs, while returning it to its position.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	Then hold the head of the finger and suspend that part to which it is dislocated, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend it and extend it while straightening it on that day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when morning comes, apply that narrative again, and do not cease loosening it during the day and exercising with movement, and apply it at night; and do this for several days until it is tight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do this similarly if it is dislocated on the belly of the hand, and apply that narrative to that part and do your first operation with it until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do for when it is dislocated in other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Of the cure of dislocation of the vertebrae of the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When a complete dislocation occurs in any of the vertebrae of the back or neck and many vertebrae have left their places, then there is no cure for that, for death overtakes the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And the sign of this is that the patient's excrement escapes without their will, and they cannot retain it; and many times some members of them or both legs of them or both arms of them, or one of those, are deadened, because many times a vertebra has left its place and many times there is removal of those to four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	So that is already deadened in the back parts and is named paralysis.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But its cure is that then you consider if the paralysis occurred from youth, because in that there is no cure nor any healing of that at all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But in that which comes from falling or from beating or similarly to those, the Ancients have already described the methods of cure with a lengthy speech, of which the most returns with profit; but I and shorten that from which little excuse of it from its excess for me, because of my proximity to my intention my exposition, by which I have already exposed and formed from diverse instrument of that by which I will show and spread that.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in paralysis which occurs from the front part in the feet, there is no remedy nor healing of that; and similarly in that which is done to both sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those there is no cure except that which occurs properly in the back by that which I relate.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And it is that the patient be extended on his face over a pillow propped up near a wall, and be extended under him instrument wet so that his feet are not bound.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then a straight stick be placed, set in the ground at the end of the pillow around the head of him, and another stick in the air under his feet at the other end of the pillow.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the minister hold the stick, and it not be stopped in a pit; and another minister hold the other second that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then wrap around the head of the patient and under them tickle with a lion tail; and extend the end of the tail to the stick by which it is supposed the head of him, and apply that on him; and then tighten all the tails and apply those on the other stick by which it is supposed the feet of him.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then the ministers each extend the tail to the end of the stick, and not be deadened the two sticks and the tails in their locations in which they are placed, but nevertheless do not stop them as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor places his palms on the vertebra with strength until it returns, or that he places on a table, and then he adjusts over the table his feet until he returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if he does not return by this form, then take a table of which the breadth or the length is in the air at three arms' length, and dig into the wall of which we have said that it is near the patient a place in which between the end of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then place the middle of the table on the vertebra, and the doctor places his feet on the other end, and tighten so that the vertebra is cramped and returns to its location.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want, open by a turn which is wound with the hand; and it is that you place on the ground beneath the head of the patient at the end of the pillow two sticks, the length of which is one arm, and place the head of him in the end of the pillow two sticks; and let the length be between each stick one palm, and it is already made in each stick a hole in which turn, and each be very stopped on the ground so that it not be deadened.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And let there be a round stick in which is the turn, and it is wound in the two holes of the two sticks.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And in its end is a hole in which the stick is formed, the length of which is one palm by which it is wound; and in the two other sticks is similarly.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then tighten the tails which you have tightened on the feet of the patient in the hole by which it is supposed the head of him, and the tails which you have tightened on his thighs in the turn by which it is supposed the feet of him.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then each turn and stand a minister who twists the turn with his hand, and the doctor smooths the vertebra as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form of the turn:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And then when the vertebra has returned and the location is smoothed, then cover that with plaster of egg white, and then stop; and then place over the plaster a cloth of table of which the breadth is three fingers or more, and the length of it is quantity that takes up the location of the paralysis, and over the end of the vertebra its.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then let it be tied with a tail as we have said, and use the patient of subtle food until he is healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if any swelling remains in the location at the end of the healing, then cover that with medicines that soften and spread by administration of the table for a long time, which we have recommended; and it is administered in that location leaf of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And sometimes swelling occurs in the end of the vertebrae of the back, and it is seized by that dislocation; and it is that bone which already swells so that it not be made projection to him by this medicine, because strongly he will do to you occur death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of cure of hip dislocated.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscle do not deviate but dislocation only, and it does not occur to those that occur to the other joints of small removal and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the hip is dislocated according to four ways, because it is dislocated at the ends inside, or at the ends outside, or at the ends in front, or at the ends behind.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And most often it is dislocated at the ends inside, and seldom at the ends in front or at the ends behind.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of its dislocation at the ends inside is that when you press the healthy hip with the sick, it is longer and the tendon is more prominent than the healthy, and the patient cannot bend his leg because of the lengthening, and it is the location which they say the lengthening of the tendon causes apothema cauter, so that the head of the hip has already come here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of him to whom this dislocation happens is that his parts are bent outward, and that his accidents are contrary to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of him to whom dislocation happens in front is that he stretches his leg according to his ability, but still feels pain where there is pain; and if he attempts to walk and cannot go forward in front, and his urine is retained and his testicles are swollen, and he has difficulty walking on the ball of his foot.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of him to whom dislocation happens in back is that he cannot straighten his leg or bend the testicles forward, and his leg is shorter than the other, and the testicles are softened, and the head of the thigh points to that location.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But the reduction of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it has been long since it was contracted, and that you should not administer reduction to it, but only when it has been recently contracted; then there is no need for poultices.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But in him whose dislocation is recent, and is one of the four species of dislocation, then you go to that which turns the joint and extends it within and without, and from both right and left, for he will quickly return and does not need other treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this way, then you must prepare to extend the leg of him from the lowest part, or with his own hands, or by means of a bandage which is tied over the leg above the thigh; and another extends his hand of that one above the ankle so that he may put his fingers under the toes; and another tightens a lion skin around the root of the thigh, and let another minister hold the end of the lion skin.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And it should be extended either from within to the anus, or from behind to the navel.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And all of these should be extended in one sitting while the patient is elevated from the ground and his leg hangs down.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this species of extension is common to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And therefore if the dislocation returns with what we have said, it will be good; and if not, then it is necessary to all species that we speak of the proper treatment.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the proper reduction of it, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is within, let the patient be laid on his side; and then place the lion skin over the root of the thigh in that place between the head of the thigh and the location below the testicles; and then extend the lion skin above the ankle to the highest part of the breastbone.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another minister should take hold of his arms and press the thick part of the bad thigh and extend to the outside by violent extension, for it will return to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is the quickest cure by which that member is reduced compared to the other species.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if he is stubborn towards you and does not obey this species of treatment at all, then let his two feet be bound together with a strong bandage, quickly, over both balls and both thighs.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let the length of each of his parts be the quantity of four digits, and let the bad thigh be extended more than the other by a quantity of two digits.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And then let the bad leg be suspended over the head of the beam and be in the middle; and let its length from the ground be the quantity of two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And then command a strong young man to lessen the head of the thigh, and let another young man suspend it, and the other young man lessen the thigh with strength push, for the joint will return to its place with speed.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the proper reduction, when it is dislocated outside, let the patient lie on his back according to what we have recommended regarding the swelling; and let the lion skin be tightly applied over the bad thigh properly and over the feet of him.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And then let two beams be placed, one under his feet and the other under his head; and then let beams be placed close to the middle of the pile upon which dampened cloths are wrapped, so that the bad leg is not harmed by the beam being between his thighs, so that the extension below is not pulled.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And then each minister should extend to his part, and the doctor with his hand should direct the reduction according to the article.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if he obeys reversal, it will be very good; and if not, then pause over that diligently and in the way we have said regarding swelling so that he swells there.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But let the bad leg lie on his side quietly.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in front, then let the leg be extended quickly, and it is according to this narrative on the pile; and the doctor let the palm of his right hand rest over the testicles, and then tighten that with his other hand, and with that tightening let him extend that to the lowest part towards the navel.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is behind, then let the bad leg not be extended to the lowest part and let it be elevated above the ground; but let him lie on a hard cause, likewise as if his thigh is dislocated outside towards two beams according to what we have said about the sitting of him on two beams; and let him lie on his back and the lion skin be extended, likewise as we have said, no doubt.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And let compression be administered with a table over the location at which the joint goes.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Therefore when the reduction is complete according to what you have — and the sign of the reduction of him is not hidden from you, and it is that you extend two thighs, and when you see those bumps and the bad leg stretch its thigh and expand likewise without excuse, then know that the member according to which it has returned — and then you adjust two thighs and apply poultice and tighten with bandage thus so that the thigh is not bent in any of the parts; and let the bad leg rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then loosen the lion skin and the poultice, and compare one leg with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Then, if you see those bumps in truth, then know that the dislocation is already stopped, and then let the bad leg walk.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then return and poultice that, and tighten that according to your first extension, and let him rest for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then loosen that, and let him delay walking on it for several days, within which he is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter .xxxii.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of the cure of dislocation of the testicles.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The testicles are dislocated according to three ways, for it is dislocated outside and inside and below but not behind; and in front it is not dislocated.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation of him is that you command the bad leg to apply his thigh to his thigh; then know that the testicles are dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all his ways is that you make the bad leg straight, thus so that it extends its thigh, if it can above that; adhere your two arms to his face, and let him place his foot between his feet; and then let him adhere the testicles with your palms, and press those between your fingers over the testicles of him with strength, and another minister extend his foot thus so that the testicles return to their place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And a sign that the patient is improving is when their bed does not adhere to the mattress with effort.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then plaster that area and attach the bed to the mattress, then bind those areas with a bandage for three or four days, then loosen them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not let the patient walk for several days until they are healed and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if you cannot reduce the dislocation, then administer strong extension with instruments of which mention was made in the treatment of the hip.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the treatment of a dislocation of the talus.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The talus is sometimes dislocated by a small displacement and sometimes dislocated according to its completion; its dislocation can be made either within or without the parts.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And a sign of its dislocation is that you will see the talus swollen in the direction of the part to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the treatment for a small displacement of this is gentle reduction; it should be extended easily with the hands and bound until it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in the treatment of this when it is dislocated according to its completion, you should make the patient lie on his back; then have a strong servant pull firmly upward from behind at the patient's ankle in the middle of that location.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	Then you should have your right hand hold the foot of the highest part and your left hand hold the lowest part of the foot at the location of the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	Then pull the foot towards you with your right hand and twice with the left, then extend with the left; push the bottom of the foot with your right hand towards the bed in front of the thigh.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do this twice according to what we have told you.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Then push the bottom of the foot against the bed on the third attempt; then you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So if it returns in one or two attempts according to this method and you see the foot swelling, that is good; but if not, then repeat the operation, for it will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if you cannot reduce it by what we have commanded, then let the patient lie on his back on the ground, and tie a rope firmly to the ground, and place it between the patient's thighs; then you have wrapped a cloth around him so that he does not slide.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	Then let one servant hold the patient's thighs and another extend the foot with their hands or with an instrument they have placed over the neck of the foot; then each servant should extend against the other, and the rope be pulled between the patient's thighs so that his body is not drawn to the lower parts due to the extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	Then let the doctor hold the dislocation with his hands; then let another servant hold the healthy thigh at the lower parts, for the dislocation will return with ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And so when the dislocation returns and you see that it is healed by the reduction of it, then apply plaster and extend it with strong instruments, and bind the foot to the bed.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And beware of the nerves which are behind the talus, so that the instrument over it is not violent and does not strike it forcefully.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	Then leave it for two or three days; if the instrument softens, loosen it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	Then loosen it on the third day or fourth; then forbid the patient to walk for 40 days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if he is forced to walk within that space, it is not safe that the dislocation is not dissolved and ruined, and then what treatment is not received.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if an ulcer occurs to him, then you should administer in the healing of it what we have commanded before, in another place for treatment and brothy, so that it is heated.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter 34.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the treatment of dislocation of the toes of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Let that which is dislocated be swollen with little extension without effort; and that which is difficult, first be gentle.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in some part of the top of the foot, then let the patient lie on their back over something flat on the ground or on a table, and be lying as if they were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	Then you stand on your feet and place your foot over that which protrudes from the joints; then press that with your foot with force so that it returns; then see that it is already swollen and does not appear as a protuberance in that location.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	Then place under the bottom of his foot a board which covers all of the foot, to which are two ends, and then tighten that with decent and firm pressure for three days; then loosen it and let him rest from walking for several days so that it is relaxed and its reduction is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	On the species of dislocation which are made with splint or with fracture or with any other impression.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of those things happen and you are expert in the treatment of that and in the restoration of it, many times death succeeds.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And therefore you should not presume over the treatment of it, but that which is wise in the art, from long experience, merciful and compassionate, slow, not hasty or presumptuous; and use in the beginning of medicines which produce ulcers cauterized only, and let the patient go to divine judgement, unless you hope for salvation from destruction, with some relief of illness, and in which there appears some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then effort to make the reduction of it at the beginning of the cause, before it produces an ulcerated cauterized.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the member returns according as we want, then administer a regimen which yields an ulcerated cauterized and cures the splint with what is convenient for it from the dry ointments.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is with fracture and occurs in the bones separated, then you are expert at their binding, and do in that which we have said in the simple illnesses of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And beware and avoid according to your strength that of the instrument in ways of fear according as you are preceded by my prediction; for that is better for you to your Creator, and more permanent to your glory, and more healthy to see those in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus end the words of Albucasis perfectly of which God be blessed.
Amen.	Amen.
